original: zag pa med pa'i las ni srid pa'i chus ma bran pas rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i las ni srid pa'i chus ma bran pas rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Uncontaminated karma does not have karmic maturation because it is not moistened by the water of existence.

original: rnam pa gsum po zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase the three kinds is stated.

original: rnam par smin pa las ltar shin tu sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni las sna tshogs pa ltar rnam par smin pa yang sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las ltar shin tu sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni las sna tshogs pa ltar rnam par smin pa yang sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the maturation of karma is extremely diverse means that just as karma is diverse, so too is its maturation.

original: 'jig rten ma lus pa khyab pa yang zhes bya ba ni las dang rnam par smin pas 'jig rten ma lus pa la khyab pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma lus pa khyab pa yang zhes bya ba ni las dang rnam par smin pas 'jig rten ma lus pa la khyab pas so //
translated: The phrase it pervades the entire world means that karma and its maturation pervade the entire world.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang rab tu dbye ba la sogs pa thams cad yongs su mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni las dang rnam par smin pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang dbye ba rab tu mkhyen pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras dus la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang rab tu dbye ba la sogs pa thams cad yongs su mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni las dang rnam par smin pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang dbye ba rab tu mkhyen pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras dus la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase he knows everything about their nature, their classification, and so on means that he knows the nature and classification of karma and its maturation, and the word and so on includes his knowledge of time and so on.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for this,🔽he says,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: as it is said.

original: las rnams zhes bya ba ni phyag byed pa la sogs pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: las rnams zhes bya ba ni phyag byed pa la sogs pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams so //
translated: “Actions” are virtuous and nonvirtuous actions such as worship.

original: las yang dag par blangs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sdom pa ma yin pa dag gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: las yang dag par blangs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sdom pa ma yin pa dag gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: “The undertaking of actions” is included in the unwholesome vows.

original: gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yul gang du las gang byas pa dang / las kyi rgyu gang yin pa dang / las kyi rang bzhin dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yul gang du las gang byas pa dang / las kyi rgyu gang yin pa dang / las kyi rang bzhin dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “The place” and so forth refers to the place where an action is performed, the cause of the action, the nature of the action, and the maturation of the action.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa shin tu sna tshogs pa nyid mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa shin tu sna tshogs pa nyid mkhas pa yin te /
translated: “The wise” are those who are skilled in the various maturations.

original: 'di yang yul can gyi sgo nas yul bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yul can gyi sgo nas yul bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is also a teaching of the object from the perspective of the subject.

original: mkhas pa nyid kyis rnam par smin pa shin tu sna tshogs pa nyid mkhyen pas so //
analyzed: mkhas pa nyid kyis rnam par smin pa shin tu sna tshogs pa nyid mkhyen pas so //
translated: The wise know the various maturations through their wisdom.

original: dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba nyid ces bya ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba nyid ces bya ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Arising from virtuous causes” means being endowed with causes such as nonattachment.

original: dge ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni chags pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni chags pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Free from virtue” means free from nonattachment, etc.

original: dge ba'i rgyu 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba skye ba'i bag chags 'jog par @340a * //🔽'gyur ba'o // las yang dag par blangs pa gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba skye ba'i bag chags 'jog par @340a * // 'gyur ba'o // las yang dag par blangs pa gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The cause of virtue” means the cause of the arising of virtue, which is the placement of the latent impressions of the arising of virtue.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //🔽mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o // mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The action that is taken up” means such things as killing.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: “Arisen from the cause of nonvirtue” means arisen from the cause of attachment, etc.

original: dge ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //🔽mi dge ba'i rgyu 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o // mi dge ba'i rgyu 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Free from virtue” means free from nonattachment, etc.

original: mi dge ba'i bag chags 'jog par 'gyur ba'o //🔽las yang dag par blangs pa gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i bag chags 'jog par 'gyur ba'o // las yang dag par blangs pa gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The cause of nonvirtue” means the cause of the latent impressions of nonvirtue.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: “The action that is taken up” means such things as meditation.

original: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: “Conducive to decline” means conducive to the arising of the afflictions.

original: gang gi dbang gis 'og mar ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis 'og mar ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is that by which one falls to a lower stage.

original: gang khyad par gyi cha dang mthun par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gang khyad par gyi cha dang mthun par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: That which is conducive to distinction is that which is conducive to attaining a lower stage.🔽In the same way, each should be understood in terms of its concordant category.

original: de bzhin du re re zhing phyogs mthun pa la shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa las nyams pa'i cha dang mthun par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa las khyad par gyi cha dang mthun par 'byung bar mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du re re zhing phyogs mthun pa la shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa las nyams pa'i cha dang mthun par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa las khyad par gyi cha dang mthun par 'byung bar mkhyen pa'o //
translated: This refers to knowing that in the past, present, and future, that which is conducive to decline arises from that which is conducive to decline, and that which is conducive to distinction arises from that which is conducive to distinction.

original: sbyor ba chung ba zhes bya ba ni kun slong gi sems chung bas bslangs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba chung ba zhes bya ba ni kun slong gi sems chung bas bslangs pa'o //
translated: Small application means that which is motivated by a small attitude.

original: sbyor ba rgya che ba 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni kun slong gi sems chen po slong bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rgya che ba 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni kun slong gi sems chen po slong bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Great application means that which is motivated by a great attitude.

original: rtsom pa chung la zhes bya ba ni zhing khyad par can la las chung du byas pa'o //🔽khyad par chen po 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsom pa chung la zhes bya ba ni zhing khyad par can la las chung du byas pa'o // khyad par chen po 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Small effort” means that one performs a small action in a special field.

original: 'bras bu chen po nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Great distinction” means that it becomes a great result.

original: rtsom pa chen por 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni zhing dman pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i las chen po rtsom pas so //
analyzed: rtsom pa chen por 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni zhing dman pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i las chen po rtsom pas so //
translated: “Great effort” means that one performs a great action of generosity, etc. in an inferior field.

original: khyad par du 'gyur ba chung ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gyur ba chung ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Small distinction” means that it has a small result.

original: nyan thos kyi rgyu 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying rje la ma ltos pa'i las kyis dus ji srid pa'i nyan thos kyi rigs stod par byed pas so //🔽rang sangs rgyas nyid dang zhes bya ba ni spobs pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rgyu 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying rje la ma ltos pa'i las kyis dus ji srid pa'i nyan thos kyi rigs stod par byed pas so // rang sangs rgyas nyid dang zhes bya ba ni spobs pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu 'byin pa'o //
translated: “Causing the lineage of the śrāvaka to emerge” means that one causes the lineage of the śrāvaka to emerge through actions that do not rely on compassion.🔽“Causing the lineage of the pratyekabuddha to emerge” means that one causes the lineage of the pratyekabuddha to emerge through actions that are not accompanied by skillful means.

original: rgyu 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi rigs stod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi rigs stod pa'o //
translated: “Causing the lineage of the Buddha to emerge” means that one causes the lineage of the Buddha to emerge through actions that are accompanied by skillful means.

original: da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni bya dka' bas so //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni bya dka' bas so //
translated: That which is painful in the present is so because it is difficult to do.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnam par smin pa bde bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnam par smin pa bde bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: That which will have a pleasant ripening in the future is so because it will experience the result of a happy rebirth.

original: da ltar byung ba na bde la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na bde la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is pleasant in the present is so

original: @340b ma byin par len pa la sogs pa da ltar gyi dus na bde ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
analyzed: @340b ma byin par len pa la sogs pa da ltar gyi dus na bde ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
translated: because it has the nature of being pleasant in the present time of taking life, etc.

original: ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which will have a painful ripening in the future is so

original: ngan 'gro'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it will experience the result of a miserable rebirth.

original: las gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las so //
analyzed: las gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las so //
translated: That which is karma is so because it is past karma.

original: rgyu gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i dus kyi rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i dus kyi rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is a cause is so because it is a cause in the present time.

original: rnam par smin pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: That which is a ripening is so because it has the characteristic of being experienced as pleasure or pain.

original: de kho na zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni gzhan ma yin pa la brten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni gzhan ma yin pa la brten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of “just that” is “based on what is not other.”

original: stobs gsum po bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs gsum po bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the three powers,

original: da ni mos pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni mos pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: now, the verse beginning with “various aspirations” is stated.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang de bzhin du dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang de bzhin du dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis te /
translated: Through the power of desire, hatred, delusion, and likewise faith, etc.,

original: sa bon gyi stobs kyis dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog tu gyur pa'i mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa gzhan mngon du rgyu bas bsgribs pa yang mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o
analyzed: sa bon gyi stobs kyis dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog tu gyur pa'i mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa gzhan mngon du rgyu bas bsgribs pa yang mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o
translated: whatever is inferior, middling, or superior is the aspiration that is known even when obscured by the manifestation of other afflictions. That is called the power of knowing various aspirations.

original: // dus gsum 'gro ba ma lus khyab pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi sems can gyis mos pa'i yul can yin pas so //
analyzed: // dus gsum 'gro ba ma lus khyab pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi sems can gyis mos pa'i yul can yin pas so //
translated: “Pervading the three times and all beings” means that it is the object of aspiration of beings in the three realms.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: 'dir 'dod chags zhe sdang la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir 'dod chags zhe sdang la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: here desire, hatred, etc. are stated.

original: 'dod chags kyi sgra ni nyon mongs pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras dge ba'i phyogs 'dzin pas 'dod chags kyi sgra ni nyon mongs pa nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi sgra ni nyon mongs pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras dge ba'i phyogs 'dzin pas 'dod chags kyi sgra ni nyon mongs pa nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The term “passion” is used to illustrate the afflictions.

original: 'byung ba'i sgras sa bon brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgras sa bon brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The reason why the term “arising” refers to seeds is stated:

original: 'byung ba'i sgras ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgras ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The term “arising” refers to the seeds of the afflictions.

original: de las gzhan gyis chos kun du spyod pas bsgribs pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang kun du spyod pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'dod pa la bsgribs su zin kyang ngo //🔽sems can gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gang zag khas mi len pa rnams la ltos nas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyis chos kun du spyod pas bsgribs pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang kun du spyod pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'dod pa la bsgribs su zin kyang ngo // sems can gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gang zag khas mi len pa rnams la ltos nas so //
translated: “By others” means by those who are dominated by hatred, even though they are obscured by passion, etc.

original: gang zag gzhan rnams kyang zhes bya ba na gang zag khas len pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan rnams kyang zhes bya ba na gang zag khas len pa la ltos nas so //
translated: “Other sentient beings” refers to those who do not accept the existence of a person.🔽“Other persons” refers to those who accept the existence of a person.

original: mos pa du ma zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni mos pa sna tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa du ma zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni mos pa sna tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of “many inclinations” is “various inclinations.”

original: 'dod chags la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kun du spyod @341a * //🔽pa dngos su yod pas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kun du spyod @341a * // pa dngos su yod pas so //
translated: “ Abiding in attachment” is the actual practice of attachment.

original: zhe sdang la mos pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis yongs su bsgribs pa'i zhe sdang la mos pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la mos pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis yongs su bsgribs pa'i zhe sdang la mos pa'o //
translated: “ Inclination toward aversion” is the inclination toward aversion that is obscured by attachment.🔽The same should be applied to the others.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'byor pa chung la zhes bya ba ni 'byor pa med pas sbyin pa la sogs pa dman pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'byor pa chung la zhes bya ba ni 'byor pa med pas sbyin pa la sogs pa dman pa'o //
translated: “ Small resources” means that one is inferior in generosity, etc. because one does not have resources.

original: bsam pa rgya chen po la mos pa dang zhes bya ba ni ser sna dang bral ba'i sems so //
analyzed: bsam pa rgya chen po la mos pa dang zhes bya ba ni ser sna dang bral ba'i sems so //
translated: “ Inclination toward a vast attitude” is the mind free from avarice.

original: sbyar ba rgya che la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyar ba rgya che la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Vast application” is

original: sbyin pa chen po gtong bas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po gtong bas so //
translated: the giving of great generosity.

original: bsam pa chung ba la mos pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis gtong bar mi nus pas so //
analyzed: bsam pa chung ba la mos pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis gtong bar mi nus pas so //
translated: “ Inclination toward a small attitude” is the inability to give mentally.

original: khyad par la gnas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par la gnas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “They will abide in the distinctive” means they will attain the state of a Buddha.

original: chung ngu la gnas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chung ngu la gnas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “They will abide in the lesser” means they will attain the state of a śrāvaka, and so on.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i khams ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos ston kyang rung mi ston kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i khams ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos ston kyang rung mi ston kyang rung ste /
translated: The element that is destined for perfect enlightenment is such that, whether or not the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma,

original: rnam par grol bar rung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar rung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: it is capable of being liberated.

original: de yang dus ji srid pa la ltos nas yin gyi gzhan du na log pa nyid du nges pa'i khams la 'jog par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dus ji srid pa la ltos nas yin gyi gzhan du na log pa nyid du nges pa'i khams la 'jog par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is because it depends on time. Otherwise, it would be reasonable to posit the element that is destined for perdition.🔽The element that is destined for perdition is such that, whether or not the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma,

original: de la log pa nyid du nges pa'i khams ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan kyang rung mi bstan kyang rung ste grol bar mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: de la log pa nyid du nges pa'i khams ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan kyang rung mi bstan kyang rung ste grol bar mi rung ba ste /
translated: it is incapable of being liberated.

original: de yang dus ji srid pa la ltos nas yin gyi gzhan du na sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can du mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: de yang dus ji srid pa la ltos nas yin gyi gzhan du na sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can du mi rigs pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is in relation to the duration of time, otherwise, since all sentient beings possess the essence of the Tathāgata, it would not be tenable.

original: log pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Those who are determined in error, etc., are the opposite of the former.

original: ma nges pa la zhes bya ba ni gang rkyen gyi stobs kyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma nges pa la zhes bya ba ni gang rkyen gyi stobs kyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur la /
translated: Those who are undetermined are those who will become liberated through the power of conditions,

original: gzhan du ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin pa ste /
translated: but not in any other way.

original: de yang dus ji srid pa la ltos nas yin gyi thams cad rigs gcig yin pas so //
analyzed: de yang dus ji srid pa la ltos nas yin gyi thams cad rigs gcig yin pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is in relation to the duration of time, since all are of one kind.

original: stobs bzhi pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir da ni khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stobs bzhi pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir da ni khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the four powers, now, the variety of elements is taught, beginning with “the eye, etc.”

original: mig sogs dag gis zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mig sogs dag gis zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The “eye, etc.” refers to the eye element, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa'i khams dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa'i khams dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The term “etc.” includes the form element, etc., and the earth element, etc.

original: rang bzhin gang zhes bya ba ston pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhes bya ba ston pa nyid do //
translated: The “nature” is just what is taught.

original: de zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That is the nature which has the characteristic of emptiness.

original: khams kyi rnam par dbye ba mkhas rnams kyis //
analyzed: khams kyi rnam par dbye ba mkhas rnams kyis //
translated: The wise ones are skilled in the divisions of the realms.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi khyad par de stong pa nyid kyi bye ba la mkhas pa @341b nyid do ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi khyad par de stong pa nyid kyi bye ba la mkhas pa @341b nyid do ;
translated: This is the special Buddhahood, which is skilled in the divisions of emptiness.

original: / rnam kun khams kyi khyad par la 'jug ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid thugs su chud pas so //
analyzed: / rnam kun khams kyi khyad par la 'jug ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid thugs su chud pas so //
translated: Engaging in the distinctions of the realms in all aspects means that by realizing emptiness in all aspects,

original: mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni khams thams cad la khyab pas so //
analyzed: mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni khams thams cad la khyab pas so //
translated: it is infinite, because it pervades all realms.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, nature and so on.

original: nang stong pa nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In inner emptiness and so on,

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: the word and so on includes outer emptiness and so on.

original: rab tu dbye ba du mar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shu rab tu dbye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba du mar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shu rab tu dbye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It becomes a manifold division means that it becomes a twentyfold division.

original: khams mtha' dag gi rab tu rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams mtha' dag gi rab tu rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Skill in the complete classification of the elements🔽 is the knowledge of the classification of the elements of the aggregates, etc.🔽

original: stong pa nyid kyi dbye ba mtha' dag la mkhas pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dbye ba mtha' dag la mkhas pa nyid do //
translated: Skill in the thorough differentiation of all the elements means skill in the entire differentiation of emptiness.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for that, he says

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said...

original: de la mig gi khams nang stong pa nyid du rab tu shes shing gzugs kyi khams phyi stong pa nyid du rab tu shes la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams phyi nang stong pa nyid du shes te ;
analyzed: de la mig gi khams nang stong pa nyid du rab tu shes shing gzugs kyi khams phyi stong pa nyid du rab tu shes la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams phyi nang stong pa nyid du shes te ;
translated: Therein, the eye element is thoroughly known as inner emptiness, the form element is thoroughly known as outer emptiness, and the eye consciousness element is known as the emptiness of both inner and outer.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa dang / phyi'i gzugs la brten nas skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa dang / phyi'i gzugs la brten nas skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and so forth and external form,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi dang nang gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi dang nang gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: the eye consciousness is included in the inner and outer.

original: de bzhin du khams bco brgyad car yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams bco brgyad car yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Similarly, all eighteen elements means that the eighteen elements are included in the inner and outer.

original: rna ba dang sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa nas yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar rnams stong pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa nas yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar rnams stong pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The ear, sound, and ear-consciousness, up to the mind, mental objects, and mind-consciousness are known as emptiness.

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni chu la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni chu la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The elements of earth, etc., are known as such. The word “etc.” includes water, etc.

original: nam mkha'i khams ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha'i khams gdod ma nas skye ba med pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa'i khams kyang rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha'i khams gdod ma nas skye ba med pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa'i khams kyang rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: Just as the space element is primordially unborn, so the elements of earth, etc., are known.

original: yongs su brtags pa las yang dag par 'byung bar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis khams rnams byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa las yang dag par 'byung bar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis khams rnams byung ba yin gyi /
translated: They arise from imagination. Imagination is the cause of the elements.

original: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: They do not exist ultimately.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do //
translated: The compounded elements are all compounded things.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba'i mtshan nyid can du zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos 'di rnams mngon par 'du bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba'i mtshan nyid can du zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos 'di rnams mngon par 'du bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase “characterized by the process of composition” means that these conditioned entities are composed, that is, they are established from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid can rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid can rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: This is the understanding that one gains.

original: bcos ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcos ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are fabricated,

original: 'di la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
translated: they do not have an intrinsic nature.

original: zhes bya ba rab tu shes pa'o //🔽'dus ma byas kyi khams @342a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rab tu shes pa'o // 'dus ma byas kyi khams @342a * //
translated: This is the understanding that one gains.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase “the unconditioned element” refers to the reality of dharmas, etc.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can du'o zhes bya ba ni sus kyang ma byas pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can du'o zhes bya ba ni sus kyang ma byas pa nyid du ste /
translated: The phrase “characterized by the absence of the process of composition” means that they are not created by anyone.

original: des na gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid du rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: des na gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid du rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because they are not produced from the beginning, they are understood to be emptiness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase “the element of affliction” refers to the afflictions of desire, etc.

original: glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid can du'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir nam mkha' la sprin bzhin du glo bur ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid can du'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir nam mkha' la sprin bzhin du glo bur ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: It is characterized by adventitious afflictions, because it is to be understood that, like clouds in the sky, they are adventitious, since suchness is naturally luminous.

original: rnam par byang ba'i khams zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i khams zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The “realm of purification” is characterized by suchness.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can du zhes bya ba ni de nam mkha' la sprin bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma gos pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can du zhes bya ba ni de nam mkha' la sprin bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma gos pas so //
translated: It is characterized by natural luminosity, because it is uncontaminated by afflictions, like clouds in the sky.

original: 'khor ba'i khams zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i khams zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The “realm of saṃsāra” is characterized by going from one life to another.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid can du'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid la ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'jug pa'i mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid can du ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid can du'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid la ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'jug pa'i mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid can du ste /
translated: It is characterized by the ignorance of non-reflection, because it is characterized by the non-understanding of the suchness of things, as they are.

original: 'khor ba ni mi shes pa las byung ba yin gyi 'di la rang bzhin 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni mi shes pa las byung ba yin gyi 'di la rang bzhin 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Samsara arises from ignorance, but it does not have any intrinsic reality at all.

original: tshul bzhin rig pa'i mtshan nyid can du'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin rig pa'i mtshan nyid can du'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The characteristic of the knowledge of reality is the characteristic of the thorough knowledge of the reality of things just as it is.

original: de'i gnas skabs na dngos po gang gi yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pas de yang stong pa nyid du rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs na dngos po gang gi yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pas de yang stong pa nyid du rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: Since at that stage one does not observe the intrinsic reality of any thing, one thoroughly knows that as emptiness.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the summary, he says, “Thus, etc.”

original: gnas pa'i khams gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa nas 'dus byas kyi khams kyi bar rnams gnas pa'i khams yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i khams gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa nas 'dus byas kyi khams kyi bar rnams gnas pa'i khams yin te /
translated: That which is the element of abiding, from the eye, etc., up to the compounded element, is the element of abiding,

original: der 'jig rten gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'jig rten gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the world abides there.

original: thob pa'i khams gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi khams te /
analyzed: thob pa'i khams gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi khams te /
translated: That which is the element of attainment is the uncompounded element.

original: thams cad de kho na nyid la thim par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: thams cad de kho na nyid la thim par 'gyur bas so //
translated: because everything dissolves into thatness.

original: sbyor ba'i khams gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i khams dag ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i khams gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i khams dag ste /
translated: That which is the element of application is the elements of affliction and purification.

original: de dag la spong ba dang mngon du bya ba'i ched du sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la spong ba dang mngon du bya ba'i ched du sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: One applies oneself to them in order to abandon and manifest them.

original: rten gyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ste /
analyzed: rten gyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ste /
translated: The element of support is samsara and nirvana.

original: de dag la snying rje dang shes rab kyi stobs kyis @342b brten pas so //
analyzed: de dag la snying rje dang shes rab kyi stobs kyis @342b brten pas so //
translated: One supports oneself in them through the power of compassion and wisdom.

original: stobs lnga pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs lnga pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the fifth power,

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽kun du rtog sogs ches rno zhes bya ba ni kun du rtog pa dang dad pa la sogs pa chen po nyid do //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / kun du rtog sogs ches rno zhes bya ba ni kun du rtog pa dang dad pa la sogs pa chen po nyid do //
translated: he says, “Now, the bodhisattva who is in the stage of the Joyful One, etc.”🔽“The sharpness of imagination, etc.” refers to the greatness of imagination, faith, etc.

original: mchog bzhed pa zhes bya ba ni gang chen por gyur pa de la mchog gi sgra brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mchog bzhed pa zhes bya ba ni gang chen por gyur pa de la mchog gi sgra brjod pa'o //
translated: “The one who is called the supreme one” is the one who is called the supreme one because he is the great one.

original: 'bring gnas skabs dang rdul nyid mchog min par bshad dang zhes bya ba ni chung dang 'bring la mchog ma yin pa'i sgras brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring gnas skabs dang rdul nyid mchog min par bshad dang zhes bya ba ni chung dang 'bring la mchog ma yin pa'i sgras brjod pa'o //
translated: The small and medium are expressed by the word non-supreme.

original: mig la sogs pa dang phan tshun bsgrub nus thub pa la zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba la sogs pa dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / mig dang sogs pa rnams phan tshun rgyu nyid du bsgrub nus par rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang phan tshun bsgrub nus thub pa la zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba la sogs pa dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / mig dang sogs pa rnams phan tshun rgyu nyid du bsgrub nus par rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mutual establishment of the eyes, etc. is the conception that the twenty-two faculties such as the eyes, ears, etc. are mutually established as causes.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: kun du rtog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Conception, etc.”

original: yang dag pa ma yin par lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun du rtog pa'i ming gi rnam grangs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun du rtog pa'i ming gi rnam grangs bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Unreal imagination” is a synonym for conception.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pas so //
translated: Because of superimposing an unreal entity.🔽In order to teach that conception itself is the faculty,

original: kun du rtog pa nyid dbang po yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa nyid dbang po yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: he says, “The faculty of conception is the mind.”

original: kun du rtog pa ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Imaginations means🔽that it is the ruler of the generation of attachment and so on. Since it is the🔽meaning of the ruler of the sense faculties, the imagination of what is unreal

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed pa la mnga' bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i bdag po'i don yin pas yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la dbang byed pas na dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed pa la mnga' bdag nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i bdag po'i don yin pas yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la dbang byed pas na dbang po'o //
translated: is a sense faculty because it rules over attachment and so on.🔽Those that are

original: dge ba'i rgyu can rnams zhes bya ba ni chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu can rnams zhes bya ba ni chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: the causes of virtue are those that are the causes of attachment and so on.🔽The

original: phul du byung ba zhes bya ba ni chen po'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: phul du byung ba zhes bya ba ni chen po'i gnas skabs so //
translated: highest means the state of greatness.🔽The twenty-five sense faculties have

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa lnga ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa lnga ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: already been explained.

original: phan tshun 'bras bu bsgrub par nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo thugs su chud pa la zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la rna ba'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i nus pa yod pa dang / rna ba'i dbang po la yang mig gi dbang po'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i nus pa yod do snyam du rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu bsgrub par nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo thugs su chud pa la zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la rna ba'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i nus pa yod pa dang / rna ba'i dbang po la yang mig gi dbang po'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i nus pa yod do snyam du rtogs pa la'o //
translated: The phrase having understood the essence that is able to accomplish each other's effect means that the eye faculty has the ability to accomplish the effect that has the characteristic of the ear faculty, and the ear faculty also has the ability to accomplish the effect that has the characteristic of the eye faculty.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for that,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, As it is said... and so on.

original: dbang po'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid do //
translated: The sequence of faculties refers to the lesser, middling, and greater states of the faculties such as faith.

original: mthar song ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni rab tu 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthar song ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni rab tu 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of having gone to the end is having become excellent.

original: 'dod chags dang @343a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang @343a * //
translated: Attachment and aversion refers to the faculties of pleasure and pain.

original: zhes bya ba dang gti mug bcos ma skye ba zhes bya ba ni sa bon rgyas pa ma yin pa dang ldan par skyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang gti mug bcos ma skye ba zhes bya ba ni sa bon rgyas pa ma yin pa dang ldan par skyes pa'o //
translated: The phrase “arisen from a counterfeit form of delusion” refers to the form of delusion that is not accompanied by a fully developed seed.

original: sprel zhing zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa ste res 'ga' 'dod chags la sogs pa skye zhing res 'ga' zhe sdang dang / res 'ga' gti mug skye ba'o //
analyzed: sprel zhing zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa ste res 'ga' 'dod chags la sogs pa skye zhing res 'ga' zhe sdang dang / res 'ga' gti mug skye ba'o //
translated: The phrase “in a mixed manner” means that they are not mixed, because sometimes desire and the other mental afflictions arise, sometimes hatred arises, and sometimes delusion arises.

original: tshar gcad pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngon du rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshar gcad pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngon du rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase “in a defeated manner” means that they arise in a manner that is not conducive to the spiritual life.

original: dbang po gang dag dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang // zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po gang dag dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang // zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “those faculties that have arisen from a virtuous cause” refers to faith, etc., that have arisen from nonattachment, etc.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung la zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang gis nges par 'byung bas na //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung la zhes bya ba ni / gang gis nges par 'byung bas na //
translated: The phrase “those that have arisen from a cause that is conducive to deliverance” means🔽that which is conducive to deliverance is the path.

original: nges par 'byung ba ste lam yin la de las byung ba'i dad pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ste lam yin la de las byung ba'i dad pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those faculties that have arisen from that cause are faith, etc.

original: dbang po rnams phan tshun rgyu nyid du bstan pa ni dbang po gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams phan tshun rgyu nyid du bstan pa ni dbang po gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The explanation of the faculties as being mutually causes is stated by “whatever faculty” and so on.

original: dbang po gang rna ba'i dbang po 'jog pa zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po gang rna ba'i dbang po 'jog pa zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “Whatever faculty” should be applied to “the ear faculty.”

original: rna ba'i dbang po ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the ear faculty?

original: mig gi dbang po'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is stated: “arisen from the cause of the eye faculty.”

original: sgra thos pa la lta bar 'dod pa byung ba'i dus dang / gzugs mthong ba la sgra thos par 'dod pa 'byung ba'i dus lta bu ste /
analyzed: sgra thos pa la lta bar 'dod pa byung ba'i dus dang / gzugs mthong ba la sgra thos par 'dod pa 'byung ba'i dus lta bu ste /
translated: When one who wishes to see arises, or when one who wishes to hear sound arises, the eye faculty is the cause of the ear faculty.

original: phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pas so //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pas so //
translated: Because they are mutually cause and effect.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbang po gang rna ba'i dbang po'i rgyu las byung ba mig gi dbang po 'jog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbang po gang rna ba'i dbang po'i rgyu las byung ba mig gi dbang po 'jog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: “The same should be understood for the ear faculty and so on” means that whatever faculty arisen from the cause of the ear faculty is the eye faculty and so on should be understood.

original: sbyin pa'i dbang po can yin la zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i sems pa gang yin pa de sbyin pa'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dbang po can yin la zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i sems pa gang yin pa de sbyin pa'i dbang po yin te /
translated: The faculty of generosity is the intention to give, which is the faculty of generosity,

original: gtong ba la dbang byed pas so //
analyzed: gtong ba la dbang byed pas so //
translated: because it controls the act of giving.

original: tshul khrims la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The application to morality is the protection of morality.

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i dbang po chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid shes pas so //
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i dbang po chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid shes pas so //
translated: By knowing the superior and inferior faculties, he knows the small, medium, and great faculties of generosity.🔽Similarly, he knows the superior and inferior faculties of morality, etc.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of patience, etc.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: He knows the superior and inferior faculties of generosity, etc.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the aids to enlightenment.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the perfections.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the emptinesses.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the doors of liberation.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the analytical knowledges.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the superknowledges.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the truths.

original: sems can gang tshul khrims kyi dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang tshul khrims kyi dbang po can yin la /
translated: He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the powers.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the fearlessnesses.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the thirty-two major marks of a great person.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the eighty minor marks.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the ten powers.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the four forms of fearlessness.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to great compassion.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: de yang sbyin pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pas tshul khrims kyi gtam byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pas tshul khrims kyi gtam byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the ten Tathāgata powers.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the four forms of fearlessness.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to great compassion.🔽He knows the superior and inferior faculties of the applications to the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa 'di dbang po can yin la zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa skye mched drug gi khyad par can mtshan nyid can gyi rigs kho na la dbang po'i sgra brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa 'di dbang po can yin la zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa skye mched drug gi khyad par can mtshan nyid can gyi rigs kho na la dbang po'i sgra brjod pa yin te /
translated: The term faculty is used to refer to the lineage that is characterized by the six sense bases such as the eye, etc.,

original: des na nyon thos kyi @343b byang chub la dbang byed pas so //
analyzed: des na nyon thos kyi @343b byang chub la dbang byed pas so //
translated: because it controls the enlightenment of the sravaka.🔽The application to the vehicle of the pratyekabuddha is the performance of listening, reflection, etc., on the vehicle of the pratyekabuddha.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa nyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa byed pa la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gang rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang po🔽can yin la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa nyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa byed pa la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni gang rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang po can yin la /
translated: The term etc. refers to the faculty of one who is a pratyekabuddha.

original: de nyan thos kyi theg pa la sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyan thos kyi theg pa la sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The application to the vehicle of the sravaka, etc., should also be applied.

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba khyad par can skye ba la dad pa la sogs pa dbang po rnams yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba khyad par can skye ba la dad pa la sogs pa dbang po rnams yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: Those whose faculties are mature are those whose faculties of faith, etc., are mature for the generation of special virtue.

original: yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Those who are not fully ripened are the opposite of that.

original: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'khor ba las nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'khor ba las nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those who do not go forth are those who will not go forth from cyclic existence.

original: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'khor ba las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'khor ba las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those who go forth are those who will go forth from cyclic existence.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary, he says:🔽The faculties of sentient beings,

original: sems can gyi dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The types, the inclinations,🔽The absorptions, and the going forth,🔽The Sage knows them all.🔽The types are as stated in the sutra:

original: rnam pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnon po yang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnon po yang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: The Sage knows the faculties of sentient beings,🔽their inclinations, their absorptions, and their going forth.

original: bsam pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The inclinations are as stated in the sutra:🔽The Sage knows the faculties of sentient beings,🔽their inclinations, their absorptions, and their going forth.

original: yongs su rtogs pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The absorptions are as stated in the sutra:🔽The Sage knows the faculties of sentient beings,🔽their inclinations, their absorptions, and their going forth.

original: gang gis tshar gcad pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye ba zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gang gis tshar gcad pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye ba zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: The going forth is as stated in the sutra:🔽The Sage knows the faculties of sentient beings,🔽their inclinations, their absorptions, and their going forth.

original: sbyor ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa'i dbang po can yin la de yang tshul khrims la sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa'i dbang po can yin la de yang tshul khrims la sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is that by which one is endowed with the faculty of giving, and that by which one is endowed with the faculty of morality, etc.

original: gang gi rgyu las byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi rgyu las byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the cause?

original: dbang po gang dag dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po gang dag dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is that from which the faculties arise, such as the wholesome roots, etc.

original: rkyen gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkyen gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the condition?

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is the maturity of the faculties, etc.

original: dmigs pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the object?

original: dmigs pa med pa'i dbang po med pas dmigs pa ni shugs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i dbang po med pas dmigs pa ni shugs kyis bstan to //
translated: Since there is no faculty without an object, the object is implied.

original: mthar thug pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthar thug pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the ultimate point?

original: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is the faculties that are associated with definite release, etc.🔽What is the end?

original: mtha' gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba'i bshad pa'o //
translated: It is the same as the ultimate point.

original: stobs drug pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs drug pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the sixth power,

original: da ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽lam 'ga' rgyal ba nyid dang zhes bya @344a * //
analyzed: da ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / lam 'ga' rgyal ba nyid dang zhes bya @344a * //
translated: now he says, “Now, the path that goes everywhere,” and so on.🔽“ Some paths are for attaining buddhahood”

original: ba ni lam 'ga' zhig gis ni sangs rgyas thob pa'o //
analyzed: ba ni lam 'ga' zhig gis ni sangs rgyas thob pa'o //
translated: means that some paths are for attaining buddhahood.

original: gang zhig rang rgyal zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba zhes bya ba thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rang rgyal zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba zhes bya ba thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “ Some are for pratyekabuddhas” should be applied to “everywhere.”

original: dmyal sogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmyal sogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: “ Hell beings and so on”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i lam bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i lam bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: means that the word “and so on” includes the various paths of humans and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mo //
translated: “ There” means “everywhere.”

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽lam gyi tshig ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / lam gyi tshig ston pa ni /
translated: he says, “There,” and so on.🔽The explanation of the words of the path is

original: lam gang la thams cad du 'gro ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lam gang la thams cad du 'gro ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: “the path that has the nature of going everywhere.”

original: sangs rgyas nyid dang rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba lnga ru 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid dang rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba lnga ru 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to the five destinies of a buddha, a pratyekabuddha, a śrāvaka, a human, etc.🔽The phrase “and so on” means that it leads to the various destinies. The phrase “hell and so on” means that each of the destinies has various divisions.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam pa sna tshogs par mtshon pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i sgra 'dis ni dmyal ba la sogs pa rigs re re la yang dbye ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa gang yod pa de🔽bsdu ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam pa sna tshogs par mtshon pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sogs pa'i sgra 'dis ni dmyal ba la sogs pa rigs re re la yang dbye ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa gang yod pa de bsdu ba'i don du'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes those.

original: lam gang zhig ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: lam gang zhig ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The phrase “the path that” refers to the path that has the nature of the Mahāyāna and so on.

original: gang du 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase “where it goes” means that it goes to buddhahood and so on.

original: lam de ni zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam de ni zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “that path” refers to the Mahāyāna and so on.

original: der 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: der 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase “where it goes” means that it goes to buddhahood and so on.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of this sūtra, he says,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said,

original: gang dag rgyu'i stobs can zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag rgyu'i stobs can zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who are powerful due to their causes are endowed with the potential.

original: sngon gyi sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma la sogs pa la thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma la sogs pa la thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who are perfect in prior application are endowed with the application of listening, reflection, and meditation in previous lives.

original: zur tsam gyis go ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zur tsam gyis go ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who understand through a mere hint

original: tshig gcig tsam bstan pas don go ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig tsam bstan pas don go ba'o //
translated: understand the meaning through being taught just one word.

original: dbang po rnon po'i zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams chen po nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams chen po nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those of sharp faculties are those whose faculties of faith and so on are great.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnon po dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnon po dag la'o //
translated: To them,

original: sngon gyi rgyu dang stobs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu dang stobs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the Buddha teaches the Dharma, having understood their prior causes and powers.

original: sngon gyi rigs dang goms pa'i stobs mkhyen nas so //
analyzed: sngon gyi rigs dang goms pa'i stobs mkhyen nas so //
translated: Having understood their prior potential and the power of their habituation,

original: chos ston to zhes bya ba ni lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston to zhes bya ba ni lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: he teaches the path.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das la yongs su mkhyen pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das la yongs su mkhyen pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows the Lord to be omniscient.

original: ma shes na ston pa mi srid do //
analyzed: ma shes na ston pa mi srid do //
translated: If he were not omniscient, he could not be a teacher.

original: rkyen gyi stobs can zhes bya ba ni sngon thos pa la sogs pa chung ba'i phyir dang da ltar nyan pa la sogs pa'i @344b rkyen la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs can zhes bya ba ni sngon thos pa la sogs pa chung ba'i phyir dang da ltar nyan pa la sogs pa'i @344b rkyen la ltos pa'o //
translated: The one who is conditioned is so called because he is dependent on the conditions of listening, etc. , in the present, due to the weakness of his previous listening, etc.

original: yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi phyir ma smin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis smin par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi phyir ma smin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis smin par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The one who is characterized by being brought to maturity is so called because he is characterized by being brought to maturity by spiritual friends, since he is not yet mature.

original: 'doms shing rjes su bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la /🔽khong du chud pa'i don du ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'doms pa ste chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'doms shing rjes su bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la / khong du chud pa'i don du ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'doms pa ste chos ston pa'o //
translated: Instruction and counsel.🔽Instruction is the teaching of the Dharma by one who is an authority.

original: chos bstan pa'i rjes la sgrub pa nyams su len du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i rjes la sgrub pa nyams su len du 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: Counsel is the urging of another to practice after the teaching of the Dharma.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i lugs las 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa dang ldan pa'i chos thos nas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i lugs las 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa dang ldan pa'i chos thos nas so //
translated: “Endowed with causes and conditions” and so on refers to the Dharma that is taught in the forward and reverse order of dependent origination.

original: tshul bzhin du rab tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rab tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Properly applied” means

original: dngos po'i de kho na bzhin du 'jug pas so //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na bzhin du 'jug pas so //
translated: engaging in the way things really are.

original: yongs su sbyang bar ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su sbyang bar ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not purified” means

original: thos pa la sogs pa la goms par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa la goms par ma byas pa'o //
translated: not being accustomed to listening and so on.

original: re chung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: re chung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Limited” means

original: brtson 'grus dang shes rab chung ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang shes rab chung ba'o //
translated: having little effort and wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na blun po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na blun po'o //
translated: For that very reason, they are “foolish.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: For that very reason,

original: snod du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snod du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “not a vessel” is mentioned.

original: lam gyi snod ma yin pas so //
analyzed: lam gyi snod ma yin pas so //
translated: They are not a vessel for the path.

original: de yang dus de la ltos nas yin gyi gzhan du na de dag gi ched du byang chub sems dpa' rnams go cha gyon par mi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: de yang dus de la ltos nas yin gyi gzhan du na de dag gi ched du byang chub sems dpa' rnams go cha gyon par mi 'thad pas so //
translated: Moreover, this is in relation to that time, because it is not tenable that the bodhisattvas would don their armor for their sake at other times.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rigs dang mi ldan pa'i sems can yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs dang mi ldan pa'i sems can yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
translated: It is established that there are no sentient beings who do not possess the lineage.

original: sdug pa'i rnam pa las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni bud med la sogs pa mdzes pa'i rnam pa mthong nas skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam pa las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni bud med la sogs pa mdzes pa'i rnam pa mthong nas skyes pa'o //
translated: There is also lust that arises from the aspect of beauty, such as when a man sees a beautiful woman.

original: rjes su chags pa'i rnam pa las skye ba yang yod de zhes bya ba ni bsting ba dang / spyo ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i rnam pa las skye ba yang yod de zhes bya ba ni bsting ba dang / spyo ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: There is also lust that arises from the aspect of attachment, such as when lust arises from the aspect of teasing, scolding, and so on.

original: sngon gyi bag la nyal gyi rgyu las skye ba yang yod pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi 'dod chags kyi bag chags las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi bag la nyal gyi rgyu las skye ba yang yod pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi 'dod chags kyi bag chags las skyes pa'o //
translated: There is also lust that arises from the cause of latent propensities, such as when lust arises from the latent propensities of previous attachment.

original: khong khro ba'i rgyu las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i rgyu las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni /
translated: There is also lust that arises from the cause of anger,

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa las byung ba'i khong khro ba las so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa las byung ba'i khong khro ba las so //
translated: such as when lust arises from anger that arises from being harmed by others.

original: bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don ma thob pa las so //
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don ma thob pa las so //
translated: There is also lust that arises from the cause of incomplete intention, such as when lust arises from not obtaining a desired object.

original: sngon bag la nyal ba las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni sngon gyi khong khro'i bag chags las so //
analyzed: sngon bag la nyal ba las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni sngon gyi khong khro'i bag chags las so //
translated: There is also that which arises from the latent impressions of former anger.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu las skye ba yang yod ces bya ba ni /
translated: There is also that which arises from the cause of nescience.

original: ma rig pa dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dag lhan cig tu spyod pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni ma rig pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //🔽de bzhin du the @345a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dag lhan cig tu spyod pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni ma rig pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o // de bzhin du the @345a * //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the co-originating cause of nescience, because nescience and the view of the transitory collection are co-existent.

original: tshom gyi rgyu las skye ba yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshom gyi rgyu las skye ba yang shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, doubt should be understood as the cause of nescience.

original: 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lam rnams so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lam rnams so //
translated: The path that is the cause of engagement refers to the paths of desire, etc.

original: ldog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni yang dag par nges pa'i lam rnams so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni yang dag par nges pa'i lam rnams so //
translated: The path that is the cause of cessation refers to the paths of correct determination.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni lam mo //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni lam mo //
translated: In regard to those,

original: stobs bdun pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs bdun pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the seventh power,

original: da ni bsam gtan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “now, the meditative development of the immeasurables, etc.”

original: de la bsam gtan ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan ni bzhi'o //
translated: Therein, the meditative development of the immeasurables refers to the four immeasurables.

original: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad do //
translated: The eight liberations.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Concentration is defined as the one-pointedness of mind on virtue.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni dgu'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni dgu'o //
translated: The nine meditative absorptions.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gang las ldang bar 'gyur te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gang las ldang bar 'gyur ba de kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ldang ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gang las ldang bar 'gyur te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gang las ldang bar 'gyur ba de kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ldang ba ste /
translated: From what do the afflicted and pure states arise? The arising of the afflicted and pure states is the arising of the afflicted and pure states.

original: de dag gi rgyu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is their cause?

original: de dag la thogs pa med par mkhyen pa'o ;
analyzed: de dag la thogs pa med par mkhyen pa'o ;
translated: It is the knowledge of their unobstructedness.

original: / ye shes ni stobs so //
analyzed: / ye shes ni stobs so //
translated: Wisdom is power.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The world is differentiated by the various kinds of yoga.

original: rnal 'byor bye brag las tha dad ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad pas bsam gtan la sogs pa yang tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bye brag las tha dad ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad pas bsam gtan la sogs pa yang tha dad pa'o //
translated: The various kinds of yoga are the different kinds of yoga of the dull faculties, etc. The meditative absorptions, etc. are also different because of the differentiation of the various kinds of yoga.

original: gcig dang brgyad gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
analyzed: gcig dang brgyad gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
translated: “One and eightfold” refers to the nine serial absorptions.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:🔽“Therein, the four absorptions and the four formless states are the eight.🔽The state of composure that is a cessation is the ninth.”

original: de la bsam gtan la sogs pa ni sngar bshad zin te //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan la sogs pa ni sngar bshad zin te //
translated: The four absorptions and so on have already been explained above.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i bshad pa ni ;
