analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i bshad pa ni ;
translated: The explanation of the nine serial absorptions is as follows:

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The four absorptions, the four formless states, and the state of composure that is a cessation.🔽The explanation of the afflicted and the purified is as follows:🔽The cause of affliction is ignorance.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The cause of purification is knowledge.

original: de la ma rig pa ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: Therein, ignorance is non-knowledge.

original: rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang bde ba la sogs pa de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang bde ba la sogs pa de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin la /
translated: The mental activity of that which is not reality, such as permanence, purity, and happiness, is incorrect mental activity.

original: de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: That is the cause of affliction.

original: de dag gi stobs kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi stobs kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because attachment and so on arise by the power of those.

original: gzhan la rjes su mthun pa'i sgra dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rjes su mthun pa'i sgra dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: In regard to the other, there is the teaching of the Dharma in accordance with the faculties, that is, the teaching of the Dharma in accordance with the faculties of the disciples.

original: tshul @345b bzhin yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul @345b bzhin yid la byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The proper mental attention is the mental attention to reality as it is.

original: de ni rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: That is the cause of purification,

original: des 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar byed pas so //
analyzed: des 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar byed pas so //
translated: because by that one abandons attachment and so on.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural authority for that,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, as it is said, and so on.

original: rgyu ni zhes bya ba ni dngos kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni zhes bya ba ni dngos kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Cause means the direct cause.

original: rkyen ni ma rig pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rkyen ni ma rig pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Condition means ignorance.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ste tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yod na ma rig pa yod pas so //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ste tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yod na ma rig pa yod pas so //
translated: That is the cooperative cause, because when there is improper mental attention, there is ignorance.

original: 'du byed rnams ni rkyen to zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyis 'du byed kyi 'gro ba rnams su bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang ma rig pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa rnams skye bar
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni rkyen to zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyis 'du byed kyi 'gro ba rnams su bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang ma rig pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa rnams skye bar
translated: Formations are the cause means that the realms of beings with the natures of virtue, nonvirtue, and so on experience pleasure and pain through the power of ignorance and the afflictions arise.

original: 'gyur ba yin te 'du byed ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin te 'du byed ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du'o //
translated: Formations are the cause means as before.

original: lta ba ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'o sred pa ni skyon to zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir sred pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bas so ;
analyzed: lta ba ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'o sred pa ni skyon to zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir sred pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bas so ;
translated: View is the cause means the view of self and mine. Craving is the fault means attachment and so on arise from craving a self and mine.

original: / bag la nyal ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: / bag la nyal ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni bag chags kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: Latent states are the cause means they have the nature of traces.

original: kun nas ldang ba ni rkyen te zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu rnams te /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba ni rkyen te zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu rnams te /
translated: Arising is the condition means the manifest causes of the afflictions.

original: dper na bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mngon du rgyu yod na bdag dang bdag gi ba dang mi mthun pa la zhe sdang ba ni bag chags kyi stobs dang / chags pa'i stobs kyis zhe sdang skye'o //
analyzed: dper na bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mngon du rgyu yod na bdag dang bdag gi ba dang mi mthun pa la zhe sdang ba ni bag chags kyi stobs dang / chags pa'i stobs kyis zhe sdang skye'o //
translated: For example, when there is a manifest cause of “I” and “mine,” hatred for what is contrary to “I” and “mine” arises through the power of habitual tendencies and the power of attachment.

original: zhi gnas la rtse gcig pa dang zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas la rtse gcig pa dang zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “One-pointedness in serenity” means that the mind becomes one-pointed through the power of samādhi.

original: lhag mthong la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa la bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa la bya ba'o //
translated: “Skill in insight” means the thorough knowledge of the nature of things.

original: de la yang tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa rgyu yin la gzhan las sgra thos pa ni rkyen no //
analyzed: de la yang tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa rgyu yin la gzhan las sgra thos pa ni rkyen no //
translated: In this case, proper mental attention is the cause, and hearing the sound from another is the condition.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen no //
translated: “That” refers to the cause and the condition.

original: ye shes dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: “Endowed with knowledge” refers to the knowledge of cause and condition.

original: 'dod pa rnams la dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i snyoms par 'jug gis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang bar 'gyur pa'o ;🔽/'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pas bsam gtan dang po las ldang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i snyoms par 'jug gis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang bar 'gyur pa'o ; /'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pas bsam gtan dang po las ldang ba'o //
translated: The phrase having arisen from the meditative development of the first absorption refers to the meditative development of the meditative attainment of cessation.🔽The phrase having arisen from the meditative attainment of cessation refers to the meditative development of the first absorption.

original: lugs dang mthun par yang dag par snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba ni dang po las gnyis par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pas so //🔽@346a * // lugs dang mi mthun pa dang zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa nas bdun pa la sogs par te /
analyzed: lugs dang mthun par yang dag par snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba ni dang po las gnyis par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pas so // @346a * // lugs dang mi mthun pa dang zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa nas bdun pa la sogs par te /
translated: The phrase he enters into meditative concentration in an orderly manner refers to the sequence beginning with the second absorption from the first absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.

original: rim pa ma yin pas so //🔽sbrel zhing yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rim pa ma yin pas so // sbrel zhing yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.

original: dang po las gsum pa dang gsum pa las lnga par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: dang po las gsum pa dang gsum pa las lnga par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.🔽The phrase in a reverse order refers to the sequence beginning with the seventh absorption from the eighth absorption.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mtha' dag dang ro gcig pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mtha' dag dang ro gcig pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, “It is called samadhi because it is of one taste with all samadhis and attainments.”

original: ting nge 'dzin la 'dres pa gang yang med cing zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi bya ba tha dad par snang bas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la 'dres pa gang yang med cing zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi bya ba tha dad par snang bas so //
translated: There is no mixing of samadhis at all, because the activities of the samadhis appear separately.

original: dmigs pas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya ba med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa med pas so //
analyzed: dmigs pas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya ba med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa med pas so //
translated: There is no attainment of samadhi through an objective support, because the Tathagata has no objective support in samadhi.

original: sems gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mtha' dag dang ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mtha' dag dang ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no progression of mind from one to another, because the Tathagata’s samadhi is of one taste with all samadhis and attainments.

original: sems mnyam par ma gzhag par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma gzhag par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: It is not reasonable that the mind is not in equipoise, because he has no unequipoised mind.

original: lus kyang lta bar mi nus te //
analyzed: lus kyang lta bar mi nus te //
translated: The body also cannot be seen,

original: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i khongs su chud par bya ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i khongs su chud par bya ba ma yin pas so //
translated: Because it is not included in the category of the śrāvakas, etc.

original: zil gyis mi non pa ste zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis so //
analyzed: zil gyis mi non pa ste zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis so //
translated: It is not overwhelmed means by the counteragents.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la'o //
translated: Here means in the Tathāgata’s meditative concentration.

original: stobs brgyad pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs brgyad pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the eighth power,

original: da ni sngon gyi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sngon gyi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: now he says, “The knowledge of the recollection of former existences,” etc.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas ni skye ba gzhan gyi gnas so //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas ni skye ba gzhan gyi gnas so //
translated: The power of the knowledge of the recollection of former existences is the knowledge of former existences, i.e., of other births.

original: de rjes su dran pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rjes su dran pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The recollection of them is their actualization.

original: de mkhyen pa ni stobs so //
analyzed: de mkhyen pa ni stobs so //
translated: The knowledge of that is a power.

original: ji srid gti mug ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: ji srid gti mug ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: As long as there is delusion, etc.

original: ji srid gti mug ces bya ba 'dis ma rig pa thog ma med pa'i phyir skye ba brgyud pa rnams la thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji srid gti mug ces bya ba 'dis ma rig pa thog ma med pa'i phyir skye ba brgyud pa rnams la thog ma med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this, “as long as there is delusion,” he demonstrates the beginninglessness of the series of births because nescience is beginningless.

original: de srid gnas 'das zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i skye ba de srid pa'o //
analyzed: de srid gnas 'das zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i skye ba de srid pa'o //
translated: As long as that is so, it is called “the past existence. ”

original: skye ba de gang gi yin zhe na bdag dang sems can gzhan re re zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skye ba de gang gi yin zhe na bdag dang sems can gzhan re re zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is that existence? It is said: “of each self and other sentient being. ”

original: bdag dang sems can rnams re re srid pa 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can rnams re re srid pa 'das pa'o //
translated: The past existence of each self and sentient being.

original: gzhan ni srid pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni srid pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the other existence?

original: sems can ji snyed de snyed mtha' yas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can ji snyed de snyed mtha' yas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said: “as many sentient beings there are, so many are the infinite. ”

original: sems can mtha' yas pas srid pa yang mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pas srid pa yang mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: Since sentient beings are infinite, existence is also infinite.

original: yang ji lta bu zhe @346b na ;
analyzed: yang ji lta bu zhe @346b na ;
translated: Again, what is it?

original: gzhir bcas yul phyogs dang bcas rnams la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhir bcas yul phyogs dang bcas rnams la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said: “in regard to the basis and the place. ”

original: de la nga sngar skyes ba'i yul du gyur pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhi dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la nga sngar skyes ba'i yul du gyur pa ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhi dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The basis is the place where one was born in the past, thinking: “This is where I was born. ”

original: nga der gnas so snyam na ni yul phyogs dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nga der gnas so snyam na ni yul phyogs dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The place is where one lived, thinking: “I lived there. ”

original: nga kha dog 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur to snyam pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nga kha dog 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur to snyam pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The form is the color with which one was endowed, thinking: “I had such and such a color. ”

original: de lta bu la mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: de lta bu la mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: The power of knowledge of recollecting former abodes is the unobstructed knowledge of that.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says

original: ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As long as there is delusion, there is birth.

original: yul nyid du bshad do zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i yul nyid du ji srid gti mug ces bya ba'i sgras brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yul nyid du bshad do zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i yul nyid du ji srid gti mug ces bya ba'i sgras brjod pa'o //
translated: He explains that as the object. The succession of births without beginning is the object of recollecting former abodes, as long as there is delusion.

original: bsdu bar brjod do zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams mu mtha' med pa'i sngon gyi skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yul nyid du bsdu bar bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu bar brjod do zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams mu mtha' med pa'i sngon gyi skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yul nyid du bsdu bar bzhed pa'o //
translated: He explains that as the collection. The succession of births of the limitless realm of sentient beings is the object of the collection.

original: gzhir bcas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhir bcas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: He explains that as the basis. It has a cause.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas so //
translated: That is the former abode.

original: lhag ma ni rgyu dang bcas pa rjes su dran pa'o zhes bya ba ni mdo las kha cig dang phyogs las gang gzhan rjes su dran pa gsungs pa de thams cad rgyu dang bcas par rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rgyu dang bcas pa rjes su dran pa'o zhes bya ba ni mdo las kha cig dang phyogs las gang gzhan rjes su dran pa gsungs pa de thams cad rgyu dang bcas par rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The rest is the recollection of the cause. This is the recollection of all that is taught in the sutra as other than the part that is recollection of the cause.

original: stobs kyi dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs kyi dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the purpose of the powers,

original: stobs 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: stobs 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “By this power,” etc.

original: cho 'phrul yod par ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nyid mkhyen pas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pas chos bstan par 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: cho 'phrul yod par ston par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa nyid mkhyen pas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pas chos bstan par 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: He shows the existence of miracles. This is to say, by knowing the possession or non-possession of the power of a previous cause, he teaches the Dharma in accordance with that, and so the teaching of the Dharma is fruitful.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to show the source of the sutra,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “As it is said,” etc.

original: de bzhin du chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi rgyu'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi rgyu'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //
translated: Similarly, he teaches the Dharma, following the previous cause.

original: sems kyi rgyu ba 'das pa yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ba 'das pa yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu shes so //
translated: The Tathāgata also knows the past movements of mind.

original: bya ba 'di rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba 'di rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this topic in detail,

original: sems gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Whatever mind . . . ” and so on.

original: yongs su shes pa 'di nyid mtha' yas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa 'di nyid mtha' yas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that this knowledge is infinite,

original: de ltar ci tsam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'di'i don ni chu bo gang g'a'i bye ma snyed dang mtshungs pa'i sems can gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod par mi nus pa'i @347a * //
analyzed: de ltar ci tsam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'di'i don ni chu bo gang g'a'i bye ma snyed dang mtshungs pa'i sems can gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod par mi nus pa'i @347a * //
translated: he says, “To that extent . . . ” and so on.

original: sems kyi rgyun de de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun de de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The meaning is as follows. The Tathāgata knows the continuum of mind of a single sentient being, which is equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River, and which is passed down from one sentient being to another, and which cannot be described.

original: ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i sems kyi rgyun mkhyen pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i sems kyi rgyun mkhyen pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: He knows the continuum of mind that is beyond the range of speech.

original: yang mu mtha' med pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang mu mtha' med pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that it is also limitless,

original: phyi ma'i mu mthar thug pa bstan kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mu mthar thug pa bstan kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Even if the final limit of the future were shown . . . ” and so on.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'i mtha' ma'i bar du sems kyi rgyun bstan par gyur kyang /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba'i mtha' ma'i bar du sems kyi rgyun bstan par gyur kyang /
translated: Even if the Lord were to teach the stream of mind up to the end of cyclic existence,

original: de ltar na yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa 'di ston pa las mtha' yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa 'di ston pa las mtha' yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: still, this knowledge of the recollection of former abodes would not be shown to have an end.

original: gal te 'khor ba la mtha' med pas phyi ma'i mur thug pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba la mtha' med pas phyi ma'i mur thug pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If cyclic existence is endless, how can it be said to reach the end of the future?

original: de la lan ni ;🔽yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ni ; yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The answer is:🔽It is said to be “imagined”

original: 'khor ba mtha' yod par brtags nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor ba mtha' yod par brtags nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because cyclic existence is imagined to be finite.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab cing zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyi sems kyi yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab cing zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyi sems kyi yul ma yin pas so //
translated: “Inconceivable” means that it is not the object of the minds of other bodhisattvas.

original: mtshungs pa med la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa rnams la de lta bu'i ye shes med pas so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa med la zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa rnams la de lta bu'i ye shes med pas so //
translated: “Incomparable” means that no one but the Tathāgata has such knowledge.

original: tshad med pa de zhes bya ba ni grangs kyis bgrang bar mi nus pas so //
analyzed: tshad med pa de zhes bya ba ni grangs kyis bgrang bar mi nus pas so //
translated: “Immeasurable” means that it cannot be measured by number.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: de'i mtha' ni bstan par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di tsam zhig go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni bstan par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di tsam zhig go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is not easy to teach its end.

original: sangs rgyas khyu mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la mi 'jigs pa mnga' bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas khyu mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la mi 'jigs pa mnga' bas so //
translated: The Buddha is the best of herds because he possesses the fearlessness of a Buddha.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la dmigs pa de dang des zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sangs rgyas la bskrun pa la sogs pa sems la byas nas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la dmigs pa de dang des zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sangs rgyas la bskrun pa la sogs pa sems la byas nas so //
translated: With that and that root of merit means having made the root of merit, such as planting in the Buddha, into the mind.

original: phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub las so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub las so //
translated: One becomes irreversible means from enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dgu pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dgu pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the ninth power of the Tathāgata,

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: now and so on is stated.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of knowledge of death, transmigration, and rebirth is as follows.

original: 'chi ba ni phung po 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni phung po 'jig pa'o //
translated: Death is the destruction of the aggregates.

original: skye ba ni phung po nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni phung po nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: Rebirth is the connection of the aggregates.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: 'jig pa dang chags pa la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang chags pa la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the destruction, creation, etc.

original: de dag la mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni stobs so //
analyzed: de dag la mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni stobs so //
translated: The power is the unobstructed knowledge of these.

original: 'jig rten la gnas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i khams na yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la gnas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i khams na yod pa'o //
translated: The phrase in the world means in the world systems.

original: nam mkha'i mthar thug dang zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas pa ste nam mkha' la mu mtha' med pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthar thug dang zhes bya ba ni mtha' yas pa ste nam mkha' la mu mtha' med pas so //
translated: The phrase to the end of space means to infinity, because space has no end.

original: bkra mang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bkra mang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase with its many varieties means

original: las sna @347b tshogs pas rnam pa sna tshogs par bskyed pas so //
analyzed: las sna @347b tshogs pas rnam pa sna tshogs par bskyed pas so //
translated: that it is created in many different ways by the variety of actions.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye bas so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye bas so //
translated: The phrase in that refers to death and rebirth.

original: skad cig 'jug pa yis zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig gis so //
analyzed: skad cig 'jug pa yis zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig gis so //
translated: The phrase in a single instant means in a single moment.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: 'chi 'pho ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, Death is the end of life.

original: phung po nying mtshams sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni yang skye ba len pa'o //
analyzed: phung po nying mtshams sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni yang skye ba len pa'o //
translated: The phrase the connection of the aggregates means to take up birth again.

original: las shin tu sna tshogs pa nyid bzos sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni las shin tu sna tshogs pa nyid bzo'i yin la des byas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las shin tu sna tshogs pa nyid bzos sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni las shin tu sna tshogs pa nyid bzo'i yin la des byas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the variety of actions is the creation of an artist” means that the variety of actions is the creation of an artist, and that is what is created by him.

original: de'i ye shes yul 'ga' la yang chags pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pas gang la yang thogs par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ye shes yul 'ga' la yang chags pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pas gang la yang thogs par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase “his knowledge is not obstructed with regard to any object” means that because he is omniscient, he is not obstructed with regard to anything.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa nye bar mtshon pa tsam du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa nye bar mtshon pa tsam du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of death and rebirth,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Bhagavān said,🔽“The knowledge of the Tathāgata is unobstructed with regard to the past, the future, and the present.

original: 'chags pa dang 'jig pa la zhes bya ba la 'chags pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten byung bas so//
analyzed: 'chags pa dang 'jig pa la zhes bya ba la 'chags pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten byung bas so//
translated: The phrase “with regard to the arising and destruction” means that the arising of the world of sentient beings and the world of their physical environment is the arising of the world.

original: 'jig pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The destruction of the world of sentient beings and the world of their physical environment is the destruction of the world.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gnas pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gnas pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” should be understood to include the abiding of the world.

original: thams cad kyang zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of “all” is “without exception.”

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for that,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba gsungs te chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can yin pas so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba gsungs te chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can yin pas so //
translated: he says, “As it is said,” and so on. The phrase “pervading the realm of space” means that it has the nature of emptiness.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: “Extending to the ends of space” means that it is limitless like space.

original: tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi ma phyi mas snga ma snga mas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi ma phyi mas snga ma snga mas bshad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “immeasurable” and so on is explained by the following passages.

original: zhing du snang ba zhes bya ba ni zhing nyid snang bar bya ba yin pas na zhing du snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhing du snang ba zhes bya ba ni zhing nyid snang bar bya ba yin pas na zhing du snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase “appearing as a field” means that it is a field that appears, and so it is called “appearing as a field.”

original: bde 'gro dang zhes bya ba ni lha dang mir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang zhes bya ba ni lha dang mir 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase “good destinies” means going to the realms of gods and humans.

original: ngan 'gro dang zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro dang zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase “bad destinies” means going to the realms of hell and so on.

original: las ji lta ba bzhin nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dag gi stobs kyis 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las ji lta ba bzhin nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dag gi stobs kyis 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “One goes according to one’s deeds” means that one goes to a realm by the power of good and bad deeds.

original: 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs pa las so //
translated: “One passes away” means from the Tuṣita heaven, etc.

original: mngal du 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal du 'jug pa'o //
translated: “One enters the womb” means one enters the mother’s womb.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mngal las so //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mngal las so //
translated: “One emerges” means from the womb.

original: tshe'i 'du byed 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams de na gdul bya med par sku tshe gtong ba'o //
analyzed: tshe'i 'du byed 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams de na gdul bya med par sku tshe gtong ba'o //
translated: “One casts off the constituents of life” means one gives up one’s life in that world-realm when there are no more disciples.

original: de nyid kyi phyir @348a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir @348a * //
translated: For that very reason,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bas so //🔽rdzu 'phrul ston pa yon sbyong ba //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bas so // rdzu 'phrul ston pa yon sbyong ba //
translated: “one passes into complete nirvāṇa.”

original: zhes bya ba ni lus las me 'bar ba dang chu 'brub pa yongs su ston pas yon bdag la sogs pa dang ba skyes pa'i sgo nas yon yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus las me 'bar ba dang chu 'brub pa yongs su ston pas yon bdag la sogs pa dang ba skyes pa'i sgo nas yon yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “One displays miracles and purifies offerings” means that by displaying the burning of the body and the appearance of water, one purifies offerings by means of the faith of patrons, etc.

original: sems can gang dag mi snang bar gyur pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag la gang mi snang bar 'gyur ba de la sems can gang dag mi snang bar gyur pa dag
analyzed: sems can gang dag mi snang bar gyur pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag la gang mi snang bar 'gyur ba de la sems can gang dag mi snang bar gyur pa dag
translated: Those who are invisible to them are called “those sentient beings who are invisible.”

original: ces bya'o // phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol mu stegs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: ces bya'o // phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol mu stegs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: “External” means external non-Buddhists.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga po ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga po ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The five superknowledges are

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa ma gtogs pa ste de rnams la zag pa med pas so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa ma gtogs pa ste de rnams la zag pa med pas so //
translated: except for the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements, because they do not have the destruction of the defilements.

original: mig gi lam du zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul nyid du'o //
analyzed: mig gi lam du zhes bya ba ni mig gi yul nyid du'o //
translated: “In the path of the eye” means in the object of the eye.

original: shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam gyi phyogs na zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i 'phang lo'i tshad tsam gyis nam mkha'i gos na'o //
analyzed: shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam gyi phyogs na zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i 'phang lo'i tshad tsam gyis nam mkha'i gos na'o //
translated: “In a direction the size of a chariot wheel” means in the sky, the size of a chariot wheel.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gdul bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gdul bya'o //
translated: “Those” refers to the disciples of the Buddha.

original: sems can de dag ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gdul bya'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gdul bya'o //
translated: Those sentient beings means those who are the disciples of the Buddha.

original: de ni ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de ni ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Not that means not by other sentient beings who are not Buddhas, such as Bodhisattvas.

original: stobs bcu pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs bcu pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the ten powers,

original: da ni zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: now he says,🔽The power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants, etc.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams yin la de rnams zad pa ni med pa yin la de mkhyen pas na stobs so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams yin la de rnams zad pa ni med pa yin la de mkhyen pas na stobs so //
translated: Contaminants are afflictions, and their exhaustion is non-existence. Since that is known, it is a power.

original: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: By the power of knowledge of all aspects means by the power of knowledge of pure suchness.

original: slob ma la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: slob ma la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: Disciples, etc. means Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyon mongs blo yis 'gog pa gang //
analyzed: nyon mongs blo yis 'gog pa gang //
translated: What is the cessation of afflictions by the mind?

original: zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rang bzhin can gyi shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rang bzhin can gyi shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of afflictions by means of the wisdom that is the nature of the path.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa 'jig rten dang nyon mongs pa 'gog pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa 'jig rten dang nyon mongs pa 'gog pa la'o //
translated: In that, means in the cessation of afflictions and the world together with their traces.

original: mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni yul mtha' yas pas so //
analyzed: mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni yul mtha' yas pas so //
translated: Infinite means that the object is infinite.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:🔽In that, means in the cessation of afflictions and the world together with their traces.

original: nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs @348b pas 'jig rten la 'khor bar gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs @348b pas 'jig rten la 'khor bar gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: Because it afflicts means that because of afflictions, the world is harmed in samsara.

original: rgyud 'bags par byed cing bsgo bar byed la rjes su bgrod par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyud 'bags par byed cing bsgo bar byed la rjes su bgrod par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It defiles the continuum, it is the controller, and it is the pursuer.

original: 'bags par byed cing zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni bsgo bar byed pa la rjes su bgrod par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bags par byed cing zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni bsgo bar byed pa la rjes su bgrod par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of “it defiles” is that it is the controller and the pursuer.

original: de la 'bags par byed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang 'dre bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'bags par byed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang 'dre bar byed pa'o //
translated: There, it defiles means that it mixes with the seeds of afflictions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su bgrod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su bgrod par byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a “conveyor.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu med pa'i phyir phra ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu med pa'i phyir phra ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: “The limit of the afflictions” is the subtle stage, because the afflictions are not manifest.

original: rtsa ba dang zhes bya ba ni sa bon no //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang zhes bya ba ni sa bon no //
translated: “The root” is the seed.

original: til mar dang me tog la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rtsi mar la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: til mar dang me tog la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rtsi mar la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “such as sesame oil and flowers” includes such things as medicinal oils.

original: de dang phrad pa zhes bya ba ni til mar dang me tog la sogs pa dang phrad pas so //🔽yon tan phra mo dmigs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang phrad pa zhes bya ba ni til mar dang me tog la sogs pa dang phrad pas so // yon tan phra mo dmigs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Contact” means contact with sesame oil, flowers, etc.

original: til mar dang me tog la sogs pa'i dri dmigs pas so //
analyzed: til mar dang me tog la sogs pa'i dri dmigs pas so //
translated: “Like the perception of a subtle quality” means like the perception of the smell of sesame oil, flowers, etc.

original: bag chags yod pa zhes bya ba ni spre 'ur gyur pa'i dus su mchong zhing mchong zhing 'gro ba la sogs pa des sa bon rang bzhin can gyi bag chags bzhag pa las so //
analyzed: bag chags yod pa zhes bya ba ni spre 'ur gyur pa'i dus su mchong zhing mchong zhing 'gro ba la sogs pa des sa bon rang bzhin can gyi bag chags bzhag pa las so //
translated: “The existence of the latent impressions” means that the latent impressions, which are seeds, are deposited by the jumping and running of the monkey at the time it was a monkey.

original: dmangs mor brjod pa'i kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa 'ga' zhig sngon bram zer gyur pa de bram ze'i rigs kyi stobs kyis dmangs rigs gzhan la brnyas pa byed pa'i dus su dmangs rigs kyi tshig brjod pa la goms par gyur pa de'i
analyzed: dmangs mor brjod pa'i kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa 'ga' zhig sngon bram zer gyur pa de bram ze'i rigs kyi stobs kyis dmangs rigs gzhan la brnyas pa byed pa'i dus su dmangs rigs kyi tshig brjod pa la goms par gyur pa de'i
translated: By the power of his being a brahman, he despised other low-caste people and in the past was accustomed to using the word “low-caste woman.”

original: stobs kyis sems la bag chags bzhag pa des da ltar dgra bcom pa thob tu zin kyang gang g'a'i lha mo la bag chags kyi stobs kyis dmangs mor brjod pa'i kun tu spyod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: stobs kyis sems la bag chags bzhag pa des da ltar dgra bcom pa thob tu zin kyang gang g'a'i lha mo la bag chags kyi stobs kyis dmangs mor brjod pa'i kun tu spyod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the power of that habit energy, even though he has attained arhatship, he still uses the expression “low-caste woman” with regard to the goddess of the Ganges.

original: shes bya yongs su spyod pa'i gegs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de'i stobs kyis shes bya ji ltar yod pa bzhin du khong du mi chud pas so //
analyzed: shes bya yongs su spyod pa'i gegs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de'i stobs kyis shes bya ji ltar yod pa bzhin du khong du mi chud pas so //
translated: The so-called “obstruction to the complete enjoyment of objects of knowledge” is the fact that, by the power of that habit energy, he does not understand objects of knowledge as they are.

original: lus dang ngag gi 'jug pa rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu yang yin te zhes bya ba ni mchod pa la sogs pa lus kyi spyod pa dang dmangs mor brjod pa la sogs pa ngag gi spyod pa de dag ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi 'jug pa rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu yang yin te zhes bya ba ni mchod pa la sogs pa lus kyi spyod pa dang dmangs mor brjod pa la sogs pa ngag gi spyod pa de dag ni rgyu'o //
translated: It is also the cause of such kinds of engagement of body and speech. The cause is the conduct of body, such as worship, and the conduct of speech, such as the expression of humility.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni shes bya yongs su gcod pa'i gegs kyi rgyu yang ngo //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni shes bya yongs su gcod pa'i gegs kyi rgyu yang ngo //
translated: And also means and the cause of the obstruction to the discernment of the knowable.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyis so //🔽gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyis so // gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: By the knowledge of the extremely pure Dharma-element means by the knowledge of the extremely pure Dharma-element.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba dag la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba dag la'o //
translated: Not to others means not to the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags lhag mar lus pa spangs pa dang @349a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags lhag mar lus pa spangs pa dang @349a * //
translated: The abandonment of the remaining imprints of the afflictions

original: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal dag go //
translated: means the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of the afflictions that are the connection of the imprints means the abandonment of the afflictions together with their imprints.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of the sutra, he says:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said...

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten zhes bya ba ni ngas thar pa'i lam bsten to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni bsten zhes bya ba ni ngas thar pa'i lam bsten to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The pure life has been lived means I have followed the path of liberation.

original: bya ba ni byas te zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni byas te zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: What was to be done has been done means I have abandoned the afflictive and cognitive obscurations along with their traces.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni srid pa 'di las srid pa gzhan mi len pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni srid pa 'di las srid pa gzhan mi len pa'o //
translated: There is no more becoming other than this means I will not take up another existence beyond this one.

original: sems rnam par grol ba shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba la ltos nas so //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba la ltos nas so //
translated: The mind is liberated, wisdom is liberated means in dependence on the mind and mental factors.

original: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bas so //
translated: Purified means free from the afflictive obscurations.

original: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas so //
translated: Stainless means free from the cognitive obscurations.

original: yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa gnyis dang bral bas so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa gnyis dang bral bas so //
translated: Completely purified means free from both obscurations.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: “Luminous” means emptiness, which is naturally pure by its very essence.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags thams cad dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags thams cad dang bral ba ste /
translated: “Having destroyed all the connections with habitual tendencies” means being free from all habitual tendencies.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas so //
translated: This is because one is free from the obscurations of affliction and the obscurations to knowing.

original: tshad yod pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spongs pa ni 'di tsam zhig yin no zhes brjod par nus pas so //
analyzed: tshad yod pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spongs pa ni 'di tsam zhig yin no zhes brjod par nus pas so //
translated: “Having a limited extent” means that the hearers’ abandonment of affliction can be described as being “just this much.”

original: snying rje chen po dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni de dag la dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje med pas so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni de dag la dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje med pas so //
translated: “Being devoid of great compassion” means that they do not have the compassion that is free from reference points.

original: spobs pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang thogs pa med par brjod mi nus pas so //
analyzed: spobs pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang thogs pa med par brjod mi nus pas so //
translated: “Being devoid of eloquence” means that they are unable to express themselves in a way that is both logical and uninterrupted.

original: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs yin pas so //
translated: Endowed with all the best aspects means that it is the state in which the qualities of the powers, fearlessnesses, etc. are perfected.

original: thugs rje chen pos kun tu bzung ba zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos kun tu bzung ba zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Held by great compassion means that it is endowed with great compassion.

original: mi 'jigs pa dang spobs pa dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa mnga' ba nyid kyis spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang spobs pa dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa mnga' ba nyid kyis spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Not devoid of fearlessness and eloquence means that it is endowed with eloquence because it possesses fearlessness.

original: 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis mi non pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad log kyang gzhan du bsgyur mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis mi non pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad log kyang gzhan du bsgyur mi nus pa ste /
translated: Not overcome by any world means that it cannot be changed by any other, even though all worlds are inverted.

original: ji ltar zhe na sems kyi @349b skad cig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na sems kyi @349b skad cig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: How is that? It is said that it is by the wisdom that is associated with a single moment of mind.

original: sems kyi skad cig dang shes rab kyi skad cig ma gcig kyang gzhan du byed mi nus na /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig dang shes rab kyi skad cig ma gcig kyang gzhan du byed mi nus na /
translated: If even a single moment of mind and a single moment of wisdom cannot be changed by another,

original: sems kyi skad cig du ma gzhan du byed mi nus pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig du ma gzhan du byed mi nus pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o //
translated: What need is there to mention that it cannot be made into many moments of mind?

original: spyod lam 'khrul ba'i bag chags med do zhes bya ba ni mchod zhing 'gro ba la sogs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: spyod lam 'khrul ba'i bag chags med do zhes bya ba ni mchod zhing 'gro ba la sogs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: There is no latent tendency for error in conduct means that it is the nature of going to a place of worship, etc.

original: nye bar len pa spangs pa'i phyir chos ston to zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs nye bar len pa spangs pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa spangs pa'i phyir chos ston to zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs nye bar len pa spangs pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It teaches the Dharma for the sake of abandoning the appropriation of desire, the appropriation of the claim of self, the appropriation of views, and the appropriation of morality and asceticism.

original: de las 'dod pa nye bar len pa ni rdzas su cu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de las 'dod pa nye bar len pa ni rdzas su cu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: Among those, the appropriation of desire is thirty-four substances.

original: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / khong khro dang / ma rig pa rnams re re la yang bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dbye bas rnam pa lnga lngar 'gyur pas nyi shu dang ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / khong khro dang / ma rig pa rnams re re la yang bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dbye bas rnam pa lnga lngar 'gyur pas nyi shu dang ;
translated: Desire, pride, anger, and ignorance are each divided into five types: those to be abandoned by seeing the four noble truths and those to be abandoned by cultivation, making twenty.

original: the tshom la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa bzhi dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / rgyags pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang /
analyzed: the tshom la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa bzhi dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / rgyags pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang /
translated: Doubt has four types abandoned by seeing the four truths, nonembarrassment, nonvirtuous shamelessness, envy, avarice, arrogance, regret, lethargy, sleep,🔽anger and attachment.

original: khong khro dang / chags pa zhes bya ba'i kun nas dkris pa bcu ste sum cu rtsa bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: khong khro dang / chags pa zhes bya ba'i kun nas dkris pa bcu ste sum cu rtsa bzhi pa'o /
translated: Thus there are thirty four.

original: kha dag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ni rdzas su sum cu rtsa brgyad de /
analyzed: kha dag tu smra ba nye bar len pa ni rdzas su sum cu rtsa brgyad de /
translated: The substances of the entanglements are thirty eight.

original: gzugs su gtogs pa'i 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa re re la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dbye bas rnam pa lnga lngar 'gyur pas rnam pa bco lnga yin la /
analyzed: gzugs su gtogs pa'i 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa re re la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dbye bas rnam pa lnga lngar 'gyur pas rnam pa bco lnga yin la /
translated: Attachment, pride and ignorance belonging to the form realm are each classified as five types: those abandoned by seeing the four truths and those abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽Thus there are fifteen types.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su yang yin pas sum cu tham par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su yang yin pas sum cu tham par 'gyur la /
translated: Similarly, there are thirty types in the formless realm.

original: gzugs khams kyi the tshom la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spong bar bya ba yin pas rnam pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi the tshom la yang bden pa bzhi mthong ba'i spang bar bya ba'i dbye bas bzhi yin pa'i phyir brgyad do //
analyzed: gzugs khams kyi the tshom la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spong bar bya ba yin pas rnam pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi the tshom la yang bden pa bzhi mthong ba'i spang bar bya ba'i dbye bas bzhi yin pa'i phyir brgyad do //
translated: Doubt of the form realm is abandoned by seeing the four truths, since it has four types. Doubt of the formless realm is also abandoned by seeing the four truths, since it has four types.

original: de ltar na sum cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sum cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus there are thirty eight.

original: lta ba lnga las tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa logs su byed la /
analyzed: lta ba lnga las tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa logs su byed la /
translated: From among the five views, the extreme view and the clinging to rules and ritual as supreme are separate.

original: lta ba nye bar len pa la rdzas sum cu rtsa tham pa yin te /
analyzed: lta ba nye bar len pa la rdzas sum cu rtsa tham pa yin te /
translated: The substance of the appropriated views is thirty three.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / @350a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / @350a * //
translated: The afflicted view of the self of the desire realm

original: mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dag sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin pas rnam pa re re yin pa'i phyir gnyis dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dag re re yang bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis rnam pa brgyad de bcu'o //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dag sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin pas rnam pa re re yin pa'i phyir gnyis dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dag re re yang bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis rnam pa brgyad de bcu'o //
translated: Thus there are ten.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi yang ma yin pas sum cu tham par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi yang ma yin pas sum cu tham par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Similarly, there are not those of the form and formless realms, so there are thirty.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa ni rdzas drug ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa ni rdzas drug ste /
translated: The appropriator of mere discipline and austerity is six substances.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa gnyis dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na yang ma yin pas rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa gnyis dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na yang ma yin pas rnam pa drug go //
translated: The two views grasping mere discipline and austerity as supreme that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and the truth of path in the desire realm and similarly there are not those of the form and formless realms, so there are six types.

original: de la zag pa rnams dang / nye bar len pa rnams kyi khyad par ni zag pa rnams la kun nas dkris pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa rnams dang / nye bar len pa rnams kyi khyad par ni zag pa rnams la kun nas dkris pa med pa'o //
translated: The difference between the defilements and the appropriators is that the defilements are not the entanglements.

original: chos ston pa'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos ston pa'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of the teaching of the Dharma,

original: kye ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Alas!

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yongs su rtog pa las byung ba dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yongs su rtog pa las byung ba dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: Arisen from unreal imagination” means

original: gang gis dngos po med pa la yod pa nyid du rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gis dngos po med pa la yod pa nyid du rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa yin la /
translated: that the imagination of what is unreal is the imagination of what is nonexistent as existent.

original: de las byung ba'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtogs shig ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtogs shig ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: “You should realize the reality just as it is” means that you should understand it to have the nature of emptiness.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa rnams la'o //
translated: “In regard to them” means in regard to those with appropriation.

original: nye bar bkod pa'i dpe rnams kyis //
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa'i dpe rnams kyis //
translated: By means of the examples that are set forth,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid gang la bkod pa'i dpe de lta bu rnams kyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba nyid gang la bkod pa'i dpe de lta bu rnams kyis te /
translated: means by means of those examples that are set forth as being similar.

original: rmi lam dang brag ca dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i dpe rnams kyis te /
analyzed: rmi lam dang brag ca dang smig rgyu la sogs pa'i dpe rnams kyis te /
translated: By the examples of dream, echo, mirage, and so on.

original: de rnams snang du zin kyang dngos po nyid du med pa de bzhin nyid zag pa rnams kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams snang du zin kyang dngos po nyid du med pa de bzhin nyid zag pa rnams kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Although they are perceived, they do not exist as things. Suchness is also like that, the defilements.

original: chos gang yang nye bar mi len pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad na chos gang yang mi dmigs pas nye bar len pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang yang nye bar mi len pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad na chos gang yang mi dmigs pas nye bar len pa med pa'o //
translated: Not appropriating any dharma at all means that, upon analysis, no dharma is observed, so there is no appropriation.

original: stobs bcu'i mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of the ten powers,

original: de ltar gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Buddha] declares, “Thus, those who . . .” and so on.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni stobs rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni stobs rnams so //
translated: “Those” refers to the powers.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni mthar thug par 'gyur @350b ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni mthar thug par 'gyur @350b ba'o //
translated: “In every way complete” means that they will reach the end.

original: ye shes kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Having the inconceivable domain of wisdom” means that they have nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i yon tan mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu las gzhan pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i yon tan mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu las gzhan pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing all other qualities apart from those is possessing all the fearlessnesses apart from the ten powers, the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha, and so on.

original: chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad par bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku dang ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad par bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku dang ro gcig pa'o //
translated: Dwelling without distinction from the Dharma Body means being of one taste with the Dharma Body.

original: yon tan rgyas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yon tan re re la yon tan rgyas pa yod pa de nam mkha'i dpe byed pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan rgyas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yon tan re re la yon tan rgyas pa yod pa de nam mkha'i dpe byed pa'o //
translated: The example of space is made for the expansion of each of the qualities.

original: 'di'i don ni yon tan re re la yang yon tan rgyas par ci tsam yod pa de nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa de mtha' yas pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni yon tan re re la yang yon tan rgyas par ci tsam yod pa de nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa de mtha' yas pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that the expansion of each of the qualities is like space, and that is said to be infinite.

original: 'gro ba 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir chu bo ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir chu bo ni bzhi ste /
translated: The four rivers are:

original: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: the river of desire, the river of becoming, the river of views, and the river of ignorance.

original: de la 'dod pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu rtsa dgu ste 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal rnams re re la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis re re la rnam pa lnga lngar phye bas bco lnga dang /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu rtsa dgu ste 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal rnams re re la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis re re la rnam pa lnga lngar phye bas bco lnga dang /
translated: The river of desire has twenty nine substances: desire, anger and pride of the desire realm, each divided into five by the four truths seen by the path of seeing and the path of meditation.

original: the tshom bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis rnam pa bzhi dang / sngar bshad pa'i kun nas dkris pa bcu bsnan pas nyi shu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: the tshom bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis rnam pa bzhi dang / sngar bshad pa'i kun nas dkris pa bcu bsnan pas nyi shu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: Doubt has four aspects since it is abandoned by the path of seeing the four truths and the ten entanglements mentioned previously are added to make twenty nine.

original: srid pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu rtsa brgyad de /
analyzed: srid pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu rtsa brgyad de /
translated: The river of existence has twenty eight substances.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dag la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis re re la lnga lnga yin pas bcu dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yin pas nyi shu yin te /🔽de dag na khong khro med pas so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dag la bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis re re la lnga lnga yin pas bcu dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yin pas nyi shu yin te / de dag na khong khro med pas so //
translated: Similarly, since there are twenty in the formless realm,🔽there are forty.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag gi the tshom so sor bden pa bzhi mthong bas spong bar bya ba yin pas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag gi the tshom so sor bden pa bzhi mthong bas spong bar bya ba yin pas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur la /
translated: Doubt in the form and formless realms is abandoned by seeing the four truths.

original: de ltar na srid pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na srid pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus the river of existence has twenty-eight substances.

original: lta ba'i chu bo ni rdzas sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i chu bo ni rdzas sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: The river of view has thirty-six substances.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba lnga dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba gnyis dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba gnyis dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba gsum yin pas bcu gnyis su 'gyur @351a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba lnga dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba gnyis dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba gnyis dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba gsum yin pas bcu gnyis su 'gyur @351a * //
translated: There are twelve in the desire realm: five views abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, two abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, two abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation and three abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: ba dang ; de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yin pas lta ba bcu gnyis su ma 'gyur du byas pas lta ba'i chu bo rdzas sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ba dang ; de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yin pas lta ba bcu gnyis su ma 'gyur du byas pas lta ba'i chu bo rdzas sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, there are twelve in the form and formless realms. Thus, since they are not made into twelve views, the river of view is thirty six substances.

original: ma rig pa'i chu bo rdzas bco lnga ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i chu bo rdzas bco lnga ste /
translated: The river of ignorance is fifteen substances.

original: khams gsum gyi ma rig pa re re sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis rnam pa lnga lngar 'gyur bas ma rig pa'i chu bo rdzas bco lngar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi ma rig pa re re sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis rnam pa lnga lngar 'gyur bas ma rig pa'i chu bo rdzas bco lngar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Each of the three realms' ignorances is fivefold, because of being abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the truth of origination, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path, and because of being abandoned by cultivation. Thus, the river of ignorance is fifteen substances.

original: chu bo smos pa ni dge ba'i phyogs nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chu bo smos pa ni dge ba'i phyogs nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: The mention of the river is because it causes the degeneration of the side of virtue.

original: de ltar chu bo bzhi'i nang du chud pa'i 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar chu bo bzhi'i nang du chud pa'i 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: Thus, beings who are immersed in the four rivers

original: mgon med pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das las gzhan pa'i rje bo med pas so //
analyzed: mgon med pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das las gzhan pa'i rje bo med pas so //
translated: are without a protector, because they have no lord other than the Bhagavān.

original: mgon du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chu bo las 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgon du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chu bo las 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are protected, because they are led out of the river.

original: sa kun du 'od do zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi nyi ma shar ba'i kun nas 'od 'di la yod pas na'o //
analyzed: sa kun du 'od do zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi nyi ma shar ba'i kun nas 'od 'di la yod pas na'o //
translated: The ground is called the ground of Universal Radiance, because it has the universal radiance of the rising sun of the wisdom of the pure sphere of reality.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa lhag ma ma lus par spangs pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa lhag ma ma lus par spangs pas so //
translated: In every way means that all the remaining obscurations, together with their traces, are abandoned.

original: rgya bskyed pas chog go zhes bya ba ni yon tan rgyas par brjod pas chog go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgya bskyed pas chog go zhes bya ba ni yon tan rgyas par brjod pas chog go zhes pa'o //
translated: It is enough to expand upon it means that it is enough to expand upon the qualities.

original: gzugs kyi sku zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The form body is the body of perfect enjoyment.

original: ba spu'i bu ga re re dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ba spu'i bu ga re re la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par spyod pa ni sangs rgyas kho nas spyod pa ni sangs rgyas kho nas spyod kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes
