analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga re re dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ba spu'i bu ga re re la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par spyod pa ni sangs rgyas kho nas spyod pa ni sangs rgyas kho nas spyod kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes
translated: Each pore and so forth means that the special qualities that are experienced in each pore and so forth are experienced only by Buddhas, not by others.

original: pa'o // gal te gsungs na ni zhes bya ba ni ba spu'i bu ga la sogs par yon tan rgyas par brjod na'o //
analyzed: pa'o // gal te gsungs na ni zhes bya ba ni ba spu'i bu ga la sogs par yon tan rgyas par brjod na'o //
translated: If it were to be spoken of means if the expansion upon the qualities in the pores and so forth were to be spoken of.

original: rang nyid kyi ye shes yul du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rang nyid kyi ye shes kyi yul du gyur pa grangs kyi gnas gzhan drug cus yongs su bcad pa'i bskal pa chen po ni bskal pa grangs🔽med pa yin la /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi ye shes yul du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rang nyid kyi ye shes kyi yul du gyur pa grangs kyi gnas gzhan drug cus yongs su bcad pa'i bskal pa chen po ni bskal pa grangs med pa yin la /
translated: An eon that is beyond number is called “incalculable.”

original: bgrang ba las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhing /
analyzed: bgrang ba las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin zhing /
translated: Because it is beyond counting, it is called “inconceivable.”

original: de dag gis sku tshe'i tshad byin gyis brlabs pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa'i grangs med par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis sku tshe'i tshad byin gyis brlabs pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa'i grangs med par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The blessing of their life spans is that they remain for eons that are incalculable in number.

original: phrin las gzhan mi mnga' bar zhes bya ba ni bya ba gzhan mi mdzad par yon tan rgyas par brjod pa'i phrin las mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: phrin las gzhan mi mnga' bar zhes bya ba ni bya ba gzhan mi mdzad par yon tan rgyas par brjod pa'i phrin las mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “without any other activity” means that they do not engage in any other activity except for the activity of proclaiming the praises of the qualities of the buddhas.

original: skyen pa skyen par zhes bya ba ni shin tu myur ba'o //
analyzed: skyen pa skyen par zhes bya ba ni shin tu myur ba'o //
translated: The phrase “in a very short time” means “in a very brief time.”

original: yon @351b tan yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni yon tan mthar thug pa rgyas par brjod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon @351b tan yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni yon tan mthar thug pa rgyas par brjod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: If the qualities are not fully perfected, then the ultimate qualities are not described in detail.

original: don 'di nyid ces bya ba ni yon tan rgyas par brjod pa mthar thug par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ces bya ba ni yon tan rgyas par brjod pa mthar thug par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This very meaning is that the ultimate qualities are not described in detail.

original: nam mkha' med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha' med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the phrase “if space did not exist,” and so on,

original: 'dab chags zhes bya ba ni bya khyung yin la de nam mkha' med pas nam mkha' la 'phur ba las ldog par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dab chags zhes bya ba ni bya khyung yin la de nam mkha' med pas nam mkha' la 'phur ba las ldog par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: “bird” refers to a garuḍa. If space did not exist, then a garuḍa would not turn back from flying in the sky.

original: 'on kyang bya khyung 'di ni rang gi mthu ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bya khyung 'di ni rang gi mthu ste /
translated: However, this garuḍa turns back from flying in the sky due to the exhaustion of its power.

original: stobs zad pa'i sgo nas nam mkha' la 'phur ba las ldog pa de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams rang bzhin gyis mthu stobs zad pas sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa ma brjod par ldog par
analyzed: stobs zad pa'i sgo nas nam mkha' la 'phur ba las ldog pa de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams rang bzhin gyis mthu stobs zad pas sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa ma brjod par ldog par
translated: In the same way, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas turn back from describing the qualities of the buddhas, which are infinite like space, due to the exhaustion of their natural power.

original: 'gyur gyi yon tan gyi mthar thug pa las ni ma yin no //🔽de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur gyi yon tan gyi mthar thug pa las ni ma yin no // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: but not from the ultimate excellence of the translation.🔽In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus,

original: 'dab gshog yangs pa'i rlung gi shugs kyis pha rol gnon pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni gshog pa rgyas pa'i rlung gi stobs kyis skyed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab gshog yangs pa'i rlung gi shugs kyis pha rol gnon pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni gshog pa rgyas pa'i rlung gi stobs kyis skyed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par rnyed pa'o //
translated: having attained the power of crossing over by the force of the wind of the extensive wings,

original: rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'o //
translated: having attained the inconceivable liberation,🔽if he were to remain without turning back,

original: ldog par gnas na zhes bya ni yon tan brjod par mi byed cing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ldog par gnas na zhes bya ni yon tan brjod par mi byed cing gnas pa'o //
translated: if he were to remain without expressing his qualities,

original: rang sangs rgyas sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la nus pa med pa de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ji ltar nus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la nus pa med pa de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ji ltar nus zhes bya'o //
translated: how could the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do that, in which the bodhisattvas have no power?

original: lo rab 'di zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan brjod pa mi srid pa'i lo rgyus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lo rab 'di zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan brjod pa mi srid pa'i lo rgyus gang yin pa'o //
translated: The year is the story of the impossibility of describing the qualities of the disciples, hermit buddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin pas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin pas so //
translated: The perfectly concealed is the unerring nature of the Transcendent Destroyers, because it is extremely concealed.

original: bdag 'dres zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: bdag 'dres zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: The I, a confused person is an ordinary being.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni yon tan rnams so //
translated: The these are the qualities.

original: dogs spangs zhes bya ba ni kho bos yon tan ji ltar brjod par nus snyam pa'i som nyi spangs nas so //
analyzed: dogs spangs zhes bya ba ni kho bos yon tan ji ltar brjod par nus snyam pa'i som nyi spangs nas so //
translated: The abandoning of doubt is the abandonment of the doubt, How can I describe the qualities?

original: cung zhig tsam zhig smras zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu'i phyogs tsam zhig brjod pa'o //
analyzed: cung zhig tsam zhig smras zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu'i phyogs tsam zhig brjod pa'o //
translated: The just a little bit is the expression of just a portion of the ten powers.

original: khyod kyi ngo bo nyid mi shes na ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: khyod kyi ngo bo nyid mi shes na ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If you do not know his nature, how can you describe him?

original: 'on kyang de dag @352a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag @352a * //
translated: Nevertheless, they

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis bshad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis bshad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because it is explained by the noble Nāgārjuna.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis stobs bcu bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis stobs bcu bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the noble Nāgārjuna explained the ten powers,

original: kho bos kyang de'i rjes su 'brangs nas bshad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kho bos kyang de'i rjes su 'brangs nas bshad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: I have also explained them following him.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gzhan la brten nas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhabs la brten nas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gzhan la brten nas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhabs la brten nas so //
translated: Thus,🔽depending on others,

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan la brten nas so //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan la brten nas so //
translated: that very thing🔽is not perceived by oneself.

original: da ni bstan bcos 'di'i bsdus pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bstan bcos 'di'i bsdus pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the summarized meaning of this treatise, he says,

original: mdor bsdus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'di las zhes bya ba ni dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bstan bcos las so //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'di las zhes bya ba ni dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bstan bcos las so //
translated: In brief,🔽in this,🔽the qualities of the buddhas are explained.

original: yon tan rgya che ba nyid dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan mchog tu gyur pas so //
analyzed: yon tan rgya che ba nyid dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan mchog tu gyur pas so //
translated: The qualities of the buddhas are explained in this treatise on the middle way.🔽The qualities of the buddhas are explained in this treatise on the middle way.

original: chos nyid zab pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid khong du chud par dka' bas so //
analyzed: chos nyid zab pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid khong du chud par dka' bas so //
translated: The so-called profundity of reality is due to the difficulty of comprehending reality.

original: yon tan gzhan rnams zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yon tan gzhan rnams zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The other qualities are generosity, morality, and so forth.

original: de'i phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the benefits of that,

original: zab pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zab pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “profundity,” and so forth.

original: stong pa nyid dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin shes pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin shes pas /
translated: By knowing the nature of emptiness and generosity, and so forth,

original: stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: one will attain the qualities such as the ten powers.

original: de ltar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the enjoyment body,

original: sprul pa'i sku bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the emanation body,

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “that,” and so forth.

original: sprul pa'i sku de zhes bya ba ni thams cad nas thams cad du 'khor ba ji srid pa dang / nam mkha' ji srid par dus ji lta bar bsams pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can ma lus pa'i mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i las grub pa'i rgyur gyur pa gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa mdzad pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku de zhes bya ba ni thams cad nas thams cad du 'khor ba ji srid pa dang / nam mkha' ji srid par dus ji lta bar bsams pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can ma lus pa'i mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i las grub pa'i rgyur gyur pa gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa mdzad pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The emanation body is so-called because it is the nature of the performance of the abundant benefit of others, the cause for the accomplishment of the high status and definite goodness of all sentient beings, for as long as cyclic existence lasts, for as long as space remains, in whatever way is desired, and in whatever way is thought.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi don thun mong ba dang zhes bya ba ni de rnams thams cad kyis mthong ba'i spyod yul du gyur pas so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi don thun mong ba dang zhes bya ba ni de rnams thams cad kyis mthong ba'i spyod yul du gyur pas so //
translated: The common aim of all śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas is so-called because it is the sphere of vision of all of them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: thabs thun mong ba 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thabs thun mong ba 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the common method arises.

original: des chos bstan pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des chos bstan pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because through that teaching of the Dharma, the result is attained.

original: ci rigs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gang gang la mos pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gang gang la mos pa bzhin du'o //
translated: As is appropriate is in accordance with whatever is believed.

original: bde 'gro la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la @352b sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la @352b sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Happy rebirth” and so on. The word “and so on” includes the fruit of stream-entry and so on.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sems can gyi don mdzad nas sprul pa'i skus kyang sems can gyis don mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus sems can gyi don mdzad nas sprul pa'i skus kyang sems can gyis don mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Again” means that after the Enjoyment Body has worked for the welfare of sentient beings, the Emanation Body also works for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: srid pa gsum du byon nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su byon nas so //🔽mi g-yo sku mnga' khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srid pa gsum du byon nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su byon nas so // mi g-yo sku mnga' khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having come to the three worlds” means having come to the desire, form, and formless worlds.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i chos kyi sku mnga' bas so //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i chos kyi sku mnga' bas so //
translated: “You, who have an immovable body” means that you have the Dharma Body, which is not subject to change.

original: gshegs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas so //
analyzed: gshegs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas so //
translated: “Having come” means having come from the Tuṣita heaven.

original: bltams pa zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i rigs su sku 'khrungs pa'o //
analyzed: bltams pa zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i rigs su sku 'khrungs pa'o //
translated: “Having been born” means having been born in the Śākya clan.

original: byang chub ces bya ba ni yul ma ga dh'a ra byang chub kyi shing drung du'o //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba ni yul ma ga dh'a ra byang chub kyi shing drung du'o //
translated: “Enlightenment” means under the Bodhi tree in the land of Magadha.

original: zhi ba'i zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa dag gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa dag gi rgyu'o //
translated: The peaceful is the cause of the high and the good.

original: 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The wheel is the wheel of the Dharma.

original: sna tshogs spyod ldan zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sna tshogs spyod ldan zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The various practices are through passion and so on.

original: re ba'i zhags pa ni /🔽mang pos bcings pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa sna tshogs pa nyid zhags pa yin te /
analyzed: re ba'i zhags pa ni / mang pos bcings pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa sna tshogs pa nyid zhags pa yin te /
translated: The many fetters are the bonds of hope.

original: de'i sgo nas 'khor ba las grol bar mi 'gyur bas so //🔽de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas 'khor ba las grol bar mi 'gyur bas so // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The various cravings are the bonds, because one does not become liberated from cyclic existence through them.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says, The Lord... and so on.

original: khams gsum las 'das su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs kyang ngo //🔽sras la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khams gsum las 'das su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs kyang ngo // sras la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Although he has transcended the three realms, he has abandoned the afflictions of the three realms together with their traces.🔽The sons and so on are the sons and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni btsun mo la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni btsun mo la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The and so on includes the queens and so on.

original: 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdul bya rnams dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdul bya rnams dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: In accordance with the world means in accordance with those to be trained.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis yab yum dang sras la sogs pa dang 'brel par ma bstan na de'i tshe mir gyur pa byang chub mi thob par dogs nas 'ga' yang byang chub kyi lam la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba dang / sh'akya'i rigs rnams kyang rjes su ma bzung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis yab yum dang sras la sogs pa dang 'brel par ma bstan na de'i tshe mir gyur pa byang chub mi thob par dogs nas 'ga' yang byang chub kyi lam la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba dang / sh'akya'i rigs rnams kyang rjes su ma bzung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: If the Lord had not taught in connection with father, mother, son, and so on, then fearing that humans would not attain enlightenment, no one would enter the path to enlightenment, and the Sakya clan would not have been accepted.

original: ji ltar 'tsham pa'i chos ston par 'jug pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'tsham pa'i chos ston par 'jug pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: In accordance with the Dharma to be taught means teaching the Dharma in accordance with those who practice desire.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i rnam par gzhag pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi rnam gzhag byas nas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i rnam par gzhag pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi rnam gzhag byas nas so //
translated: Having established the Tathagata's body means having established the three bodies.

original: theg pa ni gcig yin la zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'gro bas na theg pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa ni gcig yin la zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'gro bas na theg pa ste /
translated: The vehicle is one means that by which one goes is the vehicle.

original: thar bar 'gro ba'i thabs yin la de yang gcig kho na ste /🔽'chad par @353a * //
analyzed: thar bar 'gro ba'i thabs yin la de yang gcig kho na ste / 'chad par @353a * //
translated: It is the means for going to liberation, and it is just one.

original: 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis gzhan mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis gzhan mi rigs pas so //
translated: Because it is not reasonable for there to be another, as will be explained.

original: theg pa gsum bstan pa ni zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum bstan pa ni zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the three vehicles refers to the teaching of the śrāvaka vehicle, the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and the Great Vehicle.

original: dgongs pa can nyid ces bya ba ni gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos nas bstan pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa can nyid ces bya ba ni gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos nas bstan pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The statement “they are intentional” means that the teaching is made in consideration of the inclinations of those to be trained, but not ultimately.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: gang gi phyir 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Because here, etc.”

original: de nyid shes las zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du shes pa las so //🔽dri ma mtha' dag sel ba ni lhur byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid shes las zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du shes pa las so // dri ma mtha' dag sel ba ni lhur byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: “From the knowledge of reality” means from the knowledge that things are of the nature of emptiness.

original: bag chags dang bcad pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba la nan tan du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcad pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba la nan tan du byed pa'o //
translated: “Striving to remove all stains” means assiduously eliminating the afflictions together with their propensities.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid mi shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid mi shes pa rnams so //
translated: “Others” refers to those who do not know the reality of things.

original: chos rnams de nyid kyi rnam 'gyur dbye ba la'ang ston min zhing zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni gzhan du rnam par mi 'gyur zhing de la dbye ba'ang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams de nyid kyi rnam 'gyur dbye ba la'ang ston min zhing zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni gzhan du rnam par mi 'gyur zhing de la dbye ba'ang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Nor is the transformation of the reality of things differentiated” means that the reality of things, which has the characteristic of emptiness, does not transform into something else and is not differentiated.

original: gal te rnam 'gyur ram dbye ba yod na ni de'i tshe theg pa tha dad pa yod par 'gyur ba las de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam 'gyur ram dbye ba yod na ni de'i tshe theg pa tha dad pa yod par 'gyur ba las de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If there were a transformation or differentiation, then there would be different vehicles, but that is not the case.

original: de nyid yul blo gros 'di yang zhes bya ba la 'di yang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi yul can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid yul blo gros 'di yang zhes bya ba la 'di yang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi yul can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: “This mind that has that as its object” refers to the consciousness that has emptiness as its object.

original: tha dad 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid la dbye ba med pas shes pa la dbye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid la dbye ba med pas shes pa la dbye ba med pa'o //
translated: “It is not differentiated” means that because there is no differentiation in reality, there is no differentiation in consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na mi mnyam pa ste de dang mtshungs pa gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na mi mnyam pa ste de dang mtshungs pa gzhan med pas so //
translated: “It is unequalled” because there is nothing else that is similar to it.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says,

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Whoever” and so on.

original: de kho na nyid mi shes pa des zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yongs su mi shes pas so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mi shes pa des zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yongs su mi shes pas so //
translated: “By that one who does not know reality” means by one who does not fully understand emptiness.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ma lus par spang bar mi nus la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnams spong bar mi nus pa ste /🔽dngos po yod na rnam rtog 'byung //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ma lus par spang bar mi nus la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnams spong bar mi nus pa ste / dngos po yod na rnam rtog 'byung //
translated: “One is not able to eliminate the afflictions without remainder” means one is not able to eliminate the afflictions together with their latent tendencies.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //🔽sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so // sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because, as it is said, “If there is an entity, conceptualization arises.”

original: snod kyi dbye bas nam mkha' la dbye ba med pa ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snod kyi dbye bas nam mkha' la dbye ba med pa ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “This has been explained previously” refers to the passage, “Just as space is undifferentiated, because it is not the case that it has difference, in the same way, this reality is undifferentiated, because it is not the case that it has difference.”

original: mthong ba tha dad kyi zhes bya ba ni mthong ba du ma yod pas so //
analyzed: mthong ba tha dad kyi zhes bya ba ni mthong ba du ma yod pas so //
translated: “Because of the difference in their vision” means because of the existence of many different visions.

original: de la dbye ba med pas zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi de kho na nyid la'o //
analyzed: de la dbye ba med pas zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi de kho na nyid la'o //
translated: “Because of its undifferentiability” means because of its nature of non-arising.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin @353b can gyi de kho na nyid la rnam 'gyur dang dbye ba bya bar mi nus pas de kho na nyid kyi yul can shes pa yang de kho na yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin @353b can gyi de kho na nyid la rnam 'gyur dang dbye ba bya bar mi nus pas de kho na nyid kyi yul can shes pa yang de kho na yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the reality that has the nature of emptiness cannot be diversified or differentiated, the consciousness that has reality as its object is also just that.🔽In order to teach this, he says,

original: 'di ltar ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Thus, the wisdom that is called ‘the wisdom of the buddhas’ is the wisdom of the buddhas.”

original: rang bzhin ci ltar gnas pa bzhin ma rtogs pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin ci ltar gnas pa bzhin ma rtogs pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Because of not understanding the way things exist” means

original: rang bzhin gcig tu gnas pa'i stong pa nyid khong du ma chud pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig tu gnas pa'i stong pa nyid khong du ma chud pas so //
translated: because of not comprehending emptiness, which exists as a single nature.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach the summary, he says,🔽“Therefore, Kāśyapa, the wisdom of the buddhas is not the wisdom of the buddhas.”

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽'od srungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽'od srungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the source of the sūtra, he says,🔽“Kāśyapa, the wisdom of the buddhas is the wisdom of the buddhas.”

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa nyid yod pa de khong du chud na'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa nyid yod pa de khong du chud na'o //
translated: If one realizes that all phenomena are the same, then, having understood that all phenomena are the same in being empty by nature,

original: des na gang theg pa gsum gyi rnam gzhag mdzad pa de ni byis pa rnams gzhug pa'i don du gsungs pa yin gyi nges pa'i don rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang theg pa gsum gyi rnam gzhag mdzad pa de ni byis pa rnams gzhug pa'i don du gsungs pa yin gyi nges pa'i don rnams ma yin no //
translated: one will not make distinctions among the three vehicles. Therefore, the presentation of the three vehicles is taught for the purpose of introducing the childish, but it is not for those of definitive meaning.

original: de ltar yang lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: Thus, the Descent into Laṅkā says:

original: byis pa rnams ni drang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni drang ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to guide the childish,

original: nga yis theg pa'i dbye ba brjod //
analyzed: nga yis theg pa'i dbye ba brjod //
translated: I have spoken of the division of vehicles.

original: theg pa rnam gzhag yod ma yin //
analyzed: theg pa rnam gzhag yod ma yin //
translated: There is no presentation of vehicles;

original: nga yis theg pa gcig tu brjod //🔽zhes gsungs pa'o //🔽tshogs chung ngu bsags pa nyid dang / tshogs chad med pa bsags pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi theg pa la dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nga yis theg pa gcig tu brjod // zhes gsungs pa'o // tshogs chung ngu bsags pa nyid dang / tshogs chad med pa bsags pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi theg pa la dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: I have spoken of a single vehicle.

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is presented as the accumulation of a small collection and the accumulation of a continuous collection, but there is no division of vehicles because there is no division in the dharmadhātu.

original: de ni 'jug pa'i sgo bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa'i sgo bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the entrance.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis /
translated: Thus, the noble Nagarjuna says:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
translated: Because there is no division in the ultimate realm,

original: khyed la theg pa'i dbye ba med //
analyzed: khyed la theg pa'i dbye ba med //
translated: there is no division of vehicles for you.

original: theg pa gsum du bstan pa ni //🔽sems can rnams ni gzhug phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa gsum du bstan pa ni // sems can rnams ni gzhug phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of three vehicles

original: zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: is for the purpose of introducing sentient beings.

original: de na gang chos kyi dbyings mtshungs pa yin pas nyan thos la sogs pa chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pas theg pa ni gcig kho na yin te /
analyzed: de na gang chos kyi dbyings mtshungs pa yin pas nyan thos la sogs pa chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pas theg pa ni gcig kho na yin te /
translated: There, because of the sameness of the ultimate realm, the vehicle of the sravakas and so on is one vehicle, because there is no difference in the ultimate realm of the sravakas and so on.

original: bgrod par bya ba yin pas na theg pa yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag med pa nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba yin pas na theg pa yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag med pa nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: It is a vehicle because it is to be traversed, and because of the sameness of selflessness.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag gi dngos po med pa nyid mtshungs pas theg pa gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag gi dngos po med pa nyid mtshungs pas theg pa gcig nyid yin te /
translated: The vehicle of the sravakas and so on is one vehicle because the nonexistence of a self is the same for them.

original: 'di bgrod pas na theg pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di bgrod pas na theg pa yin pas so //
translated: It is a vehicle because it is to be traversed.

original: rnam par grol ba mtshungs pas na theg pa gcig yin te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mtshungs pas na theg pa gcig yin te /
translated: It is one vehicle because of the sameness of liberation.

original: @354a * // bgrod pas na theg pa yin pas so //
analyzed: @354a * // bgrod pas na theg pa yin pas so //
translated: Because it is a vehicle since it conveys one to the result.

original: gal te theg pa gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin na /
analyzed: gal te theg pa gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin na /
translated: If the teaching of three vehicles is intentional,🔽then the teaching of one vehicle is also intentional.

original: de ltar theg pa gcig bstan pa yang dgongs pa can yin no zhes lung bstan pa kha cig gis brjod pas na theg pa gcig tu bstan pa de dran pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba de bde na zhing mtshungs par 'dod na /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa gcig bstan pa yang dgongs pa can yin no zhes lung bstan pa kha cig gis brjod pas na theg pa gcig tu bstan pa de dran pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba de bde na zhing mtshungs par 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that the teaching of one vehicle is similar to the teaching of three vehicles,

original: 'o na sh'a ri'i bu khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas padma'i 'od ces bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i gzhung dang 'gal ba yin te des gnod do //
analyzed: 'o na sh'a ri'i bu khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas padma'i 'od ces bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i gzhung dang 'gal ba yin te des gnod do //
translated: then it contradicts the text of the Lotus Sūtra, which states, “Śāriputra, in the future you will become the perfect buddha called Padmottama.”

original: 'on kyang gdul bya'i dbang gis theg pa gsum du bstan pa de la gzhug pa'i thabs kyi don ngo bo nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang gdul bya'i dbang gis theg pa gsum du bstan pa de la gzhug pa'i thabs kyi don ngo bo nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: However, in order to introduce those disciples to the teaching of three vehicles, which is taught due to the power of disciples, the Buddha taught the essence of the method of introduction.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa gcig bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes lung kha cig las gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa gcig bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes lung kha cig las gsungs pa ste /
translated: Some scriptures say that the teaching of one vehicle by the Bhagavat is intentional.

original: de ltar gdul bya rnams kyi mos pa tha dad par de rnams gzhug pa'i don du thabs kyi mdzad pa'o zhes chos bcu pa'i mdo la sogs par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gdul bya rnams kyi mos pa tha dad par de rnams gzhug pa'i don du thabs kyi mdzad pa'o zhes chos bcu pa'i mdo la sogs par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, in the Sūtra on the Ten Topics and so forth, it is said that the deeds of the methods are for the purpose of engaging those trainees who have different aspirations.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa gsum gsungs pa ni gdul bya la ltos pa'i thabs tsam yin gyi dngos po la bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa gsum gsungs pa ni gdul bya la ltos pa'i thabs tsam yin gyi dngos po la bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement by the Bhagavat that there are three vehicles is merely a method that depends on trainees; it is not true in fact.

original: zhes shes pa'i theg pa chen po'i rigs can gyi gdul bya rnams de la gzhug par mi nus te /
analyzed: zhes shes pa'i theg pa chen po'i rigs can gyi gdul bya rnams de la gzhug par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, trainees who have the Mahāyāna lineage cannot be engaged by that teaching.

original: rigs pas gnod pas so //
analyzed: rigs pas gnod pas so //
translated: It is undermined by reasoning.

original: des na lung kha cig las theg pa gcig tu gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes 'byung ba 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'phags pa byams pas mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: des na lung kha cig las theg pa gcig tu gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes 'byung ba 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'phags pa byams pas mdo sde rgyan las /
translated: Therefore, following the statement in some scriptures that the teaching of one vehicle is intentional, the ārya Maitreya says in the Ornament for the Mahāyāna Sūtras:

original: theg pa gcig tu gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes gdul bya kha cig gzhug pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin gyi de ltar dngos po la dgongs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: theg pa gcig tu gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes gdul bya kha cig gzhug pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin gyi de ltar dngos po la dgongs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The statement of one vehicle is intentional. It was stated with the intention of introducing some disciples, but it is not the case that it is intentional in reality.

original: de ltar dgongs pa can nyid du bstan pa de la dgongs pa yod pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dgongs pa can nyid du bstan pa de la dgongs pa yod pa nyid yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught to be intentional, and it does have an underlying thought.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom Sūtras say:

original: nyan thos kyi dbang du mdzad nas gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa mdzad pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la ngas bar du gcod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dbang du mdzad nas gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa mdzad pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la ngas bar du gcod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: “If they generate the mind of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment, I will not obstruct their roots of virtue.”

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin rgyal po'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin rgyal po'i mdo las /
translated: Similarly, the King of Samādhi Sūtra says:

original: 'gro rnams thams cad sangs rgyas nyid 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: 'gro rnams thams cad sangs rgyas nyid 'gyur gyi //
translated: All migrating beings will become buddhas.

original: 'di na snod mdo @354b sems can 'ga' yang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di na snod mdo @354b sems can 'ga' yang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
translated: There are no sentient beings in this world who are not vessels.

original: 'di ni dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba ma lus pa rnams la sangs rgyas nyid du rung ba nyid yod pa yin no zhes bshad par 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba ma lus pa rnams la sangs rgyas nyid du rung ba nyid yod pa yin no zhes bshad par 'os pa yin no //
translated: This is appropriate, because the defilements are adventitious, because the mind is pure by nature, and because all living beings have the capacity for buddhahood.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo rnams las sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can zhes gsungs pa 'dis thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi go 'phang thob par rung ba nyid yongs su gsal bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo rnams las sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can zhes gsungs pa 'dis thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi go 'phang thob par rung ba nyid yongs su gsal bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One has said in the sutras that all living beings have the essence of the Tathagata. This clearly shows that all have the capacity to attain the state of supreme enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal gyis kyang theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal gyis kyang theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma nas /
translated: And the noble Maitreya, in the Supreme Continuum of the Great Vehicle, says:

original: thams cad la ni khyad med kyang //
analyzed: thams cad la ni khyad med kyang //
translated: Although there is no difference in the basic element,

original: de bzhin nyid ni dag gyur pa //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni dag gyur pa //
translated: the suchness that is pure,

original: de bzhin gshegs nyid de yi phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs nyid de yi phyir //
translated: it is the tathagatas themselves

original: lus can mtha' dag de snying can //
analyzed: lus can mtha' dag de snying can //
translated: who possess the essence of beings.

original: zhes pa 'dis kyang theg pa gcig nyid du gsungs pa yin no //🔽bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis kyang theg pa gcig nyid du gsungs pa yin no // bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: This also teaches that there is only one vehicle.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgom pas nyon mongs pa spong gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du bsgom pas nyon mongs pa spong gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The Sūtra on Entering the Two Realities also teaches that afflictions are abandoned by meditating on the absence of intrinsic existence of all phenomena, but not by other means:

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The root of all afflictions is the adherence to things.

original: de ltar yang 'jam dpal ji ltar na nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar na yongs su shes par 'gyur /🔽'jam dpal gyis gsol ba don dam pa shin tu skye ba med cing 'byung ba med pa'i dngos po'i chos thams cad la kun rdzob tu phyin ci log tu zhen pa las kun du rtog cing rnam par rtog pa de las tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la
analyzed: de ltar yang 'jam dpal ji ltar na nyon mongs pa rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar na yongs su shes par 'gyur / 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba don dam pa shin tu skye ba med cing 'byung ba med pa'i dngos po'i chos thams cad la kun rdzob tu phyin ci log tu zhen pa las kun du rtog cing rnam par rtog pa de las tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la
translated: Thus, Mañjuśrī, how are the afflictions tamed? How are they thoroughly known?

original: byed pa 'byung zhing de las bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa 'byung la /
analyzed: byed pa 'byung zhing de las bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa 'byung la /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied, “The ultimate is utterly unborn and non-arisen. All things are devoid of intrinsic existence. But due to the mistaken adherence to the conventional, there is imagination and conceptualization. From that, there is incorrect mental activity. From that, there is the superimposition of a self.

original: de las lta ba kun nas ldang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las lta ba kun nas ldang bar 'gyur la /
translated: From that, the view arises.

original: de las nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las nyon mongs pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, the afflictions engage.

original: lha'i bu gang don dam par skye ba med cing 'byung ba med pa'i chos thams cad de rab tu shes pa'i tshul gyis rab tu shes pa gang de ni don dam par phyin ci ma log pa med cing rnam par grol ba dang bral ba de ni tshul🔽bzhin du yid la byed pa yin la /
analyzed: lha'i bu gang don dam par skye ba med cing 'byung ba med pa'i chos thams cad de rab tu shes pa'i tshul gyis rab tu shes pa gang de ni don dam par phyin ci ma log pa med cing rnam par grol ba dang bral ba de ni tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa yin la /
translated: “Divine son, the one who, in the ultimate sense, knows all phenomena to be unborn and non-arisen through the method of knowing them is, in the ultimate sense, unmistaken, free from error, and free from liberation and bondage. That is proper mental engagement.

original: de la don dam pa med par sgro 'dogs par mi 'gyur zhing lta ba dang ldang bar mi 'gyur skye ba med pa de la nyon mongs pa rnams mthong ba med pa'i tshul gyis na shin tu dul bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la don dam pa med par sgro 'dogs par mi 'gyur zhing lta ba dang ldang bar mi 'gyur skye ba med pa de la nyon mongs pa rnams mthong ba med pa'i tshul gyis na shin tu dul bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: In that, there is no superimposition of the ultimate, and the view does not arise. The afflictions should be seen as completely subdued in that non-arising, in the manner of not seeing them.

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa rnams snang ba med pa'i shes @355a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa rnams snang ba med pa'i shes @355a * //
translated: When the afflictions are not seen,

original: rab kyi ye shes kyi don dam par dngos po rnams shin tu stong pa dang / shin tu mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam par skye ba med par mi shes pa'i tshul gyis rab tu shes pa de'i tshe lha'i bu dag nyon mongs pa rab tu mi shes pa'i tshul gyis yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab kyi ye shes kyi don dam par dngos po rnams shin tu stong pa dang / shin tu mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam par skye ba med par mi shes pa'i tshul gyis rab tu shes pa de'i tshe lha'i bu dag nyon mongs pa rab tu mi shes pa'i tshul gyis yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
translated: The sons of the gods, when they know the ultimate, which is the emptiness of all things, the signlessness of all things, the ultimate non-production of all things, in the manner of not knowing, then they know the afflictions in the manner of not knowing.

original: dper na gang sprul la rig sngags brjod pa de'i tshe dug zhi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs shin tu rab tu mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su shes pa de'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na gang sprul la rig sngags brjod pa de'i tshe dug zhi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs shin tu rab tu mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su shes pa de'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when one recites a spell over poison, at that time the poison is pacified. In the same way, when one knows the afflictions in the manner of not apprehending the class of the afflictions at all, then the afflictions are pacified.

original: lha'i bu gang yang shin tu skye ba med cing 'byung ba med pa dngos po med pa'i chos thams cad la yang dag par rtog pa 'di'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lha'i bu gang yang shin tu skye ba med cing 'byung ba med pa dngos po med pa'i chos thams cad la yang dag par rtog pa 'di'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The sons of the gods, whoever has the idea that non-production and non-occurrence are all things that are non-existent, for them the class of the afflictions is just that.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi dra ba 'byung ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can yin pas de'i gnyen po phyogs su gyur ba dge ba'i grong khyer du 'jug par byed pa'i shes
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi dra ba 'byung ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba can yin pas de'i gnyen po phyogs su gyur ba dge ba'i grong khyer du 'jug par byed pa'i shes
translated: Since the arising of the net of the afflictions of afflictions, actions, and birth have as their root the adherence to things, the one who seeks that which is the antidote to that, the entrance into the city of virtue, should rely on the complete abandonment of all the conceptions of bad paths.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po ma lus pa rnams stong pa nyid du sgom pa gcig nyid kho na de don du gnyer ba rnams kyis lam ngan pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ril dor ba la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po ma lus pa rnams stong pa nyid du sgom pa gcig nyid kho na de don du gnyer ba rnams kyis lam ngan pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ril dor ba la brten par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which is the meditation on the emptiness of all things without exception, is the one path.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi theg pa gcig tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi theg pa gcig tu grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the establishment of the single vehicle is for those who are of the nature of the Great Vehicle.

original: thegs chen po'i tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thegs chen po'i tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the term “Great Vehicle,”

original: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Great Vehicle,” and so on.

original: chen po nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chen po nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason for being “great,”🔽he says “because it is the cause of the great result,” and so on.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement ignorance, and so on, is made.

original: ma rig pa ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the complete abandonment of ignorance refers to the abandonment of the imprints of ignorance.

original: de rnams kyi lam theg pa'o //🔽bri sha au dha ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽rgya gar skad du /🔽theg pa chen po zhes bya ba de ma ha ta y'a na zhes bya ba yod la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi lam theg pa'o // bri sha au dha ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / rgya gar skad du / theg pa chen po zhes bya ba de ma ha ta y'a na zhes bya ba yod la /
translated: The path of those is the vehicle.🔽The statement the great vehicle, and so on, is made.🔽In the Indian language, it is called mahāyāna.

original: de la ta la aa byas nas ma h'a y'a na zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la ta la aa byas nas ma h'a y'a na zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: The word mahāyāna is formed from the words mahā and yāna.

original: de la ta'i gnas su aa ci ltar 'ong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la ta'i gnas su aa ci ltar 'ong bar 'gyur /
translated: How can the letter a come to be in the place of the letter t?

original: de la len ni /
analyzed: de la len ni /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: bri sha au dha ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi nang du 'di yang yod pas ta'i gnas su aa yang rigs pas so //🔽theg pa chen po'i bshad pa gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bri sha au dha ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi nang du 'di yang yod pas ta'i gnas su aa yang rigs pas so // theg pa chen po'i bshad pa gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since this is also found within the words briśa audhara, and so on, the letter a in the place of the letter t is also reasonable.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach another explanation of the great vehicle, it is said alternatively, and so on.

original: theg pa yang de @355b yin la chen po yang de yin pas theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: theg pa yang de @355b yin la chen po yang de yin pas theg pa chen po ste /
translated: It is a vehicle and it is great, thus it is the Great Vehicle.

original: lam chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the great path.

original: chen po nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chen po nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason for being great,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the buddhas,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas rnams der bzhugs pa'i phyir lam chen po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas rnams der bzhugs pa'i phyir lam chen po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because the buddhas, who possess inconceivable wisdom, dwell there, it is called the great path.

original: dper na rgyal po'i pho brang la chen po zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i pho brang la chen po zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the expression “great palace” for the king’s palace.

original: rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason,

original: dngos po rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “because it has as its object the infinite divisions of things,” and so on.

original: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i dbye bas mtha' yas pa'i dbye ba dang ldan pa'i 'dus byas la sogs pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i dbye bas mtha' yas pa'i dbye ba dang ldan pa'i 'dus byas la sogs pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: It has as its object conditioned phenomena, and so on, which have infinite divisions by way of the divisions of the aggregates, constituents, and so on.

original: stong pa nyid kyis sgo nas dngos po thams cad dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis sgo nas dngos po thams cad dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po yin te /
translated: It is a thing because of the observation of all things by means of emptiness.

original: ci ltar nam mkha' dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pas chen po nyid ces brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar nam mkha' dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pas chen po nyid ces brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as space is called “great” because it pervades all things.

original: yang chen po nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi shes pa ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang chen po nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi shes pa ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, in order to teach the reason for its greatness, he says, “the complete absence of all ignorance,” and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir theg pa chen po nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir theg pa chen po nyid ces bya ste /
translated: It is called the “Great Vehicle” because it abandons the afflictions together with their latent tendencies.

original: stobs dang ldan pa dgra las rgyal ba las chen po nyid thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa dgra las rgyal ba las chen po nyid thob pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as one who is powerful obtains the title “great” because of conquering his enemies.

original: de la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to anticipate the doubts of others, he says, “If it is the case,” and so on.

original: theg pa dang lam dag gcig yin pa'i phyir bgrod par bya bas na thog ba ste /
analyzed: theg pa dang lam dag gcig yin pa'i phyir bgrod par bya bas na thog ba ste /
translated: The vehicle and the path are the same, and because it is to be traversed, it is a vehicle.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la brjod la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la brjod la /
translated: It is said to be nirvana.

original: de ni gcig kho na yin pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'da' bar bstan pas de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni gcig kho na yin pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'da' bar bstan pas de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since there is only one, it would contradict the Transcendent Lord's teaching of nirvana in the Hearers' and Solitary Realizers' Vehicles.

original: 'dir theg pa gsum bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes bshad pa'i sgo nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa gsum bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes bshad pa'i sgo nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To answer this, the text explains that the teaching of three vehicles is intentional.

original: bstan pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To this end, it says, This teaching...

original: bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaching is the teaching of three vehicles.

original: dgongs pa can zhes bya ba ni gdul bya la ltos nas bstan pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa can zhes bya ba ni gdul bya la ltos nas bstan pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is intentional, meaning that it is taught in terms of disciples, but not ultimately.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To demonstrate just this, it says, Because... and so on.

original: snyigs ma zhes bya ba ni tshigs ma'o //
analyzed: snyigs ma zhes bya ba ni tshigs ma'o //
translated: Contaminants are impurities.

original: de yang lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang lnga ste /
translated: They are five:

original: sems can gyi snyigs ma dang / bskal pa'i snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs @356a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi snyigs ma dang / bskal pa'i snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs @356a * //
translated: the impurity of sentient beings, the impurity of the eon, the impurity of afflictions,

original: pa'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / tshe'i snyigs ma rnams dang / de ltar snyigs ma ci yang rung ba bzhin du sems can rnams snyigs ma lngas don dam pa'i ye shes la mi rung ba nyid kyis snyigs ma zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / tshe'i snyigs ma rnams dang / de ltar snyigs ma ci yang rung ba bzhin du sems can rnams snyigs ma lngas don dam pa'i ye shes la mi rung ba nyid kyis snyigs ma zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The five degenerations are the degeneration of life, the degeneration of sentient beings, the degeneration of afflictions, the degeneration of view, and the degeneration of the kalpa.

original: de la sems can gyi snyigs ma ni lus kyi tshad chung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems can gyi snyigs ma ni lus kyi tshad chung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of sentient beings is the smallness of the body, and so on.

original: bskal pa'i snyigs ma ni char ches pa dang chung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa'i snyigs ma ni char ches pa dang chung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of the kalpa is excessive or deficient rainfall, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma ni nyon mongs pa rnams bdo ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma ni nyon mongs pa rnams bdo ba'o //
translated: The degeneration of afflictions is the intensity of the afflictions.

original: lta ba'i snyigs ma ni lta ba rnams shas che ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i snyigs ma ni lta ba rnams shas che ba'o //
translated: The degeneration of view is the predominance of wrong views.

original: 'di dag ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: These are from the point of view of householders and monks.

original: tshe'i snyigs ma ni tshe thung ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshe'i snyigs ma ni tshe thung ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The degeneration of life is the shortness of life.

original: de na rgyu gang gis 'gro ba rnams la snyigs ma lnga yod pa de'i phyir gting zab pa ste /
analyzed: de na rgyu gang gis 'gro ba rnams la snyigs ma lnga yod pa de'i phyir gting zab pa ste /
translated: There, by whatever cause the five degenerations exist in the world, therefore it is profound.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi lam la 'jug pa mi 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi lam la 'jug pa mi 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should supply, “the entry into the path having the characteristic of emptiness does not occur.”

original: gting zab pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gting zab pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its profundity?

original: sangs rgyas spyod yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyod yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “the domain of the Buddhas,” etc.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzigs pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzigs pas so //
translated: The Buddhas see it in a manner free from conceptualization.

original: snyigs ma ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: snyigs ma ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its corruption?

original: nyes pa skyed byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nyes pa skyed byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He says, “the source of error,” etc.

original: nyon mongs pa bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the cause for the generation of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams shas che bar 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams shas che bar 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the afflictions are engaged in a manner that is very powerful,

original: de rnams ni mi rung ba nyid yin pas theg pa gsum bstan pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de rnams ni mi rung ba nyid yin pas theg pa gsum bstan pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: since they are not suitable for that, what is the purpose of teaching the three vehicles?

original: lan ni bde gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni bde gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer is, “the Sugatas,” etc.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzigs pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzigs pas so //
translated: The Buddhas see it in a manner free from conceptualization.

original: gang gi phyir bde bar gshegs pas khyod la shes rab thabs snying rje dang bcas pa mnga' ba dang / de bzhin du bdag gis sems can rnams dgrol bar bya'o zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa mnga' ba de'i phyir sems can rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis yal bar 'dor bar mi mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde bar gshegs pas khyod la shes rab thabs snying rje dang bcas pa mnga' ba dang / de bzhin du bdag gis sems can rnams dgrol bar bya'o zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa mnga' ba de'i phyir sems can rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis yal bar 'dor bar mi mdzad pa'o //
translated: Because the Well-Gone One has wisdom, means, and compassion, and because he has promised, “I will liberate sentient beings,” therefore the Lord does not abandon sentient beings.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te bcom ldan 'das la shes rab mi mnga' bar 'gyur na de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo nas sems can rnams yal bar 'dor bar 'gyur ba las de mnga' ba dang sems can rnams rnam par 'grol bar bya'o zhes zhal gyis bzhes pas
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te bcom ldan 'das la shes rab mi mnga' bar 'gyur na de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo nas sems can rnams yal bar 'dor bar 'gyur ba las de mnga' ba dang sems can rnams rnam par 'grol bar bya'o zhes zhal gyis bzhes pas
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the Lord were not endowed with wisdom, then he would abandon sentient beings on the ground that he is omniscient. But since he is endowed with that and has promised, “I will liberate sentient beings,”

original: bcom ldan 'das ci ltar na snyom las mdzad par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci ltar na snyom las mdzad par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: how could the Lord be lazy?

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i @356b phyir lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i @356b phyir lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says, “body,” and so on.

original: 'jug pa shas che ba'i rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa shas chen po 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: 'jug pa shas che ba'i rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa shas chen po 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: The cause of the predominance of the defilements is the cause of the predominance of the defilements.

original: lhag par mos pa khyad par du 'phags pa 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / chos kyi bdag med pa la mos pa ldog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa khyad par du 'phags pa 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / chos kyi bdag med pa la mos pa ldog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It causes the abandonment of the special preference for the special superiority, because it causes the abandonment of the preference for the selflessness of the person and the selflessness of the dharmas.

original: 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mi 'jug pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mi 'jug pa tsam gyis so //
translated: By this alone, by this much alone, he does not enter into the knowledge of the Buddha.

original: de dag rnam par grol bar bya ba la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams dgrol bar bya ba la'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par grol bar bya ba la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams dgrol bar bya ba la'o //
translated: For the sake of the liberation of those, for the sake of the liberation of beings.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Theirs, of those beings.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mkhyen pa las rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mkhyen pa las rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas so //
translated: By another aspect, by another aspect than the knowledge of emptiness.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni snyigs ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni snyigs ma rnams so //
translated: These, the degenerations.

original: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa nges par bsgrub par bya dgos pas so //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa nges par bsgrub par bya dgos pas so //
translated: The phrase without a doubt means that the promise must be fulfilled.

original: theg pa gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin pa dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa gsum bstan pa dgongs pa can yin pa dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate by means of an example that the teaching of the three vehicles is a matter of intention, he says:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can shes rab dang ldan pa'i ded dpon gyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can shes rab dang ldan pa'i ded dpon gyis so //
translated: Therefore, the wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'🔽The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'🔽The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'🔽The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'

original: rin po che'i gling du chas pa'i skye tshogs kyis zhes bya ba ni rin po che'i gling du rin po che tshol gyi ched du 'gro ba'i skye bo'i tshogs so //
analyzed: rin po che'i gling du chas pa'i skye tshogs kyis zhes bya ba ni rin po che'i gling du rin po che tshol gyi ched du 'gro ba'i skye bo'i tshogs so //
translated: The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'🔽The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'🔽The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'🔽The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'🔽The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'

original: dal ba nye bar sel zhes bya ba ni kha zas dang mal cha dang stan dang gos la sogs pa sna tshogs pa yod pas so //
analyzed: dal ba nye bar sel zhes bya ba ni kha zas dang mal cha dang stan dang gos la sogs pa sna tshogs pa yod pas so //
translated: The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over, having seen the people who are exhausted, frightened, and desirous of turning back, should say to them: 'Come here!'

original: yid 'ong zhes bya ba ni khang pa brtsigs pa dang / skyed mos tshal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid 'ong zhes bya ba ni khang pa brtsigs pa dang / skyed mos tshal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wise one, the captain, who is skilled in the means of crossing over

original: bar du zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'i dkyil du'o //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'i dkyil du'o //
translated: In the middle means in the middle of the ocean.

original: rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'o //
translated: Arrayed means emanated.

original: dpe bstan nas don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽khyed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dpe bstan nas don bstan par bya ba'i phyir / khyed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having taught the example, in order to teach the meaning,🔽he says,🔽You, etc.

original: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis so //
analyzed: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis so //
translated: You means the Blessed Ones.

original: theg pa 'di'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi theg pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa 'di'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi theg pa'o //
translated: In this vehicle means in the vehicle of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: zhi ba'i tshul la yid sbyar zhing //
analyzed: zhi ba'i tshul la yid sbyar zhing //
translated: Their minds are fixed on the way of peace.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba la thugs gtad nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba la thugs gtad nas so //
translated: Their minds are fixed on the pacification of the afflictions.

original: rnam par dben pa la'ang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dben pa las so //
analyzed: rnam par dben pa la'ang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dben pa las so //
translated: And in solitude means in the solitude of the Bodhisattvas.

original: blo sbyangs rnams las logs su gsungs //
analyzed: blo sbyangs rnams las logs su gsungs //
translated: They are taught separately from those whose minds are trained.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las blo dben par byas pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las blo dben par byas pa rnams la'o //
translated: Those whose minds are trained are those who have made their minds solitary from cyclic existence.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par @357a * //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par @357a * //
translated: There, the solitude of the Bodhisattvas is taught as being superior to the solitude of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: dben pa nyid ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi rnam par dben pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa nyid ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi rnam par dben pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: Solitude is the non-manifestation of the conceptualization of the solitude of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'di dag ni 'khor ba la chags pa dang rnam par bral ba rnam par dben pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'khor ba la chags pa dang rnam par bral ba rnam par dben pa'o //
translated: These are the kinds of solitude that are free from attachment to the lifecycle.

original: logs su zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po las so //
analyzed: logs su zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po las so //
translated: The phrase apart from that means apart from the Mahayana.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to illustrate that, he says:

original: dpe 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dpe 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This example, etc.

original: zhi ba'i bde ba'i rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba nyid bde ba yin la de nyid rten du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i bde ba'i rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba nyid bde ba yin la de nyid rten du gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase the basis for the bliss of peace means that the pacification of the afflictions is bliss, and that is the basis.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshu rol du zhes bya ba ni de rnams la theg pa chen po bstan pa'i sngon rol du'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshu rol du zhes bya ba ni de rnams la theg pa chen po bstan pa'i sngon rol du'o //
translated: The phrase on the far side of the Mahayana means prior to the teaching of the Mahayana to them.

original: de thob pa'i thabs su gyur cing zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de thob pa'i thabs su gyur cing zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa ste /
translated: The phrase the means for attaining that means the means for attaining the Mahayana.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag gis nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas yid las byung ba'i bdag gi dngos pos tshogs rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag gis nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas yid las byung ba'i bdag gi dngos pos tshogs rdzogs par byas te /
translated: Because by abandoning the afflictions through the Śrāvaka Vehicle and the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, they complete the collections with a self that is a mental factor,

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur bas so //
translated: and then attain buddhahood.

original: 'di'i don ni nyan thos kyi theg pas mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yongs su shes pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas gzung bar mngon par zhen pa spangs pas grol bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni nyan thos kyi theg pas mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yongs su shes pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas gzung bar mngon par zhen pa spangs pas grol bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is that the Śrāvaka Vehicle teaches liberation through the complete knowledge of impermanence, etc., and the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle teaches liberation through abandoning the attachment to the apprehended.

original: des na de dag shes pas gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar gyur pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams dang / gzung bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba tsam de kho na nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de dag shes pas gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar gyur pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams dang / gzung bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba tsam de kho na nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, when they abandon the afflictions through that knowledge, the Tathāgatas teach that impermanence, etc., and the mere abandonment of the attachment to the apprehended are not reality.
