original: gang mi rtag pa de rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because whatever is impermanent arises from causes and conditions.

original: skye ba med pa yin pas rang bzhin med pa dang / gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med pas 'dzin pa rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes chos ston cing sad par mdzad do ;
analyzed: skye ba med pa yin pas rang bzhin med pa dang / gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med pas 'dzin pa rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes chos ston cing sad par mdzad do ;
translated: He teaches the Dharma and awakens them to the fact that since they are not produced, they are essenceless, and that since there is no object, there is no subject, and so the subject is essenceless.

original: / des na de rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi theg pa chen po la 'jug cing tshogs rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: / des na de rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi theg pa chen po la 'jug cing tshogs rdzogs par byas te /
translated: Thus, they enter the Mahayana, which has the characteristic of being essenceless, and having completed the collections,

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: they attain buddhahood.

original: 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag go //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag go //
translated: “Attaining the abandonment of the afflictions of cyclic existence” refers to śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: theg pa chen po kho na nye bar bstan la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po kho na nye bar bstan la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i ched du'o //
translated: “The Mahayana alone is taught” is for the purpose of attaining buddhahood.

original: gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la phra rgyas nye bar spangs pas skye ba yang shin tu log pas skye ba du mar brgyud pas bsgrub par bya ba'i sangs rgyas nyid ga la yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la phra rgyas nye bar spangs pas skye ba yang shin tu log pas skye ba du mar brgyud pas bsgrub par bya ba'i sangs rgyas nyid ga la yod ce na /
translated: If śrāvakas and so on have completely stopped the arising of the negative tendencies through the abandonment of the negative tendencies, how could they have buddhahood, which is to be accomplished through many lives?

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: de rnams kyi skye bo la sogs pa @357b shin tu log pa nyid du ma grub pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi skye bo la sogs pa @357b shin tu log pa nyid du ma grub pas so //
translated: because it is not established that their birth, etc., are utterly reversed.

original: de ltar yang dpal gyi phreng ba seng ge sgra'i mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang dpal gyi phreng ba seng ge sgra'i mdo las /
translated: Thus, in the Siṃha-prajñā-praveśa-śrī-mālā-sūtra,🔽it says:

original: dgra bcom pa la yang 'jigs pa yod de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang 'jigs pa yod de /
translated: “Arhats also have fear.

original: 'jigs pa gang gis dgra bcom pa rnams dang rang sangs rgyas dag kyang 'jigs nas sangs rgyas nyid la skyabs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa gang gis dgra bcom pa rnams dang rang sangs rgyas dag kyang 'jigs nas sangs rgyas nyid la skyabs su 'gro'o //
translated: Because of that fear, arhats and pratyekabuddhas go for refuge in buddhahood.

original: de rnams la skye ba ma zad pa nyid yod de /
analyzed: de rnams la skye ba ma zad pa nyid yod de /
translated: They have birth that is not exhausted.

original: gang ma spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams las ring du 'gyur ba de rnams la spang bar bya ba'i chos du ma yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang ma spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams las ring du 'gyur ba de rnams la spang bar bya ba'i chos du ma yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: They have many dharmas to be abandoned, because of not abandoning that which keeps them far from the realm of nirvāṇa.”

original: gang nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la nga'i skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa bstan pa de ni mdo de nyid las drang ba'i don du gsungs te /
analyzed: gang nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la nga'i skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa bstan pa de ni mdo de nyid las drang ba'i don du gsungs te /
translated: The knowledge of exhaustion and the knowledge of nonarising that are taught for śrāvakas, etc., with the statement, “My birth is exhausted,” are said in that sūtra to be of provisional meaning.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das gang dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi rnam par grol ba'i so sor rtogs pa'i shes pa mthar thug pa gang yin pa 'di ni dgongs pa can drang ba'i don lags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das gang dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi rnam par grol ba'i so sor rtogs pa'i shes pa mthar thug pa gang yin pa 'di ni dgongs pa can drang ba'i don lags te /
translated: Thus, the final knowledge of the liberation of the Arhats and Pratyekabuddhas, O Lord, is interpretable in meaning, requiring further explanation.

original: 'chi 'pho ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of death:

original: sems can rnams kyi rnam par 'chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang / bcom ldan 'das yid las byung ba'i lus can dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub kyi snying po'i mthar thug pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ba'i 'chi 'pho ba yod par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rnam par 'chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang / bcom ldan 'das yid las byung ba'i lus can dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub kyi snying po'i mthar thug pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ba'i 'chi 'pho ba yod par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: the death of sentient beings, and the death of the Arhats, Pratyekabuddhas, and Bodhisattvas who have attained mastery over mental processes, which is not a complete death but a transformation of mental body into a different mental body, which is inconceivable except to a Buddha.

original: rnam par 'chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i dbang du byas nas dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas dag la yang nga la skye ba zad do snyam du shes par 'gyur ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par 'chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba'i dbang du byas nas dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas dag la yang nga la skye ba zad do snyam du shes par 'gyur ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: In terms of the death and transmigration that is a termination, even arhats and pratyekabuddhas think, “My births are exhausted.”

original: rnam par 'chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba ni sngar gyi 'gro bas bsdus pa'i bdag gi dngos po chad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'chad pa'i 'chi 'pho ba ni sngar gyi 'gro bas bsdus pa'i bdag gi dngos po chad pa'o //
translated: Death and transmigration that is a termination is the termination of the entity of the self that is included in the previous reincarnations.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i 'chi 'pho ba la bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams kyis ma bsdus pas so //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i 'chi 'pho ba la bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams kyis ma bsdus pas so //
translated: Death and transmigration that is an inconceivable transformation is inconceivable because it is not included in the realms of desire and so on.

original: yongs su bsngo ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngos pas so //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du yongs su bsngos pas so //
translated: It is a transformation because it is transformed into buddhahood.

original: des dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dag nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma rig pa'i bag chags spangs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dag nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma rig pa'i bag chags spangs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: By that, arhats and pratyekabuddhas do not abandon afflictions and do not abandon the imprints of ignorance.

original: de ma spangs pas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bag chags ma spangs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ma spangs pas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bag chags ma spangs par 'gyur la /
translated: Since they do not abandon those, they do not abandon the imprints of all afflictions.

original: yang de dag gis srid pa gzhan blangs nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyod do //
analyzed: yang de dag gis srid pa gzhan blangs nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyod do //
translated: Moreover, having taken up another existence, they practice the bodhisattva practices.

original: yang srid pa ji ltar len zhe na /
analyzed: yang srid pa ji ltar len zhe na /
translated: How do they take up another existence?

original: rgyu'i stobs dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis @358a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs dang rkyen gyi stobs kyis @358a * //
translated: By the power of the cause and the power of the condition.

original: te ; de la gang nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs pa'i bag chags yod pa de ni rkyen yin la /
analyzed: te ; de la gang nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs pa'i bag chags yod pa de ni rkyen yin la /
translated: Among them, the latent impressions of the complete abandonment of the afflictions is the condition.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang srid pa len par byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang srid pa len par byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The wholesome roots associated with the outflows that take up another existence are the cause.

original: de ltar yang rgya mtsho blo gros 'khor bar 'ching bar byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang rgya mtsho blo gros 'khor bar 'ching bar byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: Thus, Sāgaramati, what are the afflictions associated with the wholesome roots that bind one to cyclic existence?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de ni 'di yin te /
translated: Those by which the bodhisattvas become afflicted are these.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs tshol par byed pa la mi ngoms pa nyid dang / yang dag par bsams nas srid pa len pa dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad par 'dod pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa la yongs su mi ngal ba dang /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs tshol par byed pa la mi ngoms pa nyid dang / yang dag par bsams nas srid pa len pa dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad par 'dod pa dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa la yongs su mi ngal ba dang /
translated: It is the insatiable search for the accumulation of merit; it is the taking up of existence after proper reflection; it is the desire to meet the Buddhas; it is the non-discouragement in the process of maturing beings.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin par 'dod pa dang / sems can rnams la ci bya snyam pa'i 'dod pa dang / chos la chags pa'i phra rgyas mi 'dor ba dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams yongs su mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin par 'dod pa dang / sems can rnams la ci bya snyam pa'i 'dod pa dang / chos la chags pa'i phra rgyas mi 'dor ba dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams yongs su mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: It is the desire to uphold the true Dharma; it is the desire to do something for beings; it is the non-abandoning of the negative conditioning factors of attachment to the Dharma; and it is the non-abandoning of the fetters of the perfections.

original: smras pa bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba yin na /
analyzed: smras pa bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba yin na /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, when they are roots of virtue,

original: ci'i phyir na nyon mongs pa zhes brjod /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na nyon mongs pa zhes brjod /
translated: why are they called afflictions?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this:

original: rgya mtsho blo gros 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin 'di rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams khams gsum du gnas par 'gyur zhes /
analyzed: rgya mtsho blo gros 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin 'di rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams khams gsum du gnas par 'gyur zhes /
translated: O Sāgaramati, how is it that bodhisattvas, with such a nature, remain in the three realms?”

original: khams gsum yang nyon mongs pa las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: khams gsum yang nyon mongs pa las byung ba yin la /
translated: The three realms also arise from the afflictions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams thabs la mkhas pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas yang dag par ched du bsams nas khams gsum du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams thabs la mkhas pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas yang dag par ched du bsams nas khams gsum du gnas pa yin no //
translated: But the bodhisattvas, through skill in means and the power of their roots of virtue, intentionally take birth in the three realms.

original: des na khams gsum du gnas par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: des na khams gsum du gnas par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, they are not afflicted by the afflictions that are associated with the roots of virtue that cause them to take birth in the three realms.

original: theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma las kyang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma las kyang /
translated: The Mahāyāna Ugraparipṛcchā-sūtra says,🔽“The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.

original: ma rig pa'i gnas pa de dang ma rig pa'i gnas pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba'i spyod pa'i rgyu phra mos kun nas bslangs pa'i zag pa med pa'i las la brten nas yid las byung ba'i phung po 'byung bar 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnas pa de dang ma rig pa'i gnas pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba'i spyod pa'i rgyu phra mos kun nas bslangs pa'i zag pa med pa'i las la brten nas yid las byung ba'i phung po 'byung bar 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.🔽The bodhisattva who is skilled in means, through the power of his roots of virtue, intentionally takes birth in the three realms.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa lta bu ni ma rig pa'i gnas yin la las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa lta bu ni zag pa med pa'i @358b las mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa lta bu ni ma rig pa'i gnas yin la las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa lta bu ni zag pa med pa'i @358b las mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, the affliction of affliction is the abode of ignorance, and the affliction of karma is the formation of uncontaminated karma.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa lta bu ni yid las byung ba'i bdag gi dngos po rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa lta bu ni yid las byung ba'i bdag gi dngos po rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The affliction of birth is the establishment of the three types of self-entity that arise from mind.

original: de'i rkyen can gyi rga shi lta bu ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang yongs su bsngo ba'i 'chi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen can gyi rga shi lta bu ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang yongs su bsngo ba'i 'chi 'pho ba'o //
translated: The condition of that is the inconceivable and fully dedicated death and transmigration.🔽These, which have the abode of ignorance and uncontaminated karma as their cause, also have birth.

original: ma rig pa'i gnas dang zag pa med pa'i las kyi rgyu can 'di rnams la yang skye ba yod do zhes dpal phreng seng ge'i sgra'i mdo las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnas dang zag pa med pa'i las kyi rgyu can 'di rnams la yang skye ba yod do zhes dpal phreng seng ge'i sgra'i mdo las 'di lta ste /
translated: It says in the glorious Lion’s Roar of Queen Śrīmālā:

original: bcom ldan 'das dper na nye bar len pa'i rkyen can zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi rgyu can srid pa gsum srid pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i gnas pa'i rkyen can zag pa med pa'i las kyi rgyu can dgra bcom pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dper na nye bar len pa'i rkyen can zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi rgyu can srid pa gsum srid pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i gnas pa'i rkyen can zag pa med pa'i las kyi rgyu can dgra bcom pa dang /
translated: Bhagavān, just as the three existences are conditioned by the appropriation of contaminated karma, in the same way, Bhagavān, the existence of an arhat is conditioned by the abode of ignorance and is caused by uncontaminated karma.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gsum srid pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gsum srid pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Blessed One, just as the three existences are conditioned by the appropriation of contaminated actions, in the same way, Blessed One, the three mental bodies of the arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas who have attained power are conditioned by the appropriation of uncontaminated actions.

original: de la yid las byung ba'i lus gsum ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de la yid las byung ba'i lus gsum ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: The three mental bodies are those of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: sa brgyad par byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad la dbang ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad par byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad la dbang ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the eighth ground, bodhisattvas attain mastery over all phenomena.

original: da ni bdag gi dngos po 'jig rten 'di pa'am /
analyzed: da ni bdag gi dngos po 'jig rten 'di pa'am /
translated: Now, is this self-entity of mine in this world,

original: 'jig rten phyi ma pa zhig ste /🔽'dod pa'i khams na'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma pa zhig ste / 'dod pa'i khams na'am /
translated: or is it in the next world?🔽Is it in the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams na'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na'am /
translated: or is it in the form realm,🔽or is it in the formless realm?

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod par bya dgos te /🔽'gro ba'am / skye gnas sam /🔽'jig rten nam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod par bya dgos te / 'gro ba'am / skye gnas sam / 'jig rten nam /
translated: It must be said whether it is in the formless realm, etc.

original: srid pa gsum yang bgrang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum yang bgrang bar mi bya'o //
translated: It is not counted as a realm, a destiny, a place of rebirth, a world, or an existence.

original: 'o na bdag gi dngos po 'grub pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bdag gi dngos po 'grub pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the establishment of the self?

original: yid las byung ba sprul pa bzhin du blta ba'i sprul pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid las byung ba sprul pa bzhin du blta ba'i sprul pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is like a mental creation, but not like an emanation.

original: srid pa zhes brjod pa ni 'chi 'pho la skye ba'i dbang gis nye bar btags nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa zhes brjod pa ni 'chi 'pho la skye ba'i dbang gis nye bar btags nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: Existence is said to be a designation based on death and rebirth.

original: sems can rnams kyi don yod na dbang thob pa nyid kyis 'gro ba dang / skye gnas de dang der snang ba yin gyi sems can gyi don med pa ni snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don yod na dbang thob pa nyid kyis 'gro ba dang / skye gnas de dang der snang ba yin gyi sems can gyi don med pa ni snang ba ma yin no //
translated: When there is a purpose for sentient beings, one who has attained power appears in that destiny and place of rebirth, but not when there is no purpose for sentient beings.

original: bdag gi dngos po de yang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas 'dus byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi 'khor ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po de yang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas 'dus byas pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi 'khor ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: That nature of the self is also called conditioned cyclic existence because it is produced by uncontaminated roots of virtue.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa dag gis mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir na 'dus ma byas pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa dag gis mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir na 'dus ma byas pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is not produced by contaminated actions and afflictions, it is called unconditioned and nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das 'dus byas pa'i 'khor ba yang @359a * //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das 'dus byas pa'i 'khor ba yang @359a * //
translated: Thus the Bhagavān said, “There is conditioned saṃsāra,

original: mchis ; 'dus ma byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang mchis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mchis ; 'dus ma byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang mchis zhes gsungs so //
translated: and there is unconditioned nirvāṇa.”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang byams pa las dang nyon mongs pas nye bar 'gro ba'i skye bor mi brjod kyi 'on kyang dgra bcom pa rnams la bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bsngo ba'i skye bor brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang byams pa las dang nyon mongs pas nye bar 'gro ba'i skye bor mi brjod kyi 'on kyang dgra bcom pa rnams la bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bsngo ba'i skye bor brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: And in the Pāramitā[samāsa], it says, “One should not call the one who goes by way of action and affliction a bodhisattva, but rather one who dedicates the inconceivable to the arhats.”

original: bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa rnams la sdug bsngal dang bde ba dag 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pas mngon par dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi mngal gyi gnas yongs su 'dzin pa yin pas nyon mongs pa rnams la khams gsum du skye ba'i nus pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa rnams la sdug bsngal dang bde ba dag 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pas mngon par dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi mngal gyi gnas yongs su 'dzin pa yin pas nyon mongs pa rnams la khams gsum du skye ba'i nus pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Those who are attached to a self, by desiring suffering and happiness and by desiring to obtain them, first of all delight in the womb and then grasp it. Thus the afflictions have the power to produce birth in the three realms.

original: de rnams log pas 'bras bu khams gsum du skye ba yang ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de rnams log pas 'bras bu khams gsum du skye ba yang ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: When they are eliminated, the result, birth in the three realms, is also eliminated.

original: zag pa med pa'i khams su skye ba ni ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i khams su skye ba ni ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: But birth in the uncontaminated realm is not eliminated.

original: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
translated: The Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra says:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying bar 'gyur ba dang / ma rig pa'i gnas pa'i 'ching bas gcig tu nges par mya ngan las mi 'da' ba dang / rnam par grol ba med pa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying bar 'gyur ba dang / ma rig pa'i gnas pa'i 'ching bas gcig tu nges par mya ngan las mi 'da' ba dang / rnam par grol ba med pa dang /
translated: Because they are attached to the characteristics of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, they sink in the ocean of saṃsāra, and because they are bound by the fetters of the abode of ignorance, they are not definitely liberated from suffering, and they do not have complete liberation.

original: nyon mongs pa tsam las grol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa med du zin kyang mar me shi ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das snyam pa'i 'du shes can la zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i zag pa med pa'i khams su sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bskal pa
analyzed: nyon mongs pa tsam las grol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa med du zin kyang mar me shi ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das snyam pa'i 'du shes can la zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i zag pa med pa'i khams su sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bskal pa
translated: Although they are not liberated from afflictions alone and do not attain nirvana, they possess uncontaminated concentration and abide in the core of a lotus in a pure buddha realm for as many eons as there are sand particles in the Ganges, thinking, “I have attained nirvana like a flame extinguished.”

original: ji snyed par padma'i snying por gnas pa yin la de nas snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs nas 'od zer gyis sad par byas te /
analyzed: ji snyed par padma'i snying por gnas pa yin la de nas snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs nas 'od zer gyis sad par byas te /
translated: Then, the tathagatas such as Amitabha bless them and awaken them with light rays.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rab tu 'byor pa mthong nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rab tu 'byor pa mthong nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed do //
translated: Rising from that concentration, they see the supramundane perfections of the buddhas and bodhisattvas and generate the mind of awakening.

original: skye ba la dbang thob pa'i stobs kyis mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsams bzhin du skye ba rnams kyis dmyal bar rgyu ba bzhin du /
analyzed: skye ba la dbang thob pa'i stobs kyis mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsams bzhin du skye ba rnams kyis dmyal bar rgyu ba bzhin du /
translated: By the power of attaining mastery over birth, the bodhisattvas who abide in the stages of Immovability and so on, by means of their intentional births, go to the hells,

original: 'gro bar 'gro zhes byang chub mchog thob par 'gyur ro zhes shin tu gsal bar gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gro zhes byang chub mchog thob par 'gyur ro zhes shin tu gsal bar gsungs so //
translated: and so on, and they attain supreme enlightenment.

original: des na theg pa gcig yin gyi gsum du gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa @359b yin no ;
analyzed: des na theg pa gcig yin gyi gsum du gsungs pa ni dgongs pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa @359b yin no ;
translated: Therefore, it is established that there is one vehicle, and the teaching of three is intentional.

original: / mdo kun las btus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mdo kun las btus pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: / mdo kun las btus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mdo kun las btus pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Compendium of Sutras and so on were composed by the master Nagarjuna.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mdo rnams pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mdo rnams pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase and so on refers to the Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i dus dang zhes bya ba ni dus gang gi tshe chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa mngon du mdzad pas so //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i dus dang zhes bya ba ni dus gang gi tshe chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa mngon du mdzad pas so //
translated: The time of manifest enlightenment is the time when he actualized the extremely pure realm of truth.

original: bzhugs pa'i dus zhes bya ba ni dus ji srid du bzhugs so //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i dus zhes bya ba ni dus ji srid du bzhugs so //
translated: The phrase “for as long as he remains” means for as long as he remains.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the Sugata” and so on.

original: de la zhing de sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams la rdul phra rab ji snyed yod pa /
analyzed: de la zhing de sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams la rdul phra rab ji snyed yod pa /
translated: Therein, the field is the buddha-fields, and the atoms are however many there are of them.

original: byang chub mchog rang dam par gshegs pa'i bskal pa de //
analyzed: byang chub mchog rang dam par gshegs pa'i bskal pa de //
translated: The eons in which he has gone to the highest, supreme enlightenment

original: zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: should be connected with that.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi yul lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi yul lo //
translated: “Buddha” is the object of the Buddha’s wisdom.

original: ma lus phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu na'o //
analyzed: ma lus phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu na'o //
translated: “In all directions” means in the ten directions.

original: 'di yang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku nyid gcig yin pas de ltar brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku nyid gcig yin pas de ltar brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, this is the Dharma Body of all Buddhas, and so it is said.

original: gzhan du na sangs rgyas gzhan du 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na sangs rgyas gzhan du 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no arising of another Buddha.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽khyod kyi gsang ba 'di ni bsnyad pa ma lags so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / khyod kyi gsang ba 'di ni bsnyad pa ma lags so //
translated: For that very reason,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This secret of yours is not to be told.”

original: 'di ni gsad par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gsad par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: This is to be kept secret.

original: gzhan du na chos kyi sku la dgongs pa ma shes nas sangs rgyas gcig kho na bzhugs kyi gzhan rnams la sangs rgyas mi srid pas tshogs bsags pa don med do snyam nas log par lta ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na chos kyi sku la dgongs pa ma shes nas sangs rgyas gcig kho na bzhugs kyi gzhan rnams la sangs rgyas mi srid pas tshogs bsags pa don med do snyam nas log par lta ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, not knowing the intention with regard to the Dharma Body, one would generate a false view, thinking that only one Buddha exists, and that it is impossible for others to become Buddhas, and that therefore the accumulation of the stores is meaningless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsnyad pa ma lags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsnyad pa ma lags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, It is not a mere expression.

original: gang gis chos kyi sku la brten nas 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes shes pa de la 'di bstan par bya ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos kyi sku la brten nas 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes shes pa de la 'di bstan par bya ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is to be taught to one who knows that this is taught on the basis of the Dharma Body.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Buddhahood, etc.

original: sh'akya'i rigs su 'khrungs pa la sogs pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni sprul pa'i sku'i sgo nas yin gyi rdo rje'i gdan du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mngon du mdzad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs su 'khrungs pa la sogs pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni sprul pa'i sku'i sgo nas yin gyi rdo rje'i gdan du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mngon du mdzad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: What is taught, such as born in the Shakya lineage, etc., is on the basis of the Transformation Body, but not on the basis of the manifest perfect enlightenment at Bodhimanda.

original: sprul pa'i sku 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The cause of the arising of the Transformation Body is the Dharma Body.

original: de'i bya ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de'i bya ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Its activity is the Dharma Body.

original: de'i tshad ces bya ba ni dus kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i tshad ces bya ba ni dus kyi'o //
translated: Its measure is the time.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams na'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams na'o //
translated: Therein means in the world systems.

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas bsags pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni dus ji srid pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas bsags pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni dus ji srid pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyis so //
translated: By those who have accumulated the roots of virtue means by those of the lineages of the Disciples, etc. for as long as the time lasts.

original: de lhag par @360a * //
analyzed: de lhag par @360a * //
translated: They are the ones who have the superior aspiration.

original: mos par byed pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku la lhag par mos par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rigs rnams la'o //
analyzed: mos par byed pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku la lhag par mos par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rigs rnams la'o //
translated: For those who have the superior aspiration for the Dharma Body, who are the Bodhisattvas of the lineage.

original: bzhugs pa'i dus bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i dus bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the time of abiding, he says:

original: de ltar re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, first of all, etc.

original: mchog tu rab zhi bar zhes bya ba ni mchog tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: mchog tu rab zhi bar zhes bya ba ni mchog tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: In the state of supreme peace means in the state of supreme non-conceptuality.

original: nam mkha' rnam 'jig 'gyur min de srid du //
analyzed: nam mkha' rnam 'jig 'gyur min de srid du //
translated: As long as space endures,

original: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ji srid du 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de srid du khyod la zhi bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ji srid du 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de srid du khyod la zhi bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The meaning is that as long as the world is not destroyed, for that long you will remain in peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gang la mnga' zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gang la mnga' zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that you will remain in nirvana.

original: shes rab yul gyis bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab yul gyis bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The wisdom that is generated by the object.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas chos sku mngon du mdzad pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas chos sku mngon du mdzad pas so //
translated: The meaning is that by cultivating the perfection of wisdom, you actualize the dharma body.🔽The way of the mother of compassion.

original: thugs brtse ma ma'i tshul lugs zhes bya ba ni thugs rje'i dbang gis 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: thugs brtse ma ma'i tshul lugs zhes bya ba ni thugs rje'i dbang gis 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The meaning is that by the power of compassion, you remain for as long as cyclic existence endures.

original: chos kyi sku'i dbang gis sems can gyi don bya ba rgyun mi chad par 'gyur bas de gnas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i dbang gis sems can gyi don bya ba rgyun mi chad par 'gyur bas de gnas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that by the power of the dharma body, the activity of benefiting sentient beings becomes uninterrupted.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavan, etc.

original: dri ba'i sgo nas snying rje'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dri ba'i sgo nas snying rje'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the nature of compassion by way of a question, he says, for whose sake, etc.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba snying rjes so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba snying rjes so //
translated: With compassion.

original: de'i rang bzhin ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ston pa ni /
translated: The nature of that is taught:

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The explanation, etc.

original: ji ltar khyod de sangs rgyas skye bo rnams la thugs brtsi ba de ltar kha zas dug dang bcas pa'i zas kyis phyis bu 'gro log byed pa mas mthong ba la sdug bsngal de yid mi bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod de sangs rgyas skye bo rnams la thugs brtsi ba de ltar kha zas dug dang bcas pa'i zas kyis phyis bu 'gro log byed pa mas mthong ba la sdug bsngal de yid mi bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Just as you, Buddha, have compassion for beings, so too the mother sees the child who has eaten poisonous food and experiences that suffering, that mental unhappiness.

original: skye bo'i khyad par ni nang mi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skye bo'i khyad par ni nang mi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The distinction of beings is mentioned:

original: ngas 'di drang bar bya'o zhes zhal gyis bzhes pas so //
analyzed: ngas 'di drang bar bya'o zhes zhal gyis bzhes pas so //
translated: I will lead this one.🔽Again, the distinction of beings is:

original: yang skye bo'i khyad par ni 'jig rten kha zas dug bcas za ba'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yang skye bo'i khyad par ni 'jig rten kha zas dug bcas za ba'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The world eats food with poison, etc.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga la 'jig rten pa'i kha zas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga la 'jig rten pa'i kha zas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five types of sense objects such as form and sound are called food for the world.

original: de bden par zhen pa'i longs spyod pa'i phyir 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas dug dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de bden par zhen pa'i longs spyod pa'i phyir 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas dug dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Because of attachment to the truth of that, cyclic existence is the cause of suffering, and so is “poisoned.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gti mug skyon gyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gti mug skyon gyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “due to the fault of delusion.”

original: ma rig pa'i stobs kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i stobs kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “due to the power of ignorance.”

original: de nas mgon po mchog tu rab zhir gshegs par 'gyur ba lags //
analyzed: de nas mgon po mchog tu rab zhir gshegs par 'gyur ba lags //
translated: Then, how will the Lord go to the supreme, excellent peace?

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bden par mngon par zhen pa 'jig rten pa rnams sdug bsngal gyi rgyur @360b gyur ba'i 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga la longs spyod pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal sel bar dam bcas pa khyod mya ngan las 'das par mi
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bden par mngon par zhen pa 'jig rten pa rnams sdug bsngal gyi rgyur @360b gyur ba'i 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga la longs spyod pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal sel bar dam bcas pa khyod mya ngan las 'das par mi
translated: This is because, since worldly people who are attached to the truth enjoy the five sense objects that are the cause of suffering, you, who have vowed to remove suffering, will not go to nirvana.

original: 'gyur ba'o // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'o // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'dod pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'dod pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Worldly people, etc.”🔽In “sense objects,”

original: 'dod par bya bas na 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod par bya bas na 'dod pa ste /
translated: “sense objects” are objects of desire.

original: gzugs la sogs rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs rnams so //
translated: They are forms, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Form, etc.

original: de rnams nyid goms par bya ba yin pas na yo tan lnga'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid goms par bya ba yin pas na yo tan lnga'o //
translated: Since they are to be cultivated, they are the five virtues.

original: 'di nyid mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong ba 'di ni bden pa yin no zhes mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni gang gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong ba 'di ni bden pa yin no zhes mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: This very thing is called “attachment,” since one is attached to the idea that “this experience of form, etc. is true.”

original: sdug bsngal rgya chen po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgya chen po'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgya chen po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgya chen po'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: Because it is the cause of great suffering, since it is the cause of great suffering in the hells, etc.

original: gti mug gi skyon las zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i skyon gyis de kho na nyid mi shes pas so //
analyzed: gti mug gi skyon las zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i skyon gyis de kho na nyid mi shes pas so //
translated: From the fault of delusion, since one does not understand reality because of the fault of ignorance.

original: de ltar snying rje'i rang bzhin bstan nas khyad par du 'jig rten sdug bsngal bar gzigs nas thugs rje'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir thugs rjes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar snying rje'i rang bzhin bstan nas khyad par du 'jig rten sdug bsngal bar gzigs nas thugs rje'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir thugs rjes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, after teaching the nature of compassion, in order to demonstrate that, seeing the world as suffering, the Lord does not pass into Nirvana out of the power of compassion, he says, “Out of compassion,” etc.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs nyams su myong ba'i gzhir gyur pa zhes bya ba la skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs nyams su myong ba'i gzhir gyur pa zhes bya ba la skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs pa yin la /
translated: The basis for the experience of various sufferings.

original: de nyams su myong ba'i rten du gyur ba'i 'jig rten na //
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba'i rten du gyur ba'i 'jig rten na //
translated: The various sufferings of birth and so on are the basis for the experience of the world.🔽Those who have the idea of existence and nonexistence.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par zhen pa'i blo can gyis zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu la yid ches par yod na 'jig rten pha rol yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i blo 'byung bas dngos po la
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par zhen pa'i blo can gyis zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu la yid ches par yod na 'jig rten pha rol yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i blo 'byung bas dngos po la
translated: If one has confidence in karma and its effects, then the idea of existence arises, such as “the world beyond exists.”

original: mngon par zhen pa'i blo can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i blo can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “those who have the idea of existence.”

original: log par lta ba yod na 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba las sogs pa la dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i blo can no //
analyzed: log par lta ba yod na 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba las sogs pa la dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i blo can no //
translated: If one has wrong views, then the idea of nonexistence arises, such as “the world beyond does not exist.”

original: de la khyad par gyi sgo nas rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la khyad par gyi sgo nas rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the reason for that by way of a distinction, he says, “the unwise.”

original: gang gi phyir ma rig pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma rig pa dang ldan pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the presence of nescience.

original: 'jig rten gnas skabs dang zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas skabs dang zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The world is the occasion of abiding, i.e., impermanence.

original: 'dis ni rga shi dag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rga shi dag bstan pa yin te /
translated: This indicates both aging and death,

original: gnyis ka la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pas so //🔽sdug dang mi sdug phrad bral gyis //
analyzed: gnyis ka la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pas so // sdug dang mi sdug phrad bral gyis //
translated: because both are pervaded by impermanence.🔽The suffering of association with the unpleasant and dissociation from the pleasant is generated.

original: bskyed ces bya ba ni mdza' ba dang bral bas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lo //🔽'di @361a * //
analyzed: bskyed ces bya ba ni mdza' ba dang bral bas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lo // 'di @361a * //
translated: The suffering of association with the unpleasant is generated by the suffering of encountering what is not desired, and the suffering of dissociation from the pleasant is generated by the suffering of separation from what is desired.

original: ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: This is the suffering of attachment to entities.

original: dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'bras bu bstan bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'bras bu bstan bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the result of attachment to non-entities, he says:

original: sdig can 'gro ba thob pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sdig can 'gro ba thob pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The attainment of evil destinies.

original: mnar med pa la sogs pa'i 'gro pa rnams so /
analyzed: mnar med pa la sogs pa'i 'gro pa rnams so /
translated: The evil destinies are the hells, etc.

original: zhi las zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs su zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhi las zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs su zin kyang ngo //
translated: Even though one has abandoned the afflictions along with their traces, he still experiences the suffering of the remaining propensities.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir de la gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir de la gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that commentary, he says, “Because of that, etc.”

original: las dang 'bras bu la yid ches pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la yid ches pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Confidence in karma and its effects” means

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba yod na'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba yod na'o //
translated: that when one has right view,

original: yod par lta ba zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu dag yod par lta ba'o //
analyzed: yod par lta ba zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu dag yod par lta ba'o //
translated: “the view of existence” means the view that karma and its effects exist.

original: gong du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams so //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams so //
translated: The “suffering explained above” is the sufferings of birth, etc.

original: da ni dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bstan bcos las kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam gzhag mdzad pa de gzhan rnams dang / thun mong ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bstan bcos las kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam gzhag mdzad pa de gzhan rnams dang / thun mong ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the presentation of conventional and ultimate truths in the treatise Introduction to the Middle Way is not shared with others,

original: lugs 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lugs 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This system, etc.”

original: lugs 'di zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam gzhag go //
analyzed: lugs 'di zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam gzhag go //
translated: “ This system” refers to the presentation of conventional and ultimate truths.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “ Monk” means one who has the vows of a monk.

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos las btus nas //
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos las btus nas //
translated: and collected from the Madhyamaka treatises.

original: zhes bya ba ni slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab la sogs pa nas btus nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab la sogs pa nas btus nas so //
translated: This means that it is collected from the Mulamadhyamakakarika composed by the master Nagarjuna and so on.

original: lung ji bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lung dang mi 'gal bar ro //
analyzed: lung ji bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lung dang mi 'gal bar ro //
translated: Just as in the scriptures means that it is not in contradiction with the scriptures characterized by the sutras and so on.

original: man ngag ni ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: man ngag ni ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The instructions are just as they are.

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i gdams ngag gi rjes su 'brangs nas so //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i gdams ngag gi rjes su 'brangs nas so //
translated: This means that it follows the instructions composed by the master Nagarjuna who is in the lineage of one to one transmission.

original: 'di las gzhan na chos 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di las gzhan na stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi chos 'di ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan na chos 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbu ma'i bstan bcos 'di las gzhan na stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi chos 'di ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: This Dharma is not found elsewhere means that this Dharma characterized by emptiness is not found elsewhere just as it is found in this Madhyamaka treatise.

original: de bzhin du dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bstan bcos 'di ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam gzhag gang byas pa de bstan bcos gzhan rnams na yod pa ma yin no zhes mkhas pa rnams kyis nges par mdzod ces pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbu ma la 'jug pa'i bstan bcos 'di ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam gzhag gang byas pa de bstan bcos gzhan rnams na yod pa ma yin no zhes mkhas pa rnams kyis nges par mdzod ces pa'o //
translated: Likewise, this treatise called the Central Way Introduction is to be ascertained by the wise as not existing in other treatises, whatever their presentation of the superficial and the ultimate.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: bstan bcos gzhan las zhes bya ba ni /🔽dbyig gnyen la @361b sogs pas byas pa las so //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhan las zhes bya ba ni / dbyig gnyen la @361b sogs pas byas pa las so //
translated: As to the other treatises,

original: bstan bcos gzhan la tshul lugs 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhan la tshul lugs 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the system of this treatise is not found in them.🔽In order to make that clear, he says:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, some have said,

original: kha cig gis zhes bya ba ni slob dpon 'ga' zhig gis so //
analyzed: kha cig gis zhes bya ba ni slob dpon 'ga' zhig gis so //
translated: Some refers to certain masters.

original: lugs 'ga' zhig don dam par smras pa zhes bya ba la mdo sde pa'i 'dod pa ni gang snang ba de shes pa las tha mi dad pas yin te /
analyzed: lugs 'ga' zhig don dam par smras pa zhes bya ba la mdo sde pa'i 'dod pa ni gang snang ba de shes pa las tha mi dad pas yin te /
translated: Some system refers to the Sautrantika assertion that whatever appears is not different from consciousness.

original: dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na zla ba gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the appearance of two moons.

original: sngon po la sogs pa yang snang ba nyid yin pas des na shes pa la tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yang snang ba nyid yin pas des na shes pa la tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: Since blue and so on are also appearances, they are not different from consciousness.

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba de rnams kyang res 'ga' snang ba res 'ga' mi snang bas res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba de rnams kyang res 'ga' snang ba res 'ga' mi snang bas res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since those appearances of blue and so on sometimes appear and sometimes do not appear, they are intermittent.

original: de rgyu khas blang dgos kyi gzhan du na rgyu med pas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rgyu khas blang dgos kyi gzhan du na rgyu med pas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is necessary to accept that they have a cause. Otherwise, since they would be independent of other things, they would be either permanent or nonexistent.

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rigs pas rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rigs pas rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The reasoning that they would be either permanent or nonexistent means that they would be either permanent or nonexistent.

original: des na sngon po la sogs pa snang ba 'di rnams kyi rgyu gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi don yin pas de yang mi rtag la /
analyzed: des na sngon po la sogs pa snang ba 'di rnams kyi rgyu gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi don yin pas de yang mi rtag la /
translated: Therefore the cause of these appearances of blue and so on is external objects, and they are impermanent.

original: shes pa yang mi rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: shes pa yang mi rtag pa yin la /
translated: Consciousness is also impermanent.

original: de gnyis ka yang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa dang bral ba dang / bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa dang bral ba dang / bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Both of those are free from the creator Īśvara and so on and are free from the self and being mine.

original: de dag mi rtag pa la sogs par yongs su shes pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa las ;
analyzed: de dag mi rtag pa la sogs par yongs su shes pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa las ;
translated: By thoroughly knowing them to be impermanent, etc., one is free from the grasping of “I” and “mine,” etc.

original: bdag dang bdag gi las kun nas bslang ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams med pas rnam par grol ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mdo sde pa rnams kyi lugs don dam par smras pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi las kun nas bslang ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams med pas rnam par grol ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mdo sde pa rnams kyi lugs don dam par smras pa'o //
translated: And because of the absence of the afflictions of desire, etc., which are motivated by “I” and “mine,” one is liberated. This is the Sautrāntika system, which is said to be the ultimate.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni lugs don dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni lugs don dam pa nyid do //
translated: “ That” refers to the ultimate system.

original: kun rdzob tu 'dod do zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rnam gzhag byas pa de kun rdzob nyid du 'dod pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'dod do zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rnam gzhag byas pa de kun rdzob nyid du 'dod pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: “ It is asserted to be conventional” means that the presentation of the ultimate is asserted to be conventional.

original: de yang mi rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is also unreasonable, it is said:

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “That” and so on.

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi don gyi de kho na nyid mngon par mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi don gyi de kho na nyid mngon par mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Not understanding the reality that is the meaning of the treatise of the middle way” means

original: gang dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi don phyin ci ma log pa de ni mi shes pa nyid kyis de ltar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dbu ma'i bstan bcos kyi don phyin ci ma log pa de ni mi shes pa nyid kyis de ltar brjod pa yin te /
translated: Whoever does not understand the meaning of the treatise on the middle, speaks in that way out of ignorance.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi don 'jig rten la grags pa med pa yin no zhes sngar bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi don 'jig rten la grags pa med pa yin no zhes sngar bstan to //
translated: It has been shown previously that such a kind of meaning is not known in the world.

original: yang gzhan dag gi 'dod pa la skyon bstan par bya ba'i yang gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽slob dpon kha @362a * //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag gi 'dod pa la skyon bstan par bya ba'i yang gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / slob dpon kha @362a * //
translated: Now, in order to show the faults in the assertions of others, he says, “Whatever is asserted by some . . . ”

original: cig na re gang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rnam gzhag byas pa dbu ma pa rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi rnam gzhag yin no zhes 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: cig na re gang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rnam gzhag byas pa dbu ma pa rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi rnam gzhag yin no zhes 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Some masters assert that the presentation of the conventional by the Mādhyamikas is the presentation made by the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis don dam par 'dus byas kyi chos dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyang khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis don dam par 'dus byas kyi chos dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyang khas len pa yin no //
translated: Just as the Vaibhāṣikas accept ultimately conditioned phenomena and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de la 'dus ma byas ni nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas ni nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: Among them, the unconditioned are space, analytical cessations, and nonanalytical cessations.

original: de la nam mkha' ni mi sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can no //🔽so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' ni mi sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid can no // so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ni /
translated: Space is the characteristic of non-obstruction.

original: so sor brtags shing dpyad na nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'gog pa gang thob pas so //
analyzed: so sor brtags shing dpyad na nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'gog pa gang thob pas so //
translated: Cessation through deliberation is the cessation of the defilements obtained through deliberation and examination.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ni rgyu ma tshang bas 'gog pa thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ni rgyu ma tshang bas 'gog pa thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Cessation not through deliberation is the cessation obtained through the incompleteness of the causes.

original: dper na gzugs gcig la mig dang yid zhugs pa'i skyes bu la /
analyzed: dper na gzugs gcig la mig dang yid zhugs pa'i skyes bu la /
translated: For example, when a person has directed his eyes and mind to one form,

original: gzugs gzhan la rgyu ma tshang bas mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'gog pa thob pas ;
analyzed: gzugs gzhan la rgyu ma tshang bas mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'gog pa thob pas ;
translated: the cessation of visual consciousness is obtained through the incompleteness of the causes in regard to another form.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, visual consciousness does not arise.

original: 'dus byas ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conditioned is form, sensation, etc.

original: de dag thams cad mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral ba dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang bdag gi ba dang bral ba dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po dang bral ba'o //
translated: All of them are impermanent, devoid of a self and what belongs to a self, and devoid of an almighty creator such as Iśvara.

original: de rnams mi rtag pa la sogs par yongs su shes pa las sngar bzhin du grol bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de rnams mi rtag pa la sogs par yongs su shes pa las sngar bzhin du grol bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: One becomes liberated from them in the same way as before, through thorough knowledge of their impermanence, etc.

original: de la rigs pa ma yin zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir snyam du sems pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la rigs pa ma yin zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir snyam du sems pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show that this is unreasonable, he says, “Even those who think . . .

original: dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni gang de ltar brjod pa de rnams kyis kyang ngo //🔽ma rig pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni gang de ltar brjod pa de rnams kyis kyang ngo // ma rig pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: ” “Even those” refers to those who express themselves in that way.🔽In order to show that this is ignorance, he says,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “How can the supramundane . . .

original: bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pas don dam par brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pas don dam par brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ” “Supramundane dharmas” are those investigated by the Vaibhāṣikas and Sautrāntikas as being ultimate.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos dang chos mtshungs par mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos dang chos mtshungs par mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas grub pa yin gyi /
translated: “It is unreasonable to make them similar to mundane dharmas” means that mundane dharmas are established in accordance with mundane people.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa nyid las grub ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa nyid las grub ba ma yin no //
translated: Impermanence, emptiness, selflessness, and so on are not established from the perspective of the worldly.

original: des ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'jig rten pa dag chos mtshungs par mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'jig rten pa dag chos mtshungs par mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the supramundane and the mundane are not similar.

original: lugs 'di ni thun @362b mong ma yin ba'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam gzhag 'di thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: lugs 'di ni thun @362b mong ma yin ba'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam gzhag 'di thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: This system is unique. This presentation of the conventional and the ultimate is unique.

original: gzhan la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It does not exist in others.

original: de ltar yang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas kun rdzob kyi rnam gzhag byas pa shugs kyis gzhan gyis kun rdzob kyi rnam gzhag byas pa de rigs pa ma yin bar grub pas thub mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas kun rdzob kyi rnam gzhag byas pa shugs kyis gzhan gyis kun rdzob kyi rnam gzhag byas pa de rigs pa ma yin bar grub pas thub mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, following the worldly perspective, the presentation of the conventional is established. By implication, the presentation of the conventional by others is established as illogical. Therefore, it is unique.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni lugs 'di gzhan gyis mi shes shing zhes kho bos khong du chud pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni lugs 'di gzhan gyis mi shes shing zhes kho bos khong du chud pas so //
translated: For that reason, this system is not understood by others. I have understood it.

original: thugs dgongs mi shes shing zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam gzhag go //
analyzed: thugs dgongs mi shes shing zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam gzhag go //
translated: “Not knowing the thought” means the arrangement of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: don gyi de kho na nyid nges par zin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin can gyi don du nges par ma zin par ro //
analyzed: don gyi de kho na nyid nges par zin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin can gyi don du nges par ma zin par ro //
translated: “Not ascertaining the reality of the object” means not ascertaining the reality of the Tathāgatas, etc., which is the nature of the Dharma Body.

original: yi ge tsam nges par 'jigs par 'gyur ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas yongs su brtag pa dang / bden pa bzhi yongs su brtag pa dag las sangs rgyas bkag pa dang ; bden pa bzhi bkag pa'i tshul gyis don nges par byas te 'jig par 'gyur ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yi ge tsam nges par 'jigs par 'gyur ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas yongs su brtag pa dang / bden pa bzhi yongs su brtag pa dag las sangs rgyas bkag pa dang ; bden pa bzhi bkag pa'i tshul gyis don nges par byas te 'jig par 'gyur ba rnams kyis so //
translated: “Those who are frightened by mere words” are those who, in the Buddha’s Examination of the Buddha and the Examination of the Four Noble Truths, ascertain the meaning by way of the refutation of the Buddha and the refutation of the four noble truths, and are frightened by that.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'di zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos 'di zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “This supramundane Dharma”

original: sgrib pa gnyis spong ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis spong ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: is the teaching of reality which is the cause for the abandonment of the two obstructions.

original: bstan bcos kyi don gyi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las gsungs pa de phyin ci ma log pa yin gyi phyin ci log ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don gyi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las gsungs pa de phyin ci ma log pa yin gyi phyin ci log ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched du'o //
translated: In order to teach the reality of the treatise without error. This is for the purpose of teaching that what is stated in the treatise is non-erroneous, not erroneous.

original: de nyid kyi bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: klu sgrub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: klu sgrub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he states, “Nāgārjuna,” and so on.

original: de la klu dang srid sgrub dag dang mtshungs pa'i phyir klu sgrub ste /
analyzed: de la klu dang srid sgrub dag dang mtshungs pa'i phyir klu sgrub ste /
translated: Therein, because he is similar to a nāga and an ascetic, he is Nāgārjuna.

original: ji ltar klu rnams mtsho'i mtha' dor nas dkyil du gnas pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yod pa dang med pa la gnas pa'i mtha' spangs nas /
analyzed: ji ltar klu rnams mtsho'i mtha' dor nas dkyil du gnas pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yod pa dang med pa la gnas pa'i mtha' spangs nas /
translated: Just as nāgas live in the middle of the ocean, having abandoned the edge, in the same way, here, having abandoned the edge of existence and nonexistence,🔽he is an ascetic.

original: dbu ma'i lam la gnas pa dang / ji ltar srid sgrub kyis mnga'i tshogs kyis gzhan gyi dpung tshogs bcom pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mda'i tshogs kyis srid pa'i dgra bcom pas srid sgrub dang klu dag mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam la gnas pa dang / ji ltar srid sgrub kyis mnga'i tshogs kyis gzhan gyi dpung tshogs bcom pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mda'i tshogs kyis srid pa'i dgra bcom pas srid sgrub dang klu dag mtshungs pa'o //
translated: He abides in the middle way, and just as Arjuna destroyed the army of his enemies with his own army, so here also, since the enemy of existence is destroyed by the army of arrows of nondual intuition, Arjuna and the naga are similar.

original: blo mtsho zhes bya ba ni blo nyid mtsho yin te /
analyzed: blo mtsho zhes bya ba ni blo nyid mtsho yin te /
translated: The “ocean of mind” is the mind itself which is an ocean,

original: zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is deep.

original: shin tu rgya che zhes bya ba ni mtha' rtogs par dka' bas so //🔽kha dog gis 'jigs pas zhes bya ba ni mtsho'i dbang du byas na sngo ba @363a * //
analyzed: shin tu rgya che zhes bya ba ni mtha' rtogs par dka' bas so // kha dog gis 'jigs pas zhes bya ba ni mtsho'i dbang du byas na sngo ba @363a * //
translated: “Extremely vast” means that its limits are difficult to fathom.

original: la sogs pa'i kha dog gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i kha dog gi sgo nas so //
translated: “Frightened by its color” means that, in the case of the ocean, it is frightened by its blue color, etc.

original: blo'i dbang du byas na blos kun nas bslangs pa'i sgra rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du khang du ma chud pas 'jigs pas so //
analyzed: blo'i dbang du byas na blos kun nas bslangs pa'i sgra rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du khang du ma chud pas 'jigs pas so //
translated: In the case of the mind, it is frightened by the fact that the words which are motivated by the mind do not convey the meaning exactly as it is.

original: lugs bzang zhes bya ba ni klu sgrub zhabs kyis bzhed pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: lugs bzang zhes bya ba ni klu sgrub zhabs kyis bzhed pa dam pa'o //
translated: “Good system” is the holy doctrine of the venerable Nagarjuna.

original: rgyang ring sa spangs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don ma dpyad pa ste /
analyzed: rgyang ring sa spangs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don ma dpyad pa ste /
translated: The phrase “abandoning the distant” means not investigating the meaning of the treatise.

original: bstan bcos la ma zhugs pas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos la ma zhugs pas so zhes pa'o //
translated: That is, one does not engage the treatise.

original: ji ltar thag ring po nas mtsho'i kha dog shin tu 'jigs par byed pa mthong nas yongs su 'dor ba de bzhin du slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyi bstan bcos kyi sgra thos pa tsam gyis gzhan gyis yongs su spong ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thag ring po nas mtsho'i kha dog shin tu 'jigs par byed pa mthong nas yongs su 'dor ba de bzhin du slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyi bstan bcos kyi sgra thos pa tsam gyis gzhan gyis yongs su spong ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as one sees the color of a lake from a distance and, if it is very frightening, one abandons it, so too, others abandon the treatise of the master Nāgārjuna merely by hearing the sound of its name.

original: de'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i kham 'bus ku mu ta kha phye ba'i chus zhes bya ba ni klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa nyid kham 'bus pa'i ku mu ta yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i kham 'bus ku mu ta kha phye ba'i chus zhes bya ba ni klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa nyid kham 'bus pa'i ku mu ta yin te /
translated: The phrase “the water of the opened kumuta lotus of his verses” means that the verses composed by the master Nāgārjuna are like a kumuta lotus that has opened.

original: gzhan rnams kyis de'i don gsal bar ma byas pas so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis de'i don gsal bar ma byas pas so //
translated: This is because others have not clarified its meaning.

original: de'i kha bye ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don gsal bar byas pas so //
analyzed: de'i kha bye ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don gsal bar byas pas so //
translated: Its opening is the clarification of the meaning of the verses.

original: de nyid chu ste de'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de nyid chu ste de'i sgo nas so //
translated: That itself is water, and it is through that.

original: da lta zla ba grags pa phyogs rnams rab tu 'gengs par byed //
analyzed: da lta zla ba grags pa phyogs rnams rab tu 'gengs par byed //
translated: Now Candrakirti fills all quarters with his fame.

original: ces bya ba ni slob dpon zla ba grags pas phyogs thams cad gang bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni slob dpon zla ba grags pas phyogs thams cad gang bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: This is Candrakirti, the master, filling all quarters with his fame.

original: 'di'i don ni ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis mtsho'i kha dog gis 'jigs pas mtsho dor la phyis 'ga' zhig 'ongs nas mtsho de nyid kyi gting du 'dzul ba dang steng du byung ba dag byas nas de las bcus pa'i chus yul yongs su gang bar byas pa de
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis mtsho'i kha dog gis 'jigs pas mtsho dor la phyis 'ga' zhig 'ongs nas mtsho de nyid kyi gting du 'dzul ba dang steng du byung ba dag byas nas de las bcus pa'i chus yul yongs su gang bar byas pa de
