translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as someone, fearing the color of the water, avoids the lake, and later, when someone else comes along, having plunged into the very depths of the lake and having come up on top, fills the land with water drawn from it,

original: bzhin du slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyi bstan bcos kyi sgra'i 'jigs pas gzhan gyis dor ba de kho bos tshig le'ur byas pa'i don gsal bar byas pa'i chus phyogs rnams yongs su gang bang byas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin du slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyi bstan bcos kyi sgra'i 'jigs pas gzhan gyis dor ba de kho bos tshig le'ur byas pa'i don gsal bar byas pa'i chus phyogs rnams yongs su gang bang byas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: so, having plunged into the very depths of the treatises of the master Nagarjuna, which others have avoided, fearing the sound of the words, I have filled all quarters with the water of the elucidation of the meaning of the Caraka.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don khong du chud pa de thun mong ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don khong du chud pa de thun mong ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the understanding of the meaning of the Caraka is not common to all, he says:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If one says thus, etc.

original: de skad du smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de rnams kyis kyang yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de rnams kyis kyang yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase they also abandon it means that they also abandon that.

original: spangs par khong du chud pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spangs par khong du chud pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason for understanding abandonment,

original: bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, It should be explained, etc.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The phrase that very thing refers to the characteristic of emptiness.

original: zab mo zhes bya ba ni don rtogs dka' bas so //
analyzed: zab mo zhes bya ba ni don rtogs dka' bas so //
translated: The phrase profound thing means that its meaning is difficult to understand.

original: 'jigs rung zhes bya ba ni sgra @363b tsam thos pas so //
analyzed: 'jigs rung zhes bya ba ni sgra @363b tsam thos pas so //
translated: The phrase frightening thing means that it is frightening just to hear the sound of it.

original: sngon goms pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma la de kho na nyid la thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa byas pas so //
analyzed: sngon goms pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma la de kho na nyid la thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa byas pas so //
translated: The phrase due to previous habituation means that in a former life one has studied and contemplated reality, etc.

original: nges par rtogs 'gyur 'di ni zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rtogs 'gyur 'di ni zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The phrase one will certainly understand it means that one will understand it without doubt.

original: gsan rgya che yang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas thos pa'i mtshan nyid can rgya che yang ngo //
analyzed: gsan rgya che yang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas thos pa'i mtshan nyid can rgya che yang ngo //
translated: Even though one has heard much refers to the extensive hearing which is characterized by reliance upon a spiritual teacher.

original: gzhan gyis zhes pa ni sngon goms par ma byas pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes pa ni sngon goms par ma byas pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Others refers to those who have not previously cultivated themselves.

original: thugs su chud mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thugs su chud mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will not understand refers to the fact that they will not realize reality.

original: de'i phyir tshul lugs zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul lugs zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Therefore, system refers to the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: rang blos sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas rang rang gi blos btags pa'o //
analyzed: rang blos sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas rang rang gi blos btags pa'o //
translated: The own thought refers to the imputations of the individual minds of Vasubandhu and so on.

original: de dag mthong nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi tshul lugs mthong nas so //🔽bdag tu brjod gzhung lugs rnams ltar //
analyzed: de dag mthong nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi tshul lugs mthong nas so // bdag tu brjod gzhung lugs rnams ltar //
translated: Having seen those, refers to having seen the systems of others.

original: zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi bdag la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi bdag la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: Like the treatises that speak of self, refers to the treatises of the tīrthikas that elucidate the self and so on.

original: gzhan lugs zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan lugs zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: The “other system” is the assertion of the master Vasubandhu and so on.

original: bzhed gzhung 'di las zhes bya ba ni slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis bzhed pa las so //
analyzed: bzhed gzhung 'di las zhes bya ba ni slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis bzhed pa las so //
translated: “ In this scripture” means in the assertions of the master Nāgārjuna.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas mthong ba las so //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas mthong ba las so //
translated: “ In another” means in the vision of the master Vasubandhu and so on.

original: dga' blo dor ba zhes bya ba ni de rnams la blo brtan par mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dga' blo dor ba zhes bya ba ni de rnams la blo brtan par mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “ Abandoning the mind of delight” means one should not stabilize the mind on those.

original: 'dir ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi bzhed pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi bzhed pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: Here, the assertion of the master Nāgārjuna is abandoned.

original: sngon de kho na nyid ma goms par rgyu mtshan du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon de kho na nyid ma goms par rgyu mtshan du bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught as a reason that previously one was not familiar with reality.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Just as . . .” and so on.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs shing zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa gong mas bsdus pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lam med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs shing zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa gong mas bsdus pa'i 'jig rten pa'i lam med pa'o //
translated: Abandoning the afflictions of the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm means that there is no mundane path subsumed by the higher realms that serves as an antidote to the afflictions of the summit of existence.

original: de rnams kyi srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa ma spangs kyang zhing chag mo gang ma brdas pas brdas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis nyon mongs pa spangs shing zhes brjod par 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa ma spangs kyang zhing chag mo gang ma brdas pas brdas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis nyon mongs pa spangs shing zhes brjod par 'os pa yin no //
translated: Even though they do not abandon the afflictions of the summit of existence, it is appropriate to say that they abandon the afflictions in the manner of a person who has not yet struck a bell but has struck the stand on which the bell rests.

original: grub pa'i mtha' gzhan nye bar sbyor nus par mthong du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni grangs can la sogs pa'i grub mtha' gzhan sbyor nus kyang ngo //🔽de @364a * //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gzhan nye bar sbyor nus par mthong du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni grangs can la sogs pa'i grub mtha' gzhan sbyor nus kyang ngo // de @364a * //
translated: Even though one sees that one is able to apply other tenets means even though one is able to apply the tenets of the Sāṃkhya and so on.

original: bzhin du de dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: bzhin du de dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas kyang ngo //
translated: In the same way, they also means the master Vasubandhu and so on.

original: mang du gsan pa rnam pa de lta bu mdor zin kyang zhes bya ba ni sgra dang / tshad ma dang mngon pa la sogs pa du ma gsan du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: mang du gsan pa rnam pa de lta bu mdor zin kyang zhes bya ba ni sgra dang / tshad ma dang mngon pa la sogs pa du ma gsan du zin kyang ngo //
translated: The phrase even though he has heard much refers to his having heard many teachings on grammar, logic, Abhidharma, and so on.

original: deng sang nyid na yang zhes bya ba ni da ltar yang ngo //
analyzed: deng sang nyid na yang zhes bya ba ni da ltar yang ngo //
translated: The phrase even in his own day means even now.

original: rgyu'i stobs kho na las zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la lhag par mos pa'i bag chags kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs kho na las zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la lhag par mos pa'i bag chags kyis so //
translated: The phrase solely through the power of the cause means solely through the instinct for the special insight into emptiness.

original: 'di bden par mthong ba rnam par nyams pa rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di bden par mthong ba rnam par nyams pa rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas kyang ngo //
translated: The phrase even those who have lost sight of the truth refers to such masters as Vasubandhu.

original: mang du gsan na rnam pa de lta bu mu stegs pa'i gzhung lugs 'di bden pa yin no zhes mthong ba spangs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste stong pa nyid la lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: mang du gsan na rnam pa de lta bu mu stegs pa'i gzhung lugs 'di bden pa yin no zhes mthong ba spangs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste stong pa nyid la lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: The phrase who have heard much refers to those who have heard much about the non-Buddhist scriptures. The phrase who have abandoned the view that this is true means that they have abandoned the view that the non-Buddhist scriptures are true. The phrase who have special insight into emptiness means that they have special insight into emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi gting dpog par mthong zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yang dag par khong du chud pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi gting dpog par mthong zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid yang dag par khong du chud pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase one sees the depth of emptiness means that one comprehends emptiness correctly.

original: gzhan pa'i gzhung lugs zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i gzhung lugs zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen la sogs pas mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase other scriptural systems refers to those composed by Vasubandhu and others.

original: bdag gsal bar byed pa'i gzhung lugs zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa'i bstan bcos las bya ba ltar ro //
analyzed: bdag gsal bar byed pa'i gzhung lugs zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa'i bstan bcos las bya ba ltar ro //
translated: The phrase scriptural systems that clarify the self refers to the treatises of the non-Buddhists.

original: dga' ba'i blo gros dor bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'di kho na nyid yin no snyam du nges par ma byed ces pa'o ;
analyzed: dga' ba'i blo gros dor bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'di kho na nyid yin no snyam du nges par ma byed ces pa'o ;
translated: The phrase you should abandon the delight of your mind means that you should not form the conviction that this is the way things really are.

original: / stong pa nyid kyi lta ba la lhag par mos pa kho na la ya mtshan par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la lhag par mos pa kho na la sems brtan por gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: / stong pa nyid kyi lta ba la lhag par mos pa kho na la ya mtshan par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la lhag par mos pa kho na la sems brtan por gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should realize the wonder of the view of emptiness means that you should fix your mind on the view of emptiness.

original: bsod nams yongs su bsngo bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod nams yongs su bsngo bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the dedication of merit, he says:

original: slob dpon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The master, etc.

original: lugs bzang bsnyad la zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bzhed pa bstan pa las bdag gis bsod nams gang thob pa de 'jig rten bde bar gshegs pa'i sa kun du 'od ces bya bar bgrod par shog ces bya bar sbyar ro
analyzed: lugs bzang bsnyad la zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bzhed pa bstan pa las bdag gis bsod nams gang thob pa de 'jig rten bde bar gshegs pa'i sa kun du 'od ces bya bar bgrod par shog ces bya bar sbyar ro
translated: The line in the good system of teaching refers to the merit that I have obtained from teaching the characteristics of the conventional and the ultimate. The line may I proceed to the stage of the Sugata's universal light is supplied.

original: // phyogs kyi mthar khyab cing zhes bya ba ni bsod nams de phyogs thams cad la khyab pa ste mtha' yas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: // phyogs kyi mthar khyab cing zhes bya ba ni bsod nams de phyogs thams cad la khyab pa ste mtha' yas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The line pervading the ends of the directions means that this merit pervades all directions, that is, is infinite.

original: yid mkha' zhes bya ba ni yid kho na nam mkha' yin pas na yid mkha' ste /
analyzed: yid mkha' zhes bya ba ni yid kho na nam mkha' yin pas na yid mkha' ste /
translated: The line the space of the mind means that the mind itself is space, and so is called the space of the mind.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can yin pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can yin pas so //
translated: It is of the nature of emptiness.

original: yid kyi mkha' ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi mkha' ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the space of the mind like?

original: nyon mongs kyis sngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs kyis sngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The line stained by the afflictions is stated.

original: glo bur ba'i nyon mongs pas dri ma can @364b du byas pas so //
analyzed: glo bur ba'i nyon mongs pas dri ma can @364b du byas pas so //
translated: It is made dirty by the adventitious afflictions.

original: bsod nams ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the merit like?

original: ston ka'i rgyu skar ltar dkar ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ston ka'i rgyu skar ltar dkar ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The line white like the autumn stars is stated.

original: ston ka'i sprin dang bral bas skar ma rnams ji ltar dkar ba de bzhin du bsod nams 'di yang mi dge ba'i dri ma dang bral bas dkar ba'o //
analyzed: ston ka'i sprin dang bral bas skar ma rnams ji ltar dkar ba de bzhin du bsod nams 'di yang mi dge ba'i dri ma dang bral bas dkar ba'o //
translated: Just as the stars are bright when the autumn sky is free of clouds, so this merit is bright because it is free of the stains of non-virtue.

original: bsam pa'i mtshan la nyin gyi nor bu dang 'dra zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam pa'i mtshan la nyin gyi nor bu dang 'dra zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sign of intention is like a daytime jewel.

original: bsam pa ni yod pa dang / med par rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni yod pa dang / med par rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Intention is the discrimination of existence and non-existence.

original: de nyid mtshan mo ste /
analyzed: de nyid mtshan mo ste /
translated: That itself is night,

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid yongs su mi shes pas so //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid yongs su mi shes pas so //
translated: because the reality of things is not fully understood.

original: de spang ba'i don du nyin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de spang ba'i don du nyin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: For the sake of abandoning that, it is like a daytime jewel.

original: nyi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the sun.

original: bsod nams 'dir rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: bsod nams 'dir rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas so //
translated: This merit is free from conceptualization.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: skye ba 'di nyid la de nyid //
analyzed: skye ba 'di nyid la de nyid //
translated: In this very life, that itself...

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: zab pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ston pas so //
analyzed: zab pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ston pas so //
translated: Profound means teaching emptiness.

original: rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa lnga ston pas so //
analyzed: rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa lnga ston pas so //
translated: Extensive means teaching the five perfections such as generosity.

original: theg pa mchog la thugs gzhol ba //
analyzed: theg pa mchog la thugs gzhol ba //
translated: The mind is directed to the supreme vehicle.

original: zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la thugs shin tu dang ba mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la thugs shin tu dang ba mnga' ba'o //
translated: This is the great love for the Great Vehicle.

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i mkhyen rab dang thugs rje mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thugs rje dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i mkhyen rab dang thugs rje mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang thugs rje dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'o //
translated: He has the knowledge and compassion that cannot be taken away, that is, his wisdom and compassion cannot be overwhelmed by adverse factors.

original: ri mor bris pa'i ba drus las 'o ma bzhos pas bden par zhen pa bzlog par mdzad pas zhes bya ba ni ri mor bris pa'i ba las 'o ma bzhos pas gzhan gyi dngos por mngon par zhen pa zlog par mdzad pa des mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ri mor bris pa'i ba drus las 'o ma bzhos pas bden par zhen pa bzlog par mdzad pas zhes bya ba ni ri mor bris pa'i ba las 'o ma bzhos pas gzhan gyi dngos por mngon par zhen pa zlog par mdzad pa des mdzad pa'o //
translated: He has stopped clinging to true existence by milking a picture of a cow, that is, he has stopped clinging to the true existence of other things by milking a picture of a cow.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel bshad sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs kyi 'grel ba'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel bshad sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs kyi 'grel ba'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary to the chapter on the Buddha’s stage, the commentary to the ninth chapter of the Madhyamakavatara.

original: // / mnga' ris yul 'khrungs skye bo yon tan ldan pas kun la rab grags thugs rjer ldan //
analyzed: // / mnga' ris yul 'khrungs skye bo yon tan ldan pas kun la rab grags thugs rjer ldan //
translated: The one born in the land of Ngari, renowned to all as a man of virtue, endowed with compassion,

original: nor gyi tshogs kyis phongs pa mtha' dag khyab mdzad tshul khrims ma nyams mod mi dma' //
analyzed: nor gyi tshogs kyis phongs pa mtha' dag khyab mdzad tshul khrims ma nyams mod mi dma' //
translated: pervading all who are destitute of wealth, with ethics unimpaired, with no pride.

original: nam yang gang gi thugs la skad cig tsam yang khro ba skyes par ma gyur pa //
analyzed: nam yang gang gi thugs la skad cig tsam yang khro ba skyes par ma gyur pa //
translated: Never for an instant did he become angry with anyone.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni mtha' yas skyon yang yon tan tshogs dag 'joms shing 'phel mdzad la //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni mtha' yas skyon yang yon tan tshogs dag 'joms shing 'phel mdzad la //
translated: By his diligence, he destroyed the infinite faults and increased the mass of virtues.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba du mas gang gis sems ni ting nge 'dzin las mi 'phrogs shing //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba du mas gang gis sems ni ting nge 'dzin las mi 'phrogs shing //
translated: By his concentration, his mind was not distracted from meditative absorption by many distractions.

original: shes rab phun tshogs chu yis dri ma mtha' dag 'khru ba'i nus mnga' ba ;
analyzed: shes rab phun tshogs chu yis dri ma mtha' dag 'khru ba'i nus mnga' ba ;
translated: By his wisdom, he had the power to wash away all stains with the water of perfection.

original: / thabs kyis srid pa'i chu bor byed pa'i sems can mtha' yas chos kyi phyag gis 'dren mdzad cing //
analyzed: / thabs kyis srid pa'i chu bor byed pa'i sems can mtha' yas chos kyi phyag gis 'dren mdzad cing //
translated: By his skillful means, he rescued with the hook of the Dharma the infinite beings who were drowning in the river of existence.

original: skye ba du mar sbyangs pas gang gi smon lam shin tu mtha' ru son gyur pa //
analyzed: skye ba du mar sbyangs pas gang gi smon lam shin tu mtha' ru son gyur pa //
translated: By his vows, he reached the ultimate goal of his aspirations, which he had cultivated in many lives.

original: sbyin la sogs pa'i sbyor la goms pas gang gi stobs rnams kyang ni 'phel 'gyur la //
analyzed: sbyin la sogs pa'i sbyor la goms pas gang gi stobs rnams kyang ni 'phel 'gyur la //
translated: By his power, his strengths increased through his practice of generosity and so forth.

original: thugs kyi bstan bcos du ma rnam spyod @365a * //
analyzed: thugs kyi bstan bcos du ma rnam spyod @365a * //
translated: By his knowledge, he mastered many treatises on the mind.

original: mkhas shing chos kyi phung po ston mdzad pa //
analyzed: mkhas shing chos kyi phung po ston mdzad pa //
translated: By his teaching, he revealed the aggregates of the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan ting 'dzin bzlas brjod mngon brtson skye ba'i tshogs kyis rgyun du bskor //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan ting 'dzin bzlas brjod mngon brtson skye ba'i tshogs kyis rgyun du bskor //
translated: He was surrounded by an assembly of those who were endowed with moral discipline, who were absorbed in meditation, who were devoted to the recitation of mantras, and who were diligent.

original: me nyag yul gyi mnga' bdag chos rjes bla mar bkur zhing spyi bos phyag mdzad pa //
analyzed: me nyag yul gyi mnga' bdag chos rjes bla mar bkur zhing spyi bos phyag mdzad pa //
translated: He was honored as a guru and bowed to with the head by the lord of the Menyak region, the Dharma lord.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi don du sangs rgyas 'bum gyis brgyan pa'i gtsug lag khang chen mdzad //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi don du sangs rgyas 'bum gyis brgyan pa'i gtsug lag khang chen mdzad //
translated: For the sake of beings, he built a great temple adorned with a hundred thousand buddhas.

original: gang gis de las gzhan pa'i gnas rnams su yang rgya chen gtsug lag khang mdzad la //
analyzed: gang gis de las gzhan pa'i gnas rnams su yang rgya chen gtsug lag khang mdzad la //
translated: He also built extensive temples in other places.

original: thugs rje phul du byung bas sems can sdug bsngal dra bas sdug bsngal gang gyur pa //
analyzed: thugs rje phul du byung bas sems can sdug bsngal dra bas sdug bsngal gang gyur pa //
translated: By his abundant compassion, he saw that beings were suffering in the net of suffering.

original: 'gro bas mthong ngam thos pas rangs pa skyed mdzad dge slong gsung bcad yongs kyi bshes //
analyzed: 'gro bas mthong ngam thos pas rangs pa skyed mdzad dge slong gsung bcad yongs kyi bshes //
translated: He was a monk who delighted beings by his sight and by his speech.

original: de yis gsol ba btab nas kha che yi //
analyzed: de yis gsol ba btab nas kha che yi //
translated: Having made a request to him, the one from Kashmir

original: yul nas 'ongs pa'i mkhas la rgyal ba kun //
analyzed: yul nas 'ongs pa'i mkhas la rgyal ba kun //
translated: who was renowned as the victor over all

original: dga' zhes bya bar grags pas dbu ma la //
analyzed: dga' zhes bya bar grags pas dbu ma la //
translated: in the Madhyamaka known as “the joyous one,”

original: 'jug pa 'di 'grel bshad pa'i don gsal byas //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'di 'grel bshad pa'i don gsal byas //
translated: explained the meaning of this commentary on the Madhyamakāvatāra.

original: bdag gis 'grel bshad 'di byas las //
analyzed: bdag gis 'grel bshad 'di byas las //
translated: May the world attain the state of the Middle Way

original: bsod nams kun da zla 'dra la //🔽gang thob de yis 'jig rten kun //
analyzed: bsod nams kun da zla 'dra la // gang thob de yis 'jig rten kun //
translated: Through the merit I have gained by explaining this.🔽May the world attain the state of the Middle Way

original: dbu ma'i gnas thob rgyal gyur cig / dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: dbu ma'i gnas thob rgyal gyur cig / dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel pa'i bshad pa /
translated: Through the merit I have gained by explaining this.🔽The commentary on the Madhyamakavatara called “Illuminating the Meaning”

original: don gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba kha che'i pandi ta chen po dza ya a'a nan das mdzad pa rdzogs so /🔽// / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa lha yi yul dang mtshungs //
analyzed: don gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba kha che'i pandi ta chen po dza ya a'a nan das mdzad pa rdzogs so / // / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa lha yi yul dang mtshungs //
translated: composed by the great Kashmiri pandita Jayananda is complete.🔽The land of Minyag, where the Dharma king’s lineage

original: chos rgyal gdung mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i me nyag yul //
analyzed: chos rgyal gdung mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i me nyag yul //
translated: is unbroken, is like the celestial realm in its wealth.

original: chu bo rma yi dogs dang ri bo rtse lnga'i 'dabs //
analyzed: chu bo rma yi dogs dang ri bo rtse lnga'i 'dabs //
translated: On the banks of the Ma River and at the foot of Mount Wutai,

original: rgyal po'i pho brang dpung gi tshogs bcas gnas pa yi //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang dpung gi tshogs bcas gnas pa yi //
translated: the king’s palace and his army are situated.

original: khyad par mkhar sku zhes bya'i gtsug lag khang chen du ;
analyzed: khyad par mkhar sku zhes bya'i gtsug lag khang chen du ;
translated: In particular, in the great temple called Kharku,🔽the great Kashmiri scholar and the Tibetan translator

original: / kha che'i mkhas pa chen po rtsom mdzad de nyid dang // bod kyi lo ts'a bande kun dga' grags zhes pas //
analyzed: / kha che'i mkhas pa chen po rtsom mdzad de nyid dang // bod kyi lo ts'a bande kun dga' grags zhes pas //
translated: called Kunga Drak

original: dbu ma la 'jug 'grel bshad don gsal zhes bya ba sgyur //🔽'di bsgyur ba las dge ba gang //
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug 'grel bshad don gsal zhes bya ba sgyur // 'di bsgyur ba las dge ba gang //
translated: The commentary on the Madhyamakavatara called Pradarshana-mulamadhyamaka-vritti-prasannapada-nama🔽Whatever virtue I have gained🔽By translating this

original: thob des 'gro ba ma lus pa //
analyzed: thob des 'gro ba ma lus pa //
